product_title: Result Mens Softshell Bodywarmer Breathable Jacket

reviews.review_body: This vest fits perfectly and performs as I had hoped. The items seems to be well-made.  My only issue is that the zipper clasp is on the opposite side (women's side) as this is a European product. I may have opted for something else had I known that. This is the only reason for a lower rating.

Never got to actually use this jacket, since I ordered a size M (which it recommends for a 41" chest - which is exactly my measurement) and it was way too big. Fits like a size L.

The price is right, and I like the features of the jacket - arm holes and waist cinch down with shockcord, nice pockets, layered softshell material is waterproof and windproof, looks pretty good.

So I'm disappointed, out a total of $15 for shipping costs and nothing to show for it. The only thing that says about the jacket is that the sizes run big, so order a size down if you want it to fit nicely.

product_title: DEFCON 5 Tactical Softshell Jacket with Detachable Hood OD Green Black Coyote Brown D5 3430 OD B CB

reviews.review_body:
DEFCON 5 designs in Italy, outsourced to China. The soft shell was conventional layout, not unlike TAD, Helikon, etc. The fabrics feels a micro denser than Helikon, and has better Velcro closures… Another nice touch is the removeable hood… You can either roll it into the collar compartment, or unzip it and completely remove it, which is a handy feature… (I keep the hood stashed in the rear duck pocket of the jacket…)

The only thing I find odd are the internal pockets, which have zips that face sideways, limiting the use range of the pockets. They’re large enough to fit a few credit cards/ID cards, but not much else, which limits their utility…

Cheaply made jacket. Zipper gets stuck and just isn't made good. I do not recommend this. It gets a 3 seat rating because I got it for $8....otherwise 0 starts at full price.

I was looking for a good shell jacket to wear over top of my wool hoodie.  This definitely fits the bill from the long length and long sleeves it's everything I need.  The only reason for 4 instead of 5 stars is the inside media pocket is shallow and there is no stitching around it keeping anything from falling down inside the layers of the jacket.

I am flabbergasted at this jacket.  Seriously less than $10.  I actually had to go back and make sure that was the price.  It has triple closing (Zip from the inside, outside and velcro) The hood is well hidden in the collar. There are a couple of zippered pockets and a cord running through the middle to cinch it up to fit tighter around the midriff.  I don't know if it will be waterproof in a torrential downpour, but I don't intend to get out in that heavy of a rain, but I am sure it will repel the rain.  I am super surprised!

I bought this as my subzero Fahrenheit skiing outer layer over a down jacket. I have yet to use it, buying it off season. I like the design and it has enough pockets. My only complaint is that there's no interior pocket, only a zipper that gives you access to a pouch on the inside which seems unfinished. It's nice and light, unlike a heavier shell I have. I'll update this after I use it next winter.

I purchased this Jacket to use when riding my motorcycle.  It is water proof thus keeps me dry and warm. Would recommend this jacket whether you ride a motorcycle or not.  Does fit a little large but works great if you were to want to wear a sweater or sweatshirt under this jacket.  Great buy.

It’s just the shell jacket, no lining, which I expected since it’s the description. A fleece layer under it works well. My husband wore it in the snow and it kept him warm and dry with the fleece layer underneath. It was a good buy for the price.

For the money, this jacket is badass!!  People are crazy for spending big money on name brand snowboard jackets.

  I'm 6'2" 220 and the XL is real big. Sending back for the L.
Good quality jacket for below $20, but runs larger than expected. Unfortunately the size down is nearly 3x the price and no longer meets our preferred budget.

This is a good Jacket for rain, and snow as long as you have a liner in it.
I put a liner in mine and the Jacket is very warm. It has already been through a rain shower and I did not get wet. Make sure you put silicone lube or some other type of lube on the zippers and they'll work Great. I have heard of people who use soap as a lube. Just be Careful so you don't stain your Jacket.
So far I am pleased with the order. I would have given it 5 stars if I didn't have to live the zippers before I could use the Jacket. These are very well made and should last a long time as long as I keep the zippers lubed. Other people have complained about the zippers they work Great as long as you keep them from sticking. Very easy cheap fix for a great Jacket ??
Great deal on a good quality garment!
Great, high quality jacket.  Runs big.

reviews.review_body: great
Perfect just what I needed. The coat fit great and with the storm flaps over the zipper it was perfect.

Unless you hunt in an enclosed area DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY! The "waterproof" claim is fraudulent.  After 20 minutes hunting in the rain the arms and shoulders began to seep through.  You get what you pay for but it certainly is NOT waterproof.  0 out of 5 stars if I could it one.

Nice value for the money....for an inexpensive jacket it performs better than expected and the quality compares to coats three times the price. It is not made for subzero on its own but with layering it handles the cold very well. It's fairly light in weight too ...a definite plus!

I'm very pleased so far, and glad I added it to my hunting closet. The blaze is very visible but deer didn't seem to even notice it while I was in my stand.

This is not an arctic expedition coat, but I'm not hunting muskox so it suits my needs nicely!

product_title: Cresta Outdoor Men s Triclimate 3 in 1 Softshell Jacket

reviews.review_body: I'm 6'1" 200 lbs and bought the XL.  It fit length and arm wise, but was snug...my guess because of the liner.  Still comfortable.  However, and this is speculation here; because this coat appeared to be shipped from Turkey, and because I've spent time there and know everyone smokes, this coat reeked of cigarette smoke.  As soon as I opened the package, the smell hit me like a punch in the face.  I washed it immediately and the smell is gone.  Just not what I expected considering how warm and well constructed this coat is.  Still recommend buying one, but maybe from a vendor closer to home that doesn't smoke around their products.

This thing is awesome. It runs just a tad large, which is perfect for layering underneath. So far it seems to be legitimately waterproof as I got caught in a thunderstorm and didn't get wet at all except around the cuffs. Plenty warm with layers underneath, can't recommend this coat enough.
Did not expect too much from this due to the cost but it worked very well and kept me warm and dry while hunting above the snow line in the cascades.

I live in the Upper Peninsula of Michigan and this is extreme country. People up here are tough and we expect our gear to be tough. This parka is very well made---true to size, strong quiet material, strong stitching, very warm yet lightweight, pockets are placed well and sized to satisfy, cuffs & collar keep out the cold drafts beautifully, hood is generous, length provides perfect coverage. Bottom line this is one great value!
Kept me warm in the deer stand when it was windy and cold.  Great price and quality for something I will only wear a couple of weekends a year.

product_title: Ash City Core 365 Men s Tall Brisk Insulated Jacket 2XT CLASSIC NAVY

reviews.review_body: My husband LOVES this jacket.  It fits great; the fabric is lightweight and comfortable; the jacket washes well; he stays warm, but not too hot.  This was a terrific choice!

product_title: Port Authority Men s Glacier Soft Shell Jacket XXL Atlantic Blue Chrome

reviews.review_body: This jacket seems like a great value for the money.  It is a nice weight for cool weather.  At 40 degrees F I need a little heavier coat, but otherwise great.  I am 6'3" tall, and the sleeves fit perfectly right down to the wrist on the XXL jacket.  The sleeves are not adjustable at the wrist, but seem well fit as they are at wrist.  One thing I like about the fit of this coat is that it does not have too much fabric in front.  Even though it does not have an adjustable waistband, the jacket is well enough fitted that it does not have to be partially zipped to stay close to my body.  The color seems a little bit more blue in person than it looks on the screen.  I have received several compliments on the color.  The pocket on the chest is also nice.  It holds my iPhone in an Otterbox Defender case perfectly, which makes my phone more accessible when I am doing things.

product_title: Mountain Warehouse Firth Mens Softshell Jacket Water Resistant

reviews.review_body: The open texture of the fabric has a heather look, IMHO can be both more formal and more casual than the usual fleece jacket. As expected, DWR not quite as good as on a tighter weave -- but works OK sprinkling it from a faucet. Ordered a size small, at a middle-aged 5' 8", 160 lbs. Shoulder and sleeves have generous room, tummy not so much but still OK. The inside fleece is dense, but pretty thin. Jacket seems warm enough for 40-50s but not super warm. But... the zipper is left-handed (same as US women's side) so unfortunately going to send it back. Had a Helly Hansen (men's) jacket with a wrong side zipper, and every time I pulled the zipper down with my right hand it would and not separate. YMMV, but too annoying for me.

Great insulated coat. Warm, quiet, adequate pockets. I bought a size too large because it was the only size left in the color I wanted, but no regrets. It is indeed waterproof. I hunted all day in a constant down poor and stayed dry (except my feet). I just wish my boots were as water proof as this coat.

I think this would of been a ok coat for my husband. but the one i received had a broken zipper. and looking at how it was made not sure it would of held up over the years. i cannot say how it would of held up in the rain. (My husband was glad to receive this coat)I have a different one on the way.

Bought these last year late summer. Was surprised at the quality when they arrived considering how well made they are. I'm a firm believer in camo that matches your environment and when you are 20' up in a stand the sky is your background. To make a long story short, on Oct. 16th a 15 point 5-1/2 year old whitetail buck walked toward me on an old logging road and stopped 10 yards from my tree. He then turned sideways and the rest is history. 3rd biggest buck in the state taken with a crossbow, in cheap but effective camo. Ok now the secret is out, this is good stuff. I also bought the matching rain gear, but never got a chance to try it.

The hood is nice and big - it comfortably fits around my helmet. The snow skirt and wrist gaiters keep snow and cold out, and the back of the jacket is long enough to keep my butt warm on the chairlift.

You will love it
It not only keeps the rain off but eyes will turn and double turn as you go by, be careful however it may go to you're head.

This is a 5 star jacket with one exception. The Zipper pull that is advertised has a twist feature that allows you to turn it off and on. However this feature also has the unfortunate side effect of continually twisting to the point of coming completely off of its base and falling to the ground. This single incident has resulted in the strobe zipper pull to no longer function... Otherwise, I am completely pleased with this purchase.

I live in NYC where locals have seen everything. Well, except this jacket. This thing turns heads whenever I wear it. Some smile, some laugh, some really like it and want one. The jacket itself is great quality. It is very lightweight, true to size (I am 6 feet and 205 pounds - I got a large and it feels well). The jacket has 2 sets of LED lights on it: one on the zipper for the front pocket (purple and white blinking) and a set of LEDs (reddish/orangish) on the right shoulder. The shoulder lights can either blink, be always on or off. The jacket looks very futuristic because of the lights and the silver sheen of the jacket. More than person suggested I was from Tron or the future. Very cool overall.

This is a nice jacket, it reflects well even in very low light settings. I was able to go out for late night walks and runs without concern. It does fit a bit bigger, I am typically a medium but for this jacket I could have almost gone with a small -- but that was and still is not a concern.

I would support someone who wants to buy this, especially for the price it is very good.

product_title: Craghoppers Men s Ikuya Soft Shell Jacket

reviews.review_body: Hey all, I bought this jacket for my outdoor loving boyfriend for his birthday and he loves it! It got to Iowa in a timely manner so the company really seems to be on the ball. As for product review, I'd say it is exactly as it is described. Waterproof, breathable, wind resistant -- to sum it up Weatherproof! It has a nice soft inside and outside is still soft but durable. The hood seemed a little 'short' kind of like it was too small for the length of the coat but it is really nice with its own bill and cinchers to keep it on your head tight. We even ran the sink water over the sleeve and the water just beaded off the cloth. All in all very good jacket, just as good as 'famous name brands' like Columbia, The North Face etc.

Love this brand and their jackets.  Quality without breaking the bank while keeping it understated.  The only dislike is the different colored panels on side for expansion; changes the look and really were not needed.  Heavier than normal Crag jacket.

product_title: Helikon Trooper Soft Shell Jacket Alpha Green

reviews.review_body: shoulder is a bit wide, the coat has this stinky chemical smell, other than that, all is good

For some context, I previously has only either weatherproof, clumsy snowcoats or light but utterly useless against even wind, hoodies. So usually I have to make a choice, risk getting cold/wet, or go full Eskimo with the accompanying clumsiness.

As you can see from the list of features, this jacket solves the problems I have pretty well, without the drawbacks I had.

Although the product cautioned that it cannot withstand heavy rain, I've not yet gone through one that it can't take on. Not for now.
Being small is another thing I like (fit in a pouch, finally!). It does not have the thermal layer like the Gunfighter, so you might still need to layer yourself wearing it. I tend to alternate between tropical and arid areas so this is actually not a cons for me though.

Pricing is another plus. You don't usually get a functional, good looking softshell for this low.

Velcro for patches and the tacticool that make me look less dumb, are the cherries on top.

All in all, wow it IS a good jacket! Now if I can find a rainproof pant to go with it......

It's a good jacket with water protection. Has good number of pockets, although the inner one could have been better. But overall it serves the purpose as an outer layer. It has inner zips too, which can attach to a fleece or similar inner layer. Problem with the inner zips is they won't attach to a US product/jacket as the zip locking is on the opposite side, but you can always zip the inner layer separately

product_title: Craghoppers Men s Hsuki Jacket

reviews.review_body:
I have to say that being from the U.S. I took a bit of a shot in the dark on this purchase since I was not able to physically try it on or check it out in a store prior to the purchase (I live near Boston and haven't seen Craghoppers in any stores in the area).  This  review will be mostly an initial impression type review, since I have yet to take the jacket on any particularly trying excursions.

Fit: I normally wear XL sized shirts/jackets. For this Jacket I went with XXL (I have owned a Craghoppers Corey 4 fleece for some time, and am familiar with their sizing - I attribute it to the fact that it's a UK company and their sizes simply run differently across the pond).  The sleeve length is slightly longer than a shirt would be (this is a good thing, provides more coverage). The adjustable cuffs have a great range of adjustment.

Finish: a really well made (remember I haven't tortured it yet) garment. zippers work well, seems are nicely sealed, draw strings seem sturdy. One thing to note is (as will all Craghoppers tops that are not from the Bear Grylls line) the zipper on the men's gear is on the "wrong" side for us stateside folks, zipping up with the left hand is not challenging but just takes getting used to.

Things to note:
1. This is not a "Heavy" jacket. It does keep the wind out, but I would say this is a 3-season jacket unless you put a fleece under it.
2. It does not have the ability to zip a Craghoppers fleece into it, not sure where I read that it did (another site possibly?), but it doesn't.
3. The hood is removable, but not neatly storable, unless you count in a pocket.

Overall I give it 4.5 stars. If I could zip in a liner or stow the hood in the collar, it would be 5. But those are FAR from deal breakers and the rest of the jacket really makes up for that. If you are a real outdoors person and want a nice looking jacket that you wouldn't be afraid to get some pine sap on, I would highly recommend this. If you just want to look outdoorsy in your land rover, stick to The North Fake or Patagucci.

product_description: PROTECTION FROM COLD WET WINDY CONDITIONS Named after a 19 000 ft snow covered peak in Cordillera Blanca Peru Qaras comes into its own when it is cold and wet or windy around The water proof wind proof fabric keeps you dry in winter showers or wet snow while the high loft fleece lining keeps you super warm Qaras is tailor made for Seattle weather or for the windy city Chicago WATERPROOF BREATHABLE JACKET Water proof wind proof 3 layer 4 way stretch fabric provides protection without restricting motion Pit zips provide additional option for improved venting and temperature control Fabric Waterproof rating 10 000 mm Fabric Breathability rating 10 000 g m2 NOTE Fabric is waterproof but SEAMS ARE NOT TAPED so water may come in through the seams in heavy or prolonged rain SUPER WARM WITH HIGH LOFT FLEECE Super soft high loft fleece provides warmth and is comfortable The heft and comfort of Qaras makes you feel as if you are putting on a well worn leather jacket MADE WITH HIGH QUALITY MATERIALS Twin zippered hand warmer pockets Adjustable attached hood YKK dual color vislon zippers Velcro cuff adjusters hem cinch cord PERFECT FOR SKIING SNOWSHOEING OR CASUAL USE Alpine skiing snowshoeing bouldering hiking or just stomping around town Qaras can handle them all SIZING Sizing is running slightly small We recommend going one size up Especially the Small size is more like XS

reviews.review_body: This is an excellent jacket. Warm, comfortable and well made. It was oart of our kit on the 333 km run La Ultra The High in the Himalayas in Ladakh, India. Highly recomend it.

I bought it from Kickstarter.com; great quality and finish. It is better than my Patagonia at a very reasonable price. I like side pockets, breathable zippers on the side. Yesterday, I wore in rain, not even a single drop inside. No weird plastic raincoat sound, I can even wear it in weekend picnics, it looks so cool. Inner lining seems some special material. I like culf cut design and shape. It is perfect for outdoors.

I have even ordered mishmi takin shoes. I can't wait to try those on

I was looking at upgrading my current jackets and considered several high-end ones (different Arc'teryx, Northface, etc.) and after researching them (too much time) had nagging concerns that each had some disadvantages for me. Found Mishmi Takin and decided that, rather than try to find one all-purpose jacket, would get 2 different compatible ones. Stumbled across Mishmi Takin and was delighted to discover them. Bought both a Qaras and a Cayambe - just lovely jackets. Very well made, waterproof, windproof of course. But what was best about them was each is both extremely light for what it is (couldn’t believe how warm for how relatively thin the Qaras is) AND stylish (yeah, I admit that the fit is important.) Highly recommended

I've been using this jacket daily for about 1.5 weeks. I've used it as a casual jacket to wear everyday, during light aerobic activity, and in the elements around Washington state. I'm 6'2" 170 lbs and the medium fits me very well. It would be a tight fit to wear more than a single layer underneath this jacket. The jacket weighs 1 lb 14 oz or 850 grams.

Positives:
Great fit
Solid build quality and high quality material selection
Long pockets that can be used with a backpack waist belt but comfortable in normal situations
Long armpit zippers for great ventilation
Excellent breathability
Good adjustability. 3 sets of cordlocks allow you to adjust the waist, hood height and hood circumference for a tight fit.
Looks really great, the lines and accent colors (mine was dark blue with orange accents) are an excellent touch.

Negatives:
Uncomfortable seam along the armpit and upper arm. Not bad with long sleeves underneath but in a t-shirt it can be uncomfortable.
Heavy compared to a fleece insulation layer + rain jacket.

Uses:
I wore the jacket in ~50°F weather with a t-shirt on underneath. I was sitting outside for about 2 hours and was not moving around much. I was starting to get cold but it was manageable.

I wore the jacket in ~40°F weather with hard rain and wind for several hours while staying active. I wore a long-sleeve wicking layer underneath. The rain soaked through the jacket after about 90 minutes which isn't unexpected, not many clothes can handle heavy rain for that long. I remained warm and the cordlocks on the hood helped to make a tight seal to not let any additional rain in. It held off the rain better than my Marmot rain jacket does.

I wore the jacket on a short jog in ~50°F weather. I was warm but didn't need to open the underarm vent zippers. The breathability of this jacket is really impressive. If I were wearing my fleece and rain jacket I would have been much hotter. It's clear that a lot of thought and effort has gone into making this softshell breathable. This jacket should easily be able to handle freezing temperatures if you're active.
Great quality and warmth for the price.
I love this coat but not water tested yet though. The orange fuzz is questionable for offshore sailing conditions.
Had some issues with the jacket’s water resistance but the customer service was excellent.
My new favorite coat. An impressive soft shell that with a thin wool layer worn underneath is mighty warm while being close fitting and allowing movement. Impressive,
Product does as advertised. The sizes run small so order next size up.

Bought this for my husband, who loved it so much he did not take it off for 2 weeks! Lightweight, waterproof in Los Angeles rain, XL is long enough for a tall guy. Fun orange lining, it's a great between seasons jacket.

I live in SE Michigan and I golf year round. This coat keeps you comfortably warm in temperatures between 20 and 45 degrees.It keeps out the water and the wind while allowing freedom of movement in all ranges of the golf swing. I love it and I recommend it for all outdoor activities in relatively cold temperatures. ( teens and below - not so much ).

Amazingly, this light weight jacket keeps in the warmth and does a good job of repelling the rain. Its not water proof but you would think it is by the way the water rolls off...I would purchase this again, but 2 years later it shows little signs of wear...

I have ordered a large men size, thinking it would fit me ok, being an average female around 175-200 pounds.  It is a bit snug and the measurement is most likely based on an Asian profile, which is significantly smaller than the average white male size.  if I reorder this item, I will go one size larger.  I love the fact that it repels the rain, and is perfect for windy & cooler days.  It allows me to stay dry and I do not overheat wearing it. A darn good product for the price !

Wind and water resistance is superb. Can't say about durability as of yet, only had it a few weeks and it hasn't been jacket weather much here.

For fit reference I'm 6'2 225 medium build and I ordered a large, I can wear a fleece or sweatshirt underneath it with no problem as long as it's not baggy.

Heading to Iceland in a few weeks and I will update review after.

Got this for my son's birthday.  He LOVES IT! It is a breathable, fleece lined, waterproof jacket.  Very well made and it even has a hidden zipper under each arm pit for better ventilation if needed. I would get a size up, runs a bit small. I needed a little help from Mishmi Takin and their Customer Service was WONDERFUL!! My request was met with PERFECTION. Unbeknownst to me, at the time, the founder of Mishmi Takin was my Customer Service Rep. I LOVE this brand & plan to purchase another for my husband.  Taki

Jacket seemed nice but there were two serious issues that resulted in me returning it. One: not lightweight at all. I didn't expect this to be so heavy.  but the single biggest issue was it was very small when compared to sizing by Northface and Mountain Hardwear. At least a size smaller. I wear a size L in Northface, MT Hardwear, and Marmot, but this jacket was a trim M at best even though I ordered a L.

Buy this jacket! It's absolutley the best one you can buy for the value. It's light, breathable, warm and it looks and fits great! Definatley go one size up though. The sizing runs small! I have tried 3-4 jackets in my search and this one impressed me the most(even though others were more expensive). I purchased large in black but it was to small. So I had to go with yellow in xl. Also, if you have an issue and need help the customer service is fantastic. Kapil has been working with me non stop with the size thing and the return and exchange process has been a good experience. SO GO FOR IT. You will be happy.

I grew up in Nebraska and spend 17 (too many) years there.  I've been through harsh winters.  But I don't remember them at all.

I've lived in tropical climates for the past 12 years and am currently in North Carolina.  Winters here sit at a regular low in the mid 20s; we usually get highs into the high 40s, maybe the low 50s even. Suffice to say, I'm spoiled.

I ordered this jacket to survive this winter, which is promising to be a cold one.  Middle of December and it's already dipping into the 30s! Brrrr!  And survive this jacket will do!  The "high loft fleece" layer is relatively thin, which keeps this jacket nice and light, but it also keeps me warm.  I've worn it outside walking the dog (who, at 5 AM, feels as if she must investigate every blade of grass in the neighborhood) when it was close to 0C outside (see what I did there?  Tricked you!  Kept you on your toes!) and I was fine.

Wind does not penetrate this jacket at all.  The hood is snug enough that you don't create a small wind tunnel around your head like jackets that are designed to be worn with a helmet; another benefit to the hood is that it's not designed to be removed, which always leaves gaps in the material coverage.  At the wrists is a perfectly placed piece of hook-and-loop fastener which isn't quite as strong (or loud) as Velcro, but does more than an adequate job at sealing the sleeves around a pair of gloves.  If you were active, you may be interested in unzipping under the arms to allow extra ventilation.

My only complaint with this jacket is that the pockets only have lining on one side of the inside.  You won't keep both hands warm using these pockets, only the side of your hands away from your body.  On the side your palms would sit is a mesh fabric.  This means that if you're cold outside and leave the pockets unzipped, be prepared for that inevitable breeze that hits just right to blow right through the jacket.

I guess it could also use a chest pocket, but now I'm just being picky.

product_title: Walker and Hawkes Men s Wax 3 in 1 Greendale Jacket

reviews.review_body:
First, if you're curious how a British style waxed jacket may fair or adapt to a North American climate, just remember Filson is an American company offering similar clothing.

Second, this jacket is very well made and very comfortable. It is a touch looser than a Carhartt 2XL Detroit jacket I own, despite being marked as 3XL. If you compare measurement sizes(I suggest looking at their actual website vs sizing info here on Amazon), this won't be a surprise. But if are counting on a 3xl=3xl, you'll find your jacket is a little more fitted\tailored than you might expect.

I am 5'11", 235 pounds, with long arms, and a 50" chest.  The size chart suggested I get the 3XL, but, I read that these tend to run a bit large, so, I ordered the 2XL.  Glad I did - perfect fit, with room for layers.  I'm almost looking forward to a rain storm so I can test out the water repelling functionality!  Out of the box, with the liner attached, I put it on over a heavy sweatshirt, and there was plenty of room to move - very comfortable, and warm, even on a blustery cold New England day.

I ordered this Feb 24.  Coming fastest shipment, it was expected March 2; it arrived Feb 28 - 2 days ahead of schedule.

I will say that the zip is a bit fiddly, but, I imagine that is more a "learning the item" issue, rather than a defect.

product_title: Columbia Men s Glacier To Glade III Parka

reviews.review_body: Very impressed so far with this 3-in-1 parka. It's very, very warm with the liner zipped into the shell. The inner portion works well by itself in above-freezing temperatures. Connecting and disconnecting each part is not too complicated, though the zippers all around are not the best and I get the impression they will be the first things to fail on the coat. Fabric was caught in one of the side pocket zippers to start with and it was a challenge to fix it without tearing anything. It's made in China which is a bummer but for the price it seems to perform as well as much more expensive options. I got a size medium and it's a perfect fit (5'9, 150lbs). If you think you're between sizes, opt for the next one up. This is not a baggy or relaxed-cut coat. Overall very satisfied so far - here's hoping it lasts more than one or two seasons.

After just one day of wearing this coat I'm pretty confident that it's pretty much what I was hoping it would be. -25ºC windy and snowing outside, I wore this coat and just my dress shirt and tie (plus my combo clava) as I rode my bike to work, and I was still warm.

However, I find it strange that the zipper is on the wrong side.

I like everything about this jacket save for one thing: the fit.  I ordered a small because I wear small, sometimes medium sized, jackets, and based on the fit of Columbia gear I've bought in the past I thought a small would be fine.

Well, when I received the jacket I found out how wrong I was.  Thus my advice to anyone looking at buying this or a similar jacket from Columbia this year is to lean towards a larger size if there is any doubt about the fit (and perhaps even if there isn't), particularly if you have much weight on your stomach.  The chest was about what I expected, but the waist and shoulders of the jacket were VERY slim.  The bottom of the jacket barely fit over my belt and the tightness in the shoulders and upper arms made me look like I was wearing a full-body cast.

Fit aside the rest of the jacket is pretty great.  The liner jacket is what keeps you warm and it does a very good job of that.  The shell is supple yet very resistant to the elements, so with the liner in place you've got something that is heavy-duty against both cold and inclement weather.  If the fit were looser in the upper arms and the bottom I'd give this 5 stars.

If you don't mind the crazy lining on this bad boy, it's really quite nice.

Sizing seems about right. I bought a 3XL, and it fits similarly to other 3XL jackets I own from other brands. It might be a hair tighter or snugger than my other 3XL jackets, but not so much that I'd recommend ordering a size up from your usual size.

Interestingly, I paid about 30 dollars when I ordered mine, and the prices seem to be much higher now. Guess I snuck in at the right time and lucked out. For 30 dollars, I'm rather pleased. If I wanted to order a 3XL as of writing this review, the prices are higher ($48 or $97, depending on color). For 30 dollars, I'm pleased. For 48 or 97, I'd be less pleased.

The jacket is comfortable. It feels flexible and stretchy enough to be comfortable (as opposed to some jackets that are stiffer and less comfy). Yet it feels substantial enough to be warm. Granted, I'm writing this review in August and I live in New Mexico... so I haven't gotten to put the jacket through its paces in real cold conditions yet. But it feels like it will be quite warm. I can already tell it'll be too warm for me to wear it in summer or late spring. I might stash it in my car for my wife during those seasons just in case we run into a super-cold movie theater. But it feels too warm to get much use between from April through September, or thereabouts.

Depending on whether you value fashion over functionality, the lining might be a problem for you. The lining is bananas. No other way to say it, really.

When you click around and look at Columbia's "Omni-Heat" jackets on Amazon, there's a reason why they are engaging in very strategic photography. They're trying to mainly show you the jacket zipped up as much as possible, because the interior lining is bonkers. It's shiny and glittery looking. Like you're wearing one of those emergency survival blankets made of foil.

Of course, if you're talking about an item of clothing meant to keep you warm, why is it a bad thing for it to employ heat-retention technology? So... I can only speak for myself, but I don't mind the lining, personally.

I'm a bit of a dork. And anybody who knows me would take one look at the lining and then nod knowingly, because they know that it's probably a point of pride for me to be wearing clothes that are so functional. Anybody who doesn't know me, on the other hand, might think I'm wearing a lady's jacket (or a really flamboyant dude's jacket) if they get a good glimpse of the flashy lining.

You might need to wander away from Amazon to find better pictures of the lining, to get a better idea of whether it's a deal-breaker for you.

One thing I really like about the jacket is the sleeves. The sleeves have smaller, elastic sleeves sewn into the openings. This means that the elastic bit of the sleeve clings tightly enough to your wrist/hands to prevent too much cold air from getting in. It just looks like you're wearing a long-sleeve black t-shirt underneath the jacket, which isn't bad.

Let me say this; it is only slightly water resistant, and certainly not breathable.

Bought this jacket because I needed a waterproof shell when I go on rock climbing trips (which involve hiking, camping, and backpacking) and for when I go cycling in light rain. Got this jacket at a local retailer for a great deal, and was super excited to try it in wet conditions.

I have to agree with another reviewer on here that claimed he got wet when wearing this jacket, and it was due to his own sweat. I experienced the same problem when I'm doing anything that causes me to perspire even a LITTLE bit. I find myself almost completely soaked when I remove my jacket after an extended length of time (45 min-2 hours). I would consider myself relatively fit, and that I don't sweat more than average. "Sweatier" individuals may experience this more extremely, as they're peeling off the jacket that is plastered to their skin.

In terms of water-proofing, it's only slightly better. Initial rain/moisture of any kind will run off due to gravity, and typically don't cause a problem. However, areas of the jacket that are perpendicular with gravity (such as the shoulders, hood, and certain creases in the sleeves), experience only a bit of run off leaving the water to soak into the shell. After a cold, wet day when I didn't sweat, I removed the jacket and found my arms to be slightly damp. Later that week I tested the jacket's water-resistance under the sink on the sleeve portion (for 30 seconds) and found that after most of the water had run off, there was still a damp area where water had soaked through.

I'd say it's a decent jacket for the price, but certainly wouldn't purchase it again knowing that it's not water-proof and not breathable (the two main features it claims to do).

Don't get caught up in the colors or the price of this jacket. There are better options and equivalent styles made by other companies.

Had the jacket for 2 years, now the zipper is broken. Also it's thinner than I expected. I'll have to see if

I was expecting this jacket to be a little thicker. But since I live in Florida, thinner is better. I tried it on a windy night and it blocked the wind. But now I have to try it when it rains.Hope rain doesn't seek through this jacket.

This is light and keeps the rain out but invariably gets wet on the inside due to condensation.  Not a problem if I'm wearing long sleeve polyester breathable fabric underneath but it does limit the upper temperature I will wear this in.

By mistake I first posted review for a Columbia fleece jacket that I bought at the same time as this shell. I needed a shell for month long trip to Falklands, S. Georgia, and the Antarctic peninsula. When I saw this I was afraid it was not "tough" enough to hold up. But at the end it showed no signs of wear. My ski Northface XCR shell was much heavier than I needed (or had space to pack) for this trip. We were afraid our outer wear would have to be discarded after the trip due to residue Penguin poop smell. But that smell washed off without difficulty. So now I have a light shell to put over sweaters etc., for example, when shoveling snow.

I got this jacket for the mild Seattle fall/winter/spring rainy times. I love the fit and it is very waterproof, but if I work up any kind of sweat at all, the inside of the jacket ends up SOAKED with my sweat. This wouldn't be such a problem, except it claims to be breathable, and it isn't at all. If you are looking for something good to keep you dry while you stand and wait for the bus, get this one; if you want something to be at all active in, I would look elsewhere.

This jacket is perfectly priced. I am 5'10 140 lbs and I wear medium. The arms come slightly past my wrist which is fine. This jacket seems to be a lot more durable and thicker than other "waterproof" jackets I have bought.  THE UPDATE I went on a 10k run and I was dry from the rain the jacket is waterproof, BUT there is perspiration in the jacket. My shirt was wet. It was 65° and a downpour. I'm going to use this on a colder day and see how it does.

This jacket is a bit large for myself (5' 3"), but most jackets for me are usually to big.  Nevertheless, this jacket keeps me extremely dry, and warm.  During the summer time this jacket made me a bit to warm, to the point I was sweating quicker then it can evaporate.  However, this jacket is great now that it's winter.  Overall impression would be that it was a good buy.
Fantastic fit!!!! It looks and feels awesome!!! It does well in the rain for awhile but after a few hours will start to feel wet. Meant for quick trip outside. Not meant for long rainy days.

It fits great, but it was a little pricey. Also I find it sticks to my skin a little like when you sleep on a leather couch and wake up stuck. It's best if you're intending on working out not leisure. Then the wicking makes more sense and I assume sticks less.

The jacket is very stylish in my opinion. I have used this jacket anywhere from wearing it when it's a bit windy to taking it to the snow. It ventilates very well to keep you fresh during activities and you remain fresh while moving around. In one of my trips to South Lake Tahoe it kept me dry from the snow, I had a thermal underneath it and did not feel too hot while snowboarding.

I like to combine this jacket while wearing shorts with a tank top underneath and roll up the sleeves a bit. You do not get hot and it still will protect you from some wind, over all the jacket is great and very versatile. I would definitely recommend it and will purchase it again when needed, the only think I would recommend is to buy a size up if you will be using with multiple layers underneath.

product_title: Russell Mens 3 Layer Soft Shell Gilet Jacket

reviews.review_body: Awful...very poor quality, sizing is way off.
The material looks great and stylish.

I bought this as "Small" and it is too large for me.  I bought this product as a blind spot without knowing the dimensions of all the sizes so I can compare

Extra small - dimensions?
Small - dimensions?
Medium - dimensions?
Large - dimensions?

SHOULDER, HIP and LENGTH  dimensions please....

product_title: Columbia Men s Coupe De Main Jacket

reviews.review_body: The perfect Combination of light weight, warm, and nice desing for a ver fair price. You can not ask more for a Jacket
Excellent

I got this jacket on sale and I'm very happy with my purchase. I got this from altrec through amazon and the product arrived in 3 days! The jacket fits just like any other Columbia products I've owned (Not awkwardly fitted like the melting point jacket). This jacket fits just like the ascender jacket without the hoody. I'm 5'9 178lbs and the large fits great. It has a relaxed fit. If you want a fitted look like the model in the pic, get a medium but a medium will feel uncomfortable in the arm pit area. The large is perfect for me.

Update

I wore this outside for 30 min and it was very warm. It is very windy and cold today in Seattle area but I felt no air go through this jacket and was comfortably warm. This puts my newly acquired $130 Northface jacket to shame. I've owned a $220 NF jacket before with 800 fill down jkt and I like my new Columbia better. I find it interesting that TNF couldn't come up with an idea like omni heat.

product_title: Columbia Men s Omni Heat Insulated Liner

reviews.review_body: Good, light coat.  The camo is a bit bright, however.  Should be more muted.
Light weight,warm and allows full range of motion when uaed with my Columbia shell parka for bowhunting.Quaility product and another reason why I'am a big fan of Columbia clothing.

good quality arrived fast, warm enough.
Will be using this winter at some point.
Like the feel of it

Would buy again.

it's very cool and light.it's too short to me but exactly to me in arms.
it's too difficult to choose a jacket fit to me.

The item is not what's shown on the website. The one on the website is colorful and with leaves. The one I received is in the plain color of titanium black. No patterns etc. It's very disappointing. I don't know whether it's a mistake or what. But I wanted an exchange.

Fit and quality appear good. Have not put it to the test in the field yet but the initial wearing inconjunction with the wader jacket are comfortable and do not restrict movement. Think I'm going to like it in the duck blind with waders.

product_title: Port Authority Challenger Jacket 4XL True Royal True Navy

reviews.review_body: Excellent quality. We have this one as a xmas gift. Hard to find size but we knew by the ones our family they are great. Wash like new. Look great to wear anywhere. Can layer over a sweater for cold weather . Thankyou for being there to fill my order quickly. Mrs. Smith

product_title: Columbia Men s Heat 360 Jacket Small Black

reviews.review_body: The description is right on in that you do not overheat nor do you get cold, a perfect balance!  Check out the Columbia website for sizing, they give a perfect picture to select your correct size.  Mine fits very nicely.  This jacket has been perfect this fall, and I will most likely be using it under my winter coat shell.  Zero complaints here, zero, zilch, nada.  Only praise, good job Columbia, I think you nailed this one!

product_title: Columbia Men s Ice Axe III Softshell

reviews.review_body: This coat is perfect. I live off lake Erie so we get a lot of snow, wind, rain and other various harsh weather conditions. I wear this coat everywhere I go. The waterproof pockets are great. If you are only wearing a t-shirt under it, it is great for anything above 20 degrees. The only complaint that I have is that there is no inside pocket.

product_title: Columbia Men s Horicon Marsh Jacket

reviews.review_body: I purchased this item on March 28th and received it on April 6th for $ 68.99. When I check on April 8th if they have anymore for a friend it was now $50.99. This B.S. to me that to days after I received the Jacket the price went down $18.99. I am really thinking of returning this Jacket.

product_title: Port Authority Men s Tall Textured Soft Shell Jacket

reviews.review_body:
I actually bought for a coworker for the winter. They work in a cold warehouse. They said jacket felt excellent and was high quality with a good price. Delivered in a timely manner.
Thank you
JJH
Nice

product_title: Spyder Men s Shadow Insulator Jacket

reviews.review_body: The jacket was very small.  It was not true to size. The color was nice and quality.  Had to return jacket because it was very small.

product_title: Port Authority 3 in 1 Jacket Black Black

reviews.review_body: Wonderful product with great quality.

product_title: Mountain Warehouse Torrent Mens Waterproof Jacket

reviews.review_body: Zipper broke in less than a month. Poor quality. Don't recommend!!
It was as discribed
It fit perfectly but not as warm as I thought.
Very nice jacket.
very nice and comfortable and well worth the money.  The only problem I had was the zipper zips on the same side as the women's jacket.
Good quality good value for the money
I like this item so much that I ordered one for my husband.

For the price and being waterproof, my expectations weren't too high. But it's still a decent & lightweight rain jacket for spring/summer weather. The stitching at the seams doesn't seem like it'll hold up over time, but it should last a couple seasons without an issue.

I tested it in during a rainy morning walk and it kept me dry. Not sure how it would hold up in a downpour over long periods, but light/medium rains are no problem with this jacket.

Just note that this jacket runs BIG. For reference, I'm 5'8" and 155 lbs with athletic build. I'm usually somewhere between a small/medium depending on brand. But with this, even the XS is big on me. The XS fitment is good in the shoulders and sleeve, but there's a lot of extra room in the mid-section. Definitely good for people with bigger stomachs. I have a similar jacket made by Columbia in size medium that's smaller than this jacket in size XS.
Very nice product

Why spend $60 or more on a waterproof shell when you can have this for $30?  Well worth the money and I would highly recommend it.  I am 5’10” and 165 lbs and athletic build.  Surprisingly the medium fit very well and I have room to layer.  I have had very good luck with the Mountain Warehouse brand of clothes.

product_title: Manfrotto MA LSS050M XLBB Men s PRO Soft Shell Jacket XL Black
product_description: Abrasion protection shoulder and elbow patches Side entry chest pockets Pocket for point and shoot camera Can be used with Pro Photo Vest as thermal protection

reviews.review_body: This is a Great jacket!  It was a good purchase.  However, the shoulder has external reinforcement that is plastic. It looks good, but is slippery! My camera bags slide off. Should be made of something similar to Rubber!!

The jacket is very well made. It is a snug or 'Italian' fit. I am 6'3" tall and a fairly standard build. An XL is a good if snug fit on me - if I was going to wear a few layers under it I would probably need one size up.

It is expensive compared to a plain black fleece from some outdoor company or other but is is a bit out of the ordinary and I am sure it will last well.

Great Italian fit which means it runs lean.  Wonderful workmanship and great fabrics. Very comfortable. Plenty of little storage pockets -- you'll need a map to find everything.  My only complaint is with Amazon, not the product.  The jacket was offered for 169 with rebate. When I ordered, the price had increased to 176 with rebate.  I ordered thinking the lower price was gone.  A week later, the lower 169 price appeared.  Amazon wouldn't match the lower price, unless I packed it all up and returned it.  Nordstrom or Saks? --  No problem, the differential would have been returned -- with a smile.  Amazon? They told me no deal.  They still have a lot to learn about customer service.  Great product with this Manfrotto Jacket.  Everything I expected and more.  Amazon?  A total let down.  Very disappointed in them, negative 5 stars....

product_title: Columbia Men s Omni Heat Wader Widgeon Parka

reviews.review_body: The Columbia Omni Heat Parka does what it says, (keep you warm in the coldest temps. I wore this coat while hunting in 15 degree temps and was kept very warm. This Parka runs a little large but that is a plus as you will want to layer your base. It has an outstanding hood and is very water proof. It's made extremely well and should last for a good long time.

product_title: IKIIO Mens Fleece Sherpa Lined Jacket Hooded Sweatshirt Zip Winter Warm Coat

reviews.review_body: It a nice sweatshirt but smaller than expected

product_title: ATG by Wrangler Men s Reversible Classic Jacket

reviews.review_body: I absolutely love it!! I am a small woman so I know to get a size small for men’s and I’m telling you it’s such a good jacket! Very nice for being out in cold weather for sure!

My hubby really really likes this jacket. It fit him absolutely perfectly. He is 5'8'' and 175 - 180 lbs with an athletic build.

This is really the perfect jacket for chilly Mississippi days. We are in this point of winter where it's cold but not freezing and often warms up a tad in the afternoon. It's lightweight but still warm, It looks great on either side you wear it since it is reversible.

Very pleased with this jacket!

This loose fitting longer length Jacket is perfect for 3 season wear. Deep accessable pockets warm the hands and hold all the essentials. Add a sweater or hoodie for more warmth and the longer length keeps the hawk off your backside. did I mention it's reversable? Change of weather, mood, you have options. It'll be your goto jacket of choice.

I love this reversible jacket. It fits perfectly, is comfortable and warm The zippers run smoothly with no catching or hesitation. It is well made and machine washable. Both sides look great. Good way to enjoy two looks for the price of one.

My husband wears a large to XL tall. He has long arms and a barrel chest. The positives: The sleeves are plenty long enough which makes him very happy. The color is an approved one for work so he can wear it with his uniform. With the fleece on the inside, he finds this a comfortable and appealing layer.

On the downside, The fit is barely enough and he called this more of a large tall than an XL tall. It fits him very closely like a base layer. He could not wear this over a sweater or anything heavier than a t shirt. His primary criticism is that the zipper is very light and pulls apart very easily. The zipper teeth are small and plastic. I put it on me (it's huge on me) and the same thing happened, the zipper constantly giving way and pulling apart.

We could not think of any reason to wear this fleece side out with the smooth layer on the inside. It made no functional sense to us. We are not "reversibility" people so maybe that has more value to others. I would think the fleece out would pick up lint like crazy.

Conclusion: he will wear this over a tee and in moderate weather for rain and wind protection. Happy with the sleeve length and color. Upset about the flimsy zipper.

Great looking jacket. I am usually really picky when it comes to jackets but this one is great. It looks great, feels great, and is easy to wear with almost everything, not to mention it's reversible.

Very comfortable and warm jacket!  It's stylish and well-made.
The reversability is a bonus to give you two jackets in one.
This is a really refined jacket by Wrangler. It still has the Wrangler feel, but with a sleeker look. It’s warm and very versatile- it’s even reversible!
Hubby really likes this jacket.  Reversible and so cozy.  Fits true to size and well made.

This Men's Reversible Jacket by Wrangler is dressier than most jackets and has many great attributes.  Reversible jacket has a soft side and a windbreaker side, a sturdy reversible zipper, big pockets, short height collar, and long sleeves that are perfect for this size of jacket and the man who wears it!  Windproof and waterproof, this jacket can't be beat!

I love the fact that this jacket doubles as two jackets. If it's raining or snowing, you can wear the black side out to protect against the elements. If it's dry or you want the look of a fleece, just reverse it.

The fit is as expected. XLT is a little big on me. I normally would wear an LT. But, finding a jacket with the sleeves long enough is always a bonus. I'm 6'2" with long arms and legs and the sleeve length works for me.

This jacket is great. You get 2 for the price of 1!
One side is water repellent and the other is more casual look. It is light weight, so it won’t work for a very cold winter. I would say is for cooler spring nights or autumn.
It is very well made, zipper works good.
The color, both colors are great.
Fits true to size.
My husband loves it.

My husband has found a new favorite sporting gear maker! He has tried seven products from this line and they all have been exceptional! He's normally a bit picky - not to mention that he wears a "tall" in most of his tops and jackets. Wrangler even thought about the taller guys and gave them a tall option. The clothing is very well made and very thoughtfully planned out.

Comfortable and lightweight, yet, still warm and provides the right coverage as a transitional coat. Fits true to size, and, perfect in width and length. Made impeccably and true Wrangler quality. The double function, provides great coverage, the fleece side is warm and cozy, yet, the rain gear side provides rain, water and snow coverage - keeps you dry on a wet day. This jacket is truly amazing and would be a great addition to anyone's closet and would durable and usable for years to come.

This stylish blue/black Wrangler's XL "All Terrain Gear" jacket is surprisingly warm (and wind shedding) in cold weather,  if worn solo or as an undergarment. Shiny in exterior color, reversible from blue/black exterior to a soft gray interior, the jacket has two (2) hand warming side pockets (without zippers) and a zippered left side vest pocket for cell phone or wallet when worn shiny side out and when worn in soft gray; vest pocket then is in the inside. This is not the trendy puffer jacket but has a similar modish cache; collar is small approx. inch in width but will be chic with scarf. Reversible front zipper is sturdy and high quality. XL is true to male sizing guidelines.

I ordered this for my husband and he looks great in it! We both prefer the look of the matte grey side over the shiny blue side but both sides are very nice. He likes that its reversible so of he gets one side messy he can still flip it inside out and wear it for the rest of the day. He likes the zippered chest pocket and it works great for concealed carry. It's hoodless so he can use it for layering and still has this as a lighter midweight option. It has hand pockets on both sides as well and it also repels water. It's great for fall and warmer winter days and looks very nice! I would definitely recommend it!

This jacket is awesome for chilly fall weather or early spring. I think you could also wear it as a layer under a winter coat. However, it is not warm enough to wear alone in winter. The fit is perfect. Not too loose or tight. I like that it has one side that is water resistant and the other side is a nice grey soft material.
My partner is 6'4 and I got him the XLT size. It fits him true to size. I would recommend ordering your normal size in this jacket. He really likes it and I like he looks great in it.

This jacket is exactly what you need for cooler weather that's not downright cold. One side is a slick, waterproof fabric. The other is a plush fleece. Both sides have pockets. The slick side has a zippered chest utility pocket. This jacket is ready for the elements. It will keep you warm and dry. I found the fit to be true to size. This jacket makes a great gift for your favorite outdoorsman.

rarely have i found a really lightweight jacket and it be warm and mobile.  usually the armpits are tight and you are desensitized in the arms to what you may be leaning on (edges/being poked by something sharp, etc).  because this is so thin you can comfortably maneuver and not get snagged on something or put on a seat belt without having to hold the jacket in.  i'm a cheapskate but i definitely would be willing to spend the money on this jacket.  so far everything ATG has been a big win to me by Wrangler.  definitely worth the purchase!

I wish I can give more than 5 stars. I love this jacket, because it resembles an old torn jacket that I used to love. This ATG jacket is even better in many ways. It's extremely soft, roomy, and comfy. I do not like jacket that feels constraining. It has a soft interior that can be worn reversed.

The size fits me perfectly. I typically wear a M size and it was spot on. The sleeves weren't even too long. I was delighted because you never know about sizing when ordering online.

This is a perfect light-medium jacket for Fall and late winter weather in the Midwest. It is now my favorite jacket. Overall, it feels like a very high quality jacket and I highly recommend it.

Note: there is no hood to block the rain.

This jacket is exactly what you need for cooler weather that's not downright cold. One side is a slick, waterproof fabric. The other is a plush fleece. Both sides have pockets. The slick side has a zippered chest utility pocket. This jacket is ready for the elements. It will keep you warm and dry. I found the fit to be true to size. This jacket makes a great gift for your favorite outdoorsman.

Thanks so much for taking the time to read this review. I hope the information that I've provided makes your decision a little easier.
Water repellent canvas fabric is durable and helps resist water. Keep Cool. Moisture-wicking knit helps lift sweat from the skin. Light Insulation. Lightweight warmth makes for comfort.

Looks kind of dressy, especially the grey side. Both sides have hand warmer pockets, the black side also has a zip chest pocket.
Fit is generous, arms are long.
No frills, no good cuffs or adjustable waist.

This jacket just isn't right for me. That doesn't mean it couldn't be right for you, but I found a few flaws, to my taste.

First, it's supposed to be reversible, but I really didn't like the feel of the nylon on my skin. Maybe if you're wearing a long-sleeve shirt? But with short sleeves it feels kind of gross as after a little time some sweat starts building up against the nylon. So, as far as I'm concerned, that's one strike.

Second, the cut seems to hang a little strange on me. Not sure what it is about my proportions, but this Nehru-jacket, collarless look just doesn't look right.

Third, it is too heavy for slightly cool weather, but too light for really cold weather. It could work be a good jacket to keep in the car if you live in San Francisco. You know, you always need a jacket in the car in San Francisco. But unfortunately, not where I live. Where I live, there are only a few weeks a year where this would be the right choice. It's an awkward in-between jacket.

So I can't get on the bandwagon of good reviews for this one. It's OK and I will probably wear it a few times a year just to mix things up. But it won't be in regular rotation, unfortunately.

This is a pretty decent jacket. It’s reversible. One side is a fabric material that keeps you pretty warm. The other side is a slick windbreaker like material. Wearing the slick side inside is less warm, which is nice when the weather is a little unpredictable. The jacket is a little big on me, I’m between a L and XL and depending on the fit of the clothing I wear either size.

This jacket is surprisingly warm considering how light it is. It's well-constructed and I like how the zippers reverse for the two looks. I actually prefer the lighter gray fabric to be facing out. The fit is good, if not on the square side. My shoulders and chest are wider than my waist, so I'd prefer if the cut were more V-shaped. It's probably a more slimming look if your not so trim and want more structure in your jacket. I've been wearing this as a layer under a bigger coat for extremely cold days. That way I can keep it on when I go inside and shed the outer, bigger layer, and still stay warm.

This jacket fit as expected, and came with a hanger. I found it to be lightweight and comfortable to wear. It was reversible, and had two front pockets at the bottom, as well as a zipper pocket up top on the dark blue side. The zipper worked well on both sides, without issues. I did notice that when I turned this jacket inside out to wear it on the other side, the attached tag on the top stuck out so it was visible that I was wearing it inside out. For a jacket that's supposed to be reversible, I found this inconvenient, so I will stick to wearing it on the dark blue side.

This is a nice warm lightweight weather-resistant close-fitting jacket. I weigh 160 pounds and the jacket fits me well over a light shirt, but the sleeves and shoulders are too snug to wear the jacket over a sweater or sweatshirt. The jacket is very lightweight and non-bulky, but very warm for the low weight. The collar is low and loose with no hood, so I have to wear a scarf to keep my neck warm in cold weather. The jacket is reversible, but I find myself only wearing the weather-resistant side on the outside. I really like the sturdy front zipper. I would have liked zippers on the hand pockets, too, though.

I machine washed it and dried it without issues.

This is a coat that is between a jacket and a full blown winter coat. It is lined enough to be warmer than a regular jacket and is reversible. This makes it a good choice when a jacket is not enough but a coat is too much.

Pockets in both directions (worn padded side or waterproof side out)

It runs a bit small, around a half size small, I think due to the padding. . The Long is actually long which is a big plus. The arms are a bit wider as well.  A XLT is a bit big in the torso but the right length on  a 6ft 1 inch 155 pound young adult with long arms but who is a really lanky build. On a 5ft 10in, 175 lb guy  with large shoulders and arms it fits well across the torso and body w with only a t shirt underneath but is a tad long. He normally wears an XL jacket but has a sweater or sweatshirt on underneath, no room in this jacket. The extra width in the arms comes in handy if your arms are a bit more built.
Very nice reversible jacket!

Had looked at this jacket for a late winter addition, decided to pass. When I reviewed some browsing history, seen where it was only $17...thought why not.  When it arrived, it was much heavier than expected, runs a little big for me. I usually where XL slim fit, this is not a slim fit style, so it is a bit too roomy for me around the mid section. Feel is great, sure it is going to be super comfortable, still looks great on.

I wear XL in just about everything shirt related. The XL of the jacket fits me well. I'm 6'1" tall muscular build weighing 200 pounds. The feel of the jacket is nice to, I like the soft feel, one side is soft and plush the other has a nylon feel yet soft on the skin. One thing that did not make sense was they put a brite white tag right at the neck where most tags are, but they could have at least made the tag stylish, sense the jacket is reversible. Best thing to do is just cut off the tag. The warmth of the jacket is just right for Southern California.

If you find this review helpful please press the helpful button, thanks!

Really well made an warm jacket.  If it's raining or snowing you can use the puffy side as the exterior.  Both outer, side pockets, are zip close.  The zippers are well made and don't get caught in the pocket liners, or jacket liners.  The interior is completely, even the sleeves, fleece lined because you can flip this coat inside out. The puffy portion then becomes the inside.  Inner pockets are not zip close but opened.  When the fleece side is worn out then its exposed pockets are zip close as well.  I am 5'9" 180lbs (female) with an athletic build and the Men's Medium fits me wonderfully.  It looks like a stole some nice guys coat but its very comfortable and warm.

Excelente abrigo de buena calidad caliente por su material pedí XL pero siento que es un poco largo de cuello a cadera un poco alargado y no elegí el XL Alto imagino que el XL Alto es mas largo de cuello a cadera, soy de elegir ropa XL y me quedo un poco ancho ya que no es un XL Fit pero sirve a su proposito excelente inversión pero fuera bueno que le bajaran los precios a los otros abrigos de color negro y azul pprque compre el verde por ser mas barato que si le bajan a uno le bajaran a todos por eso 3 estrellas también un detalle importante a mostrar en la etiqueta de este XL dice XL/TG importante antes de comprar yo siendo XL no soy de unar talla alta asiq al venirme un XL/TG alto y grande no lo podré usar mucho salvo para ocasiones que hagan frío y no para salir habitualmente..

This is an extremely versatile jacket. Overall I’m very happy with it all around. Living in Alaska, it needs to be able to handle extensive cold winter weather. So far this jacket is handled numerous trips outside for camping and hiking and temperatures well below freezing. The jackets office in credibly. The polyester outer shell does a tremendous job at keeping you warm and dry on the inside. Typically when outside I wear the black color jacket showing on the outside. The pockets Friday ample storage and a great place to keep my hands warm if need be. The lighter gray side is also equally warm and dry., But it does tend to get dirty relatively easy, so I just Generally  reserve the side For more casual situations. This jacket looks great with a pair of hunting pants out of the woods all day, as well as it does with a pair of khakis or slacks going out to a nice dinner with friends or family. I wanted the large size wanting  some room to layer clothes underneath. But overall I found it to be very true to size. And I am extremely happy with it so far.

Happy with the jacket overall, its very true to size, nice feel, good zipper etc.

Only thing is I would like to see is that the bottom to have either a slight taper or have a cinch in the bottom. I felt the bottom half was larger than the top. Lastly it needs to have tear away tags. I also didnt like the tag on the soft side and its very difficult to remove. If there ever is a version 2 or a modern take of the "classic jacket" those are some things to consider.

Nice lightweight jacket but it runs a bit small, around a half size small, I think due to the padding.  The measurement down  is actually long which is a big plus. The arms run a bit wider as well.  A XLT is a bit big in the torso but the right length on a 6ft 1 inch 165 pound young adult with long arms but who is slender .  On a 5ft 10in, 185 lb guy with large shoulders and arms it fits well across the torso and body w with only a t shirt underneath but is a tad long. He normally wears an XL jacket but has a sweater or sweatshirt on underneath, no room in this jacket. The extra width in the arms comes in handy if your arms are more muscular.

The weather cannot be too cold but nice to have on hand for the spring and colder summer nights.  And , a refreshing change to constantly wearing sweatshirts and hoodies.  The color is great which matches  most clothing.
Warm and comfortable in ordered the 4x

product_title: Columbia Men s Carabineer II Parka

reviews.review_body: Excellent product, very warm yet breathable. Great value. Saved plenty purchasing on this site and would definately do so again.
Great jacket! Would recommend to anyone. Used in Niagara Falls -9 degrees, I actually got HOT!
Good product.  Nicely done. No complain. Will do more shopping on line if and when I have time.  : )

Overall cut was great for my shoulders and waist.  The waist band is adjustable with non-slip band that helps keep the coat from riding upwards.  The uppers arms can be bit snug for larger biceps/triceps.  Mixed results for warmth.  At about 0F-10F I was bordering on cold without physical exertion.  Definately warm to hot from 20F-30F.

I bought 6 of these for my employees. They all have had nothing but great things to say about them. You can actually pull out the inside liner and still be incredibly warm just wearing the outside liner.

When I got this jacket, I thought they shipped me the wrong one, as it is much thinner than expected. But that's not a bad thing, this jacket is very warm. I cannot keep it on inside very long, as I get way too hot. I really like the jacket so far, as it's stylish, very warm, not big and bulky. I also found a good deal on amazon.com for $195. I would recommend this jacket for a sale price, but not for $280 (full price), that's just too much.

What a waste of good money! After approximately two years of ownership, I find this jacket to be insufficient to keep me warm even on days when temps are in the 30's. The hood, if you can call it one, is useless. Do yourself a favor and buy a lower-priced winter jacket at Sears or some other big-box store where you can examine the jacket for warmth and overall quality. You'll save a lot of hard-earned cash and be happier with your purchase than I am with mine. In general, I recommend you stay away from Columbia and Northface - they are ripoffs! The only reason I did not give the coat one star is because it has not fallen apart after wear - yet!

The inner coat is filled with down and while warm its so fine that it goes threw the jacket's fabric and you get down feathers all over the place.  Most of the insulation will eventually find its way outside your jacket.

This jacket is the best I've ever owned.  Not only is it warm but it also allows the wearer the freedom of movement needed during outdoor activities like skiing or snowboarding:  Unlike lesser jackets, the waist doesn't ride up if you lift your arms above your head.

The Omni Heat + goose down combination is extremely effective.  I truly doubt anyone could ever feel cold while wearing this jacket.  I've even held my arm under a running tap to test the waterproofing; it passed with flying colours.

My only minor gripe about the jacket is its length.  I'm 6'4" so I wish it were just a little longer.  For people who are less tall, the length should be perfect.

In summary, if you're looking for the best jacket available for outdoor sports, save yourself some time and just buy yourself this Columbia.

This jacket is replacing a North Face Windstopper fleece I have used for the last few years.  I have had number of soft-shells and fleeces over the years to compare to, here are my thoughts:

Fit - The tall length is perfect for me (6'5") with adequate sleeve length.  The width (girth) of the jacket seems a little big, if you are between sizes or unsure, go with the smaller size.

Construction - Seams seem good, and the jacket is well constructed of robust fabric that seems to be ubiquitous on soft shells.  The zipper is mid-level, and I wish a beefier one was there.

Overall, nice jacket would buy again for the price.

I returned it.

Things I liked:

Size: The size was ok, I'm a fairly big guy (6'3" 225 lb) and a Large fit me ok. I don't lift weight though. No V shape.

Blue: I liked the blue. Not sure why the other person who left a review complained about it, its very obvious in the picture. Why would you buy it if you  didn't like blue.

The things I *didn't like* about it are:

Fabric: Its not a thin windbreaker jacket, its a fairly thick all artificial material rain jacket, the fabric makes noise when you wrinkle it or move, I felt that when I was walking it was going to be annoying. The whole jacket feels stiff. Like a straight jacket adn I didn't feel it was going to 'wear in' as its all man made and too thick to fold. It would be fine if you live in a rainy climate and protection is more important than style.

Hood: The hood is permanantly attached. Not a deal breaker but I didn't anticipate wearing it in the rain that much, it was mostly supposed to be a Fall and Spring jacket for me. The hood itself is nice and it fit my head nicely. Not too big. Again, I liked the blue.

Zipper: The zipper seems cheap with small teeth that I felt they were going to break with repeated use. Even zipping it up a couple times made me feel like I was damaging the teeth. Like they weren't aligned correctly, but they were of course. For a weather jacket the teeth should have been bigger and given the jacket a secure feel.

Flap: The the zipper has a top to botton flap that seals with a few velcro patches. You can see in the picture, it gives the jacket a sealed look covering the zipper. The flap gets in the way of trying to zipper up. The top part has a spread collar style and it was hard to zip all the way up and I found I was already fighting with the coat to get the velcro on the flap to line up. The spread collar aspect also creates an odd have open half closed feel to the top of the neck area that I didn't like. Like they were trying to design it to be open and closed at the same time... and failed. Its better zipped all teh way up with the flap closed but I didn't think I was going to be wearing it that way all the time so it failed the casual jacket test.

Sleeves: There is a velcro adjustment band on the sleeve ends. It just seemed poorly designed. I have long arms and the sleeves were adaquate, though not long. As long as I didn't have to raise my arms up they were going to be fine. Better than most sleeve lengths for a Large.

I bought 2 recently both XXL both fit great. one however has a weird zipper it's actually on the wrong sidewhich is just weird getting used to since all my other clothes have the zipper on the correct side.

Fits wonderfully. Not too tight esp for us bigger guys.. BIG PROBLEM, the zipper is on the wrong side!!?? It is a reverseable but the black side is probably the more commonly worn side and they put the zipper on the left side?? It’s right on the orange side when reversed. So dumb!! Sadly Returning it (bcuz it fit so damn well) but that zipper tho.... ugh.

Jacket Fits slightly large around the stomach and slightly short in length, however good material and warmer than I expected it to be. The zipper is on the left which is strange to see considering its advertised as a Mens jacket. Overall happy with the product.

The jacket is very puffy so it's not like the wind breaker feel of the other bomber jacket so it's a good heavy stylish coat for winter, but the buttons feel like they are about to come off when I pull them, but overall it's a well rounded jacket, with lots of pockets. But don't forget to rock the "remove before flight" tag with it ;)

It's slightly larger than most mediums, which is probably a good thing. The jacket itself is more of a windbreaker than a jacket. The inside is very close to the same material as the outside, so what you get is more or less a two layer windbreaker/jacket. No information on where the jacket is made, which is almost always an indication it's offshore. There are NO washing/cleaning instructions on the tags either. :( Side note; look at the zipper pull tab - sharp! lol
The large was too large for me (I'm 6 feet and 150), so I gave it to my brother, who loves it.

at 245# and 6'1" a 2xl fit perfect lots of room just like ordering from a big name outfit at less than half the cost. Great buy! order like your expensive dress shirts same size. don't try to order one size bigger it'll be too big. only complaint...zipper is on backwards made for the orange side first, then the green side. works as intended. I like the quality.

Thin-framed, 6'3", 205lbs. Size Large, Burgundy and Orange. The fit was good.

I really like the color of this jacket and being a Hokie fan, the reversible to Orange would have made that color actually a little useful as well. It fit well and was relatively comfortable.

My big problem though, is in the look of it. For years I had settled for clothes that didn't look or fit perfectly but were reasonably priced. I have a different standard now and this just didn't meet it.

I personally am not a fan of the external material. I don't know anything about it, but it's shiny and seems to hold creases.

The worst part for me though was the arms. They have a larger diameter giving me, what appear to be, really fat arms. I think I saw another person use the word 'poofy' which is exactly right. The "Erin Garments" jacket that I like is relatively tight to the arms and you can see a gap between the elbow and torso when your hands are in your pockets. But this jacket made me look like a a big, burgundy marshmallow.

A year ago I may have just sucked it up and been content with it. But I couldn't do it and had to return this.

I got this jacket after being VERY happy with another bomber, the "Erin Garments Padded Bomber Jacket" here on Amazon. It doesn't have as many colors but I'd recommend taking a look at it.
VERY GOOD PRICE & QUALITY !!!
Ordered a medium, its more like a large
A little to small but still fits
Pretty dope jacket everyone at work likes it I love it super warm says reversible but the orange side seems too soft to wear on the outside that side was definitely made to be on the inside ha

I bought this jacket primarily because of the item description, with cost also being a factor. The next day, I decided to browse the reviews on the jacket and found mostly negative reviews concerning sizing, zippers, pockets, missing pockets, etc. Feeling certain that I would be returning this jacket, I ordered a similar jacket from a different seller at a significantly higher cost. I just received this jacket today and, I don't know, maybe I was lucky, but my jacket looks great! It fits perfectly and has none of the issues raised in other reviews. I don't know why that is, but I would definitely buy this jacket again, and I'm sorry I jumped the gun to buy another at a higher cost without first seeing this jacket for myself. Hopefully the second jacket is as good as this one.
