product_title: Mizuno Running Men s Breath Thermo Jacket

reviews.review_body: Great running jacket.  Mizuno is not the usual running jacket brand.  But really, it puts the major brands to shame in terms of quality and comfort.  Warm when you need it and does not overheat in warmer weather.  Wind and rain resistant.  Orange color is perfect for running.  Has pockets.  Robust zipper.  Vented back. Best running jacket I've ever owned.  Buy with confidence: good value, excellent construction and fits true to size.

product_title: ArcticShield Arctic Shield Mens Classic Waterfowl Parka

reviews.review_body: warmest jacket I got thanks!!!
this is a good product but warmth is not up to standard to the original suit I bought.

Love this jacket it's warm and has all the right pocket. I'm 6 ft 5 280lbs and it fits great xxl. It's cut long with a little extra Leng in the back to avoid drafts which is awesome. It's hard for me to find jackets cut long.

product_title: Columbia Men s Sawyers Creek Softshell

reviews.review_body: coat is nice, keeps you dry and warm but the downside is when you take it off it is basically a disco ball. I can deal with it but be prepared to get a ton of comments haha.

This jacket was bought by my boyfriend, he absolutely loves it! It looks really nice and fits very well. It is definitely warm, wind-resistant, and water-resistant.  The only potential bad part about the jacket is that it is very very thin, which I was not expecting. Despite it's thinness, it is very warm down to at least high 30s. You'll also want some gloves and ear warmers if you wear it at the lower temps!

Really comfortable, fits snug, but not too snug, thin and warm.  This has become my favorite daily jacket- I wear it to work, school, everywhere...  The zippers don't get in the way when you put your hands in the pockets and they work well.  I'd recommend buying it.

Initially, I bought a small, and though it fit really well in the arms, chest, and shoulders, the waist was too tight, but the medium is just right.  For reference, I'm 5'11, 160 lbs, lean build.
I ordered this jacket, and have mainly been wearing it layered with

I had been looking for an all round jacket for the cooler northern California climate. I finally am thrilled with a purchase. Lightweight, well fitting jacket, that is just warm enough that you don't want to remove it when you jump into your car, or enter your office, and warm enough to defend against the chill factor. I have looked at umpteen jackets, shells, etc. This is simply the best. Almost feels like the degree of warmth varies based on the weather outside. I think I will be wearing this in 10 out of the 12 months in the year..

product_title: Element Men s Alder

reviews.review_body: Very classic. A good in-between of a windbreaker and a coat

The jacket has a great fit, even though it does not have an elastic band at the waist, it is not loose. Material is nice, it is water proof but does not look as a sport jacket, it looks casual. The hood is large and comfortable to wear. Fully recommended.

product_title: Columbia Men s Rain Scape Jacket

reviews.review_body: I bought this for my husband to use over his packable down jacket.  It fits well and looks very nice. It also packs very well. It’s light weight and works great keeping him dry.

I love the colors and the way it feels, it’s a little more substantial than most lightweight rain jackets but it’s not hot or heavy. Feels really well made too. I’m short (5’5”) and chonky so I appreciated the Velcro on the wrists to keep it from hanging too low over my hands. I ordered an XXL and it’s plenty roomy but doesn’t look massive. Overall very happy with it.
Quick shipment and good product.
Exchanged M for S. Small fit much better than medium; he is 5’7 and 160 lbs.
Absolutely rainproof! I deliver outdoors and when it rains this keeps me completely dry!
excellent for extended walks due to excellent repellency and high visibility

I finally found a jacket that fits. For decades (50yrs+) I have always gotten jackets that have short sleeves. Even the "XXXXT" jackets had sleeves that were too short. This is a wonderful surprise. There is also a longer body on the jacket as well which is another plus. I haven't tried it in the rain yet though - we're having a dry spring..
Product quality is OK. I don't give 5 stars only because size is a little bit big. I usually use XXL but based on previous post, ir ordered XL and fits OK (if I order XXL proably I had to change it)
Just got it so I don't know how well it works but I can say that size wise it runs large.  Normally I like xxl tall but just got a xxl.  It's more than big enough for me and plenty long.
value for money jacket

I bought this right before the rainy season set and I don't regret it at all.  Great color, is very lightweight, good water dispersion.  It even packs up real small in your bag for those multi-seasonal-weather-change kinda days.  Go one size down, they run big.

product_title: Salomon Men s Nova Soft Shell Jacket

reviews.review_body:
Excellent jacket, light, comfortable and warm (for moderate cold). Good finish, size fits perfectly.
Glad I bought it !

product_title: Columbia Men s Trail Fire Windbreaker Jacket Small Black

reviews.review_body: This is my second one of these jackets.  I had one for 2 years and it has been an incredible jacket.  Then I lost it and had to find another.  Luckily Amazon had it posted and I bought it again.  This jacket is so lightweight and warm.  It's got to weigh like 3 or 4 ounces.  Well maybe not that light, but you can barely tell you have it on.  Wind protection is fantastic.  It's very packable.  I can roll it up into a small ball that fits into my hand.  It has the Omni-Shield silver lining which "does" help to keep me warm in the Colorado winters.  It can be too light if the temp is too cold and you have wind and snow.  Otherwise, I wear this thing all the time.  The hood is nice but there is no way to secure it around your head (no drawstring).  Overall - excellent jacket.  Very versatile. Great price.
Great quality, superb product.
This jacket is exactly as advertised. I love it! Love the omnishield!

I wanted a windbreaker. I wear a Medium size. When the Columbia Men's Trail Fire Windbreaker arrived, not only was it tissue paper thin, but it was so small, I couldn't even get it on. The label read Medium, but it certainly was not Medium. I returned it for credit. It took many emails with the company asking for my email, before I finally understood that Amazon.com strips out any email in all correspondence, so if this happens to you, give you email, but put a dash or something other than the @ symbol. I have no idea why Amazon.com would strip away the email between a customer and one of their companies, but they do. Once they finally got my email straight, they send me a return authorization immediately. Some weeks later, and after the credit did not appear on my credit card for the return, I had to file another return with Amazon.com to get them to respond. Now, at last, they have credited my credit card, but not for the full amount. Only the windbreaker charge was credited. I didn't get credit for the Sales Tax I had to pay. I notified Amazon.com that the Sales Tax was not refunded, but I got the standard response from one of their computers. So beware. Not all Amazon.com products are what they appear to be.
Perfect for rainy spring days in the northwest.  Not too warm, but keeps the rain off and is easily packable.

product_title: Columbia Men s Key Three II Softshell Jacket Buffalo X Large

reviews.review_body: Bought this as a gift for my brother - the size fits perfectly and it is a great jacket overall. Comfortable and warm. Great quality.

reviews.review_body: Poor quality and looks
The jacket keeps me dry, but there is no way to synch the hood.  This is a big design flaw. The hood folds around my face to the point I have to hold it in place in order to see.  Very disappointed!
this is price fix for large size since the large size are super big at store it was fit by 100% this is misslead people and way of scamming
love it

This fit my guy perfectly and has protected him on some very wet hikes
Tried this out even with bad reviews. I had my wife turn the mist on and point it up high above me to simulate a light rain. Water came straight through after only 3 minutes out of the package.
Bought for great nephew for Christmas
what a price and great rain jacket I ended up buying 3 and gave one to a friend
Very happy with the purchase.. very light and thin but at the same time very warm and comfortable. Easy to put in bag. Very recommended
The waterproof is ok.
The jacket was a Christmas gift and he is happy with it.

This jacket is very light weight and blocks the wind very well. Only downside is it is very thin so it will not keep you very warm. I had planned to use it with a sweatshirt underneath so this is not an issue for me but it’s something to keep in mind.

The teeth of the zipper are very small which I am not a fan of but isn’t a big issue. I’m not sure if it’s designed that way to help block more wind or not.

The front pockets are fairly spacious and zip closed. They are made of a mesh material.

I am 6’ and ~200lbs and the large fits nice, if a little loose.

product_title: Helly Hansen Men s Tofino Cis Jacket

reviews.review_body:
To start, Helly items run small! Luckily, I was able to try one of these jackets on in my normal size (M) and it was too small. The Large was just fine!

The zip-in feature (like most of the upper-end jackets have nowadays) is great. Living in Florida, I can use it as a rain jacket most of the year, then zip-in the fleece for a colder weather jacket for the few months I need it. The breathability of the jacket is amazing. I never get sweaty wearing it when it warms up a little (or I warm up a little) and it has the zippable armpit areas for extra breathability.

The jacket is very waterproof and the hood will stay flipped up, if you will, to allow the water coming down the hood to run off the side, rather than in your face over the front of the hood. Handy feature when it's raining or there is a tropical storm...

Overall, great jacket for the price. I hope to have mine for a long time!
Excellent jacket !! i love it

I tried on a L in this jacket at a local retailer (which is the size I would normally wear), and it was too small for me. I figured I would order an XL and it would fit perfectly. But the XL fits almost exactly as the L. It's a very small make, and I am very surprised at the size difference between a L and XL. I am very surprised how small the XL is, and would definately not fit most XL friends I have.
Fit well and is still going strong 4 years later.

This is very comfortable and a durable jacket. However, I still need to test it in a storm. I think it will survive a storm and keep
  me dry!
Totally sick jacket! Its been all over the world thru every condition possible and never let's me down. I love that it has a inner fleece that is removable. Great lodge liner

reviews.review_body: Great jacket but not warm for my husband for the winter. Returned.
Great jacket. Definitely not as heavy as I expected but was still more than warm enough.

I purchased this for my husband for Christmas.  He loves it.  It's much lighter than most of his winter coats, yet keeps the warmth in.  We do have cold winters in the midwest!
The navy is a true color, and it's a "fitted" coat.
I ordered a Fjällräven Expedition Pack Down Hoodie from Outland USA. They delivered it via FedEx. The jacket is gorgeous. And I look forward to shopping with Oakland USA again.

This will probably be the first review on this item, so I’ll make it as useful and possible!

I’m going on a big bear camping trip this weekend and it’s going to be 25 degrees at night and 55 degrees in the day time. I needed a nice comfortable jacket to keep me warm at night, so I went with Fjallraven!

Upon receiving this item (which came a full day earlier) I was happy that it fit perfectly. I ordered a size XS in mens. For size reference I have a slim build, 5’6” 125lbs. The length is perfect and the sleeve length is perfect. There’s just enough room to wear a sweater underneath. The jacket isn’t too puffy at all and it’s very comfortable. I’ve been wearing it since I opened it 4 hours ago. I wish there was forest green available, but I’m 100% happy with the black. We’ll see how it holds up on my big bear camping trip!

Right now it is 100 degrees.  I am sure this top will do well.  It fits very well and should work good on a cold winter day underneath wader straps.  Will keep my elbows dry if I am in deep water.

But when I got it it wasn't what I wanted. It does not have a zipper on the front so you have to put it on like a shirt. The neck part goes almost to your chin and you can't put it down. There is only one pocket on the front. Now if you are planning to use this and you are an extreme outdoors person then this is a great jacket. But if your like me and want something warm and simple then this is not for you.

Not the product advertised at all. It's a extremely heavy canvas jacket with no hood. Spoke with Amazon and sent me another and same wrong jacket. Obviously returned. Going to just go to Cabelas and buy the one I wanted. But so y'all know this is a different jacket than pictured.

Jacket exactly as pictured. Made of a durable, weather resistant fabric. Runs a little bit small, so I ordered the next size. I have two of these; one in forest camo and the other in the tan. I use these for hunting and everyday wear. I wear a light puffy or sweatshirt underneath.
Very durable

Great quality item, seems well made and durable.  I'm typically an XL but bought a 2XL and it fits well with a little extra room that I wanted to layer when needed.  I love the forest Camo pattern and will use this for everything from waterfowl to deer to upland hunting.

product_title: Columbia Men s Triple Trail Shell

reviews.review_body: El producto comprado llegó a tiempo y es de buena calidad. Estoy satisfecha con la compra realizada. Espero me sirva para el frío, aun no lo he probado.
Nice shell if it fit better. The sizing is a small. I returned it for the next size up and it fits and works great.
This jacket is nice and warm but not enough room for my husband to wear anything other than a shirt underneath. He has other Columbia jackets and this one fits much smaller.

I bought the Columbia Men's Triple Trail shell and it has been excellent in all kinds of weather. Ever since I bought it, the weather where I live has been in the negative. The Omni-heat inside of the coat has kept me warm even with just wearing a short sleeve shirt. The Omni-tech on the outside of the coat has been excellent repelling rain, snow and ice while the water-tight zippers keep the moisture from entering inside the jacket. The hood fits over helmets for skiing and snowboarding. The cuffs are velcro and adjustable. It is very light-weight and durable. It has two zippers on the main zipper so when it gets too hot on the slopes, you can just zip the bottom one to cool down without having to unzip the whole jacket.

  It's the best Columbia jacket I have ever owned and I've owned 8 Columbia jackets now. I feel like the sizing is right on for me, but I guess it depends on what you do and how many layers you plan on wearing underneath. I doubt you will need to wear multiple layers because of how warm the coat will keep you even with just a long sleeve shirt underneath. I highly recommend this jacket!

It's the fist time I buy a Columbia product but I don't think their cut fits the athletic body type.
The jacket runs very tight under the arms on me. It is uncomfortable. If you're a v-shape kinda guy,
it might not be for you. Going a size higher wont help as the jacket is then too long and the sleeves too.
Apart from the cut, it's a great jacket.

It feels durable and it does an excellent job stopping the snow and wind even in gusts 60+ mph. I've worn it on a few winter hikes in NH and my only complaint is that the zipper tends to jam. I talked to Columbia about this problem and they advised me to buy some zipper lubricant and try that. The zipper lube improved things enough that I'll keep the jacket but my confidence in it is a little shaken. It's not good when you have to take your gloves off and use both hands to finish zipping your hard shell. If it weren't for the zipper problem this would be a 5 star shell.

Sizing: I usually wear a medium jacket but I ordered this in large because I tend to wear it over multiple fleece layers. When I'm layered up it fits pretty good. The arms are a little long but that doesn't really bother me.

Kept me warm  and dry during the 1-2 hours I had to be outside.
Was wearing a fleece jacket as 1st inner layer.
Midlayer was a Mountain Hardwear Zonal Jacket.
This shell was excellent protecting from cold wind/ rain/snow.
ORDER a size LARGER. Needless to say, this shell is the last part of your layering system.

The jacket would be fine if the temps are 30-40 but I wouldn't recommend it in colder temps unless you layer up.  I tested it out in below zero temps and felt the cold coming through.  I ended up returning this and getting the Spyder Dolomite Hoody instead, which is super warm compared to this jacket.
Very good
I am surprised how warm this is.  It folds up very small for packing which is awesome.
Looks sick
Warm and light weight.

Excellent ski jacket, especially for springhish skiing. Feel the windproofness and breathability. Light,yet warm enough.

product_title: Woolrich Men s Absolute Insulated Softshell Jacket

reviews.review_body:
I think it looks pretty damn good; I feel confident walking around in it. It breaks the wind, protects against water, and keeps me relativity warm. The sleeves have elastic and the bottom has a drawstring thingy, so wind stays out. The collar takes a few uses for the right side to stay down

It is a lot lighter of a jacket than I was expecting. Its more 'wind breaker' rather than 'jacket' but still does a decent job of keeping me warm.

product_title: Columbia Men s Omni Heat Squall Line Insulated Fishing Liner

reviews.review_body: this liner fits very good not loose but comfortable looks great and is warm by itself  nice liner would recommend strongly
This jacket has been amazing! I've been wearing it for years now and it still looks great on me. It was everything I asked for.

I bought this jacket to replace the fleece one that came with my interchangeable parka. So far though, I haven't had to use it because the winter has been quite mild. I have used it in 30 degree weather and it is quite warm. The shiny omni-heat lining really does work. It is surprising how lightweight this jacket is given how warm it is.

This jacket is very lightweight, fits great, and very warm.  The omni-heat lining looks like a space-suit and does exactly what it claims---it keeps you warm. I was pleasantly surprised when I recently wore it in 30 degree weather---It kept me warm without the bulk of a heavy coat.  It fits true to size and looks great.  I only wish it didn't have the Performance Fishing Gear symbol silk screened on it, I don't fish but love the jacket!

product_title: Salomon Men s Charvin Softshell Jacket

reviews.review_body:
This jacket is a great running jacket for mild temperatures.  As long as you know what your getting, you'll love it.  It is a breathable, form fitting jacket great for cold windy days.  Once you get colder than 30 degrees fahrenheit you will probably need an additional layer below, or a heavier jacket.  Also, water resistance is minimal.  Do not wear this jacket in significant rain.  A mist is fine, as the jacket has some water resistant properties, but the approach for this jacket is breathability over protection from the elements.

Fit:  I am a 5'10" male, 160 lb who wears almost exclusively medium clothing.  This jacket, like all other Salomon apparel I own, fits perfectly.

Style:  One of my favorite features of this jacket is the look.  I own the black jacket with red zipper and it is one of the best looking jackets I have ever seen.

Bottom Line:  If you want to look good, stay relatively warm, and not be bogged down by heavy clothing, I fully recommend this jacket.

product_title: Gore Bike Wear Men s Contest 2 0 Active Shell Jacket Red Black White Small

reviews.review_body: I bought this for my brother who is an avid cyclist. He was very pleased with it and said that it kept the wind out as he rode.

This would have been a great jacket for me in the cooler season.  However, Gore apparel seem to be made for women!  This is the 2nd time I've gotten burnt will bike tops too small.  I am 6', 190lb and the Large size is too small.  This is a jacket, not jersey and I think it is not unreasonable to want to wear a baselayer underneath.  As is, the arms are not long enough.  The chest/shoulders are too restrictive, and the front is not long enough--looks ridiculous.  I would have exchanged it for an XL but I'm done with Gore--I will stick to Pearl Izumi for my gear.
Nice jacket keeps wind out and packs small in its own pocket.
The product was nice. But after wash it the letters fall down. I suggest chance the quality of the products.
I love the bike wear from Gore and this jacket is no exception. Super light shell in top quality. Perfect fit and functionality.
it's ok, but during heavy training i got sweat,

Por los comentarios compré una talla L, generalmente compro M, esa decisión fue asertada, mido 1,70 cm con 75 kg. siendo algo grueso de contextura, la chaqueta me quedó perfecta, posee una convinación de colores hermosa, es muy liviana, con viento es genial. El envío a Chile se completó en 7 días. Es de muy buena calidad con excelentes terminaciones.

Nice jacket, but the large had too much material in the arms and chest. I usually find large jerseys snug, so a little surprised at this fit, which is descibed as slim on the Gore website. I'm returning and will try a medium.

I am 6'1" and weigh 185 lbs.  Normally I wear an extra large in most of my bikewear jerseys.  In the case of the Gore bike products you will need to go up a size if you expect that kind of fit.  I ordered an XXL in the case of the Contest Jacket and it fit perfectly.  Read other reviews and I think you will see the same kind of comment.  The product itself is excellent and exactly as described.

This is a great piece for a road cyclist.  This jacket is fairly pack able (a bit too bulky for a jersey pocket in my opinion) seems to breath well and definitely keeps the water and wind away.  The small tail in the back is a vice feature to keep your back side a little more dry.  Bottom line a jacket like this is a must have. I am 6'0
170 lbs and a large fits perfect. I often need the length of a large but the fit of a medium, not this time. Colors look great too!
Great top but too small.  Had to go a size bigger than normal but that seems to be the norm with biking gear.  Would have loved it otherwise

I wanted something to keep the wind off me during chilly morning rides, this fits the bill perfectly.  Easily packs down into a jersey pocket when it warms up.  I have been really impressed with how well this stops the wind given how light it is.  Build quality is top notch.

I am 6'3", 195lbs with a 42" chest, shirt size is 16 1/2 x 35. After obsessing for a couple of days I went with the XXL based on the sizing chart on the Gore website and off of a few reviews I found on the web.  When I got it the chest seemed a little bigger than I expected, but the sleeve length was just right.  Thought about returning it for an XL, but I was afraid the sleeves might be too short.  Turns out the extra fabric in the chest is not a problem at all with just a jersey underneath, and will probably be a benefit if I want to layer it over something warmer.

Highly recommended.
Love this jacket however the size runs bit small. Get a size larger to feel comfortable. Its just way too tight.

I use this jacket as a shell in cold, wet, or windy riding. It works well at keeping water and wind off of your body. It fits close to the body, like lots of cycling clothing. I'm able to wear a Pearl Izumi Thermal Select long sleeve + a base layer underneath of it.  However if you wanted to use a lot of thicker layers underneath you might want to go up a size. One gripe is that the zippered rear pocket kind of flops around and can get twisted or inverted.

I purchased this jacket for use riding in the rain and cold. The Gore Contest jacket will keep you very dry in the rain but what is even better is how it keeps stinging cold wind away from your body. I cycle in the winter using this jacket and a long sleeve jersey, and if it is cold enough, sometimes a thin wicking layer underneath it. Even cycling below freezing, when using layers this jacket is component to a superior system. During the early winter and late fall, it can be below 40 when I start my ride but heat up to the 50s. This jacket can be rolled down and placed in a rear pocket. It will completely fill one of your pockets but as long as you fold/roll neatly it fits perfectly.

I've owned a few Gore jackets for biking and other sports (windstopper, GoreTEX, etc.) and I'm a bit disappointed by this jacket. It does not seem quite as well thought out as many of their other jackets. The Gore Windstopper fabric is still great quality though. It does what it's made out to be, for the most part, but I would not pay a cent more for it.

Pros
+ Small fits snug enough to not flutter, but loose enough to allow for some layering (I'm 5'6" and 145 lbs).
+ Repels a great deal of water (I was still dry even after a 3h ride with pretty much constant rain).
+ Breathable, as one would expect from Gore.
+ Lightweight.

Cons,
- White sections were no longer white after a single ride (unlike previous Gore windstopper jackets I've owned, the dirt did not wash off at all).
- Back pocket tends to hang out from under the jacket when the back rides up, and everything in the mesh pocket will get wet and muddy (don't put your phone in there without a ziploc bag to protect it!) - a simple fix would be to attach the bottom of the mesh pocket to the jacket.
- Back pocket zipper feels like its going to fall apart any minute.
Good quality for a reasonable price.

This is a good jacket for its intended use that is built to last. It's not the lightest and smallest but compresses down to easily fit in a jersey pocket (but don't plan on anything other than your house key in with it). The windstopper fabric reduces wind chill about 95%, and, even without any vents, the material is remarkably breathable so you aren't marinating in your own juices at the top of a climb. I can adequately regulate temperature by slightly opening the zipper pulling up the cuffs a bit (cuffs have both elastic and velcro so comfortable and will stay put). I wouldn't want to depend on this jacket in an extended downpour, but it has kept me dry in occasional showers and on a long ride in mist and drizzle on the Blue Ridge Parkway.

It's a good fit for general cycling but not super form fitting; however, this allows adequate room for layering and year-round use and it's comfortable off and on the bike. I'm 6', 175 lbs and find the large true to size with adequate length in the sleeves and tail. I can wear it over my soft-shell cycling jacket in winter but it isn't excessively loose over just a summer jersey. There is some wind noise on the descents but it doesn't puff up like a parachute. Another good example of quality and versatility I've found in most of the Gore Bike products.

product_title: Columbia Men s Landlash Softshell

reviews.review_body: I chose this rating for efficiency and perfect the product, I like that it looks exactly like what I saw on page
It fits great and is very warm, though I got it in early Spring, it hasn't been tested is serious winter cold yet.

I bought this shell for my brother for Christmas. It was much lighter weight than I expected, and definitely not warm enough for where he lives, but it is still a nicely made jacket. I bought it thinking it would zip into his Columbia jacket, since its labelled as interchangeable. Nope, no way. The zippers are not compatible at all, but this is an issue with Columbia's labeling. I've looked at other shells since and others also listed as interchangeable will not zip in and others that are not listed as interchangeable will.

Love the fit (I am a bit of an athletic cut, tall and slim)  Good for cool but not cold temps, does a great job of keeping me dry and stopping the wind.  Zippers are good and easy to work, zippered pockets are a plus (I always drop things)

product_title: Columbia Men s Triteca Softshell Jacket Black X Large

reviews.review_body:
Fit as expected. Excellent overall protection!
Keeps me really warm. Really good wind blocking protection.
Excellent price
I completely recomend it!!

This jacket is a very nice warm jacket. Combined with my Columbia Fleece jacket it is really warm in colder weather. According to the size chart for Columbia I should wear a large but the jacket fit is on the small side. I would recommend getting one size larger if you want this to be comfortable and last a while.

This jacket was meant to be taken on an Alaskan cruise, which it fit the purpose perfectly. It blocked the wind when we were near glaciers, and kept me warm when I was on a glacier.

I did not get rained on, so I cannot comment on the water protection.

I normally wear a size Large shirt or jacket, but I bought an XL, and it fit great.

product_title: Columbia Sportswear Men s Fusion Exact Jacket

reviews.review_body: I got it for my brother, who is usually an extra large but he is a large in this one. I wished it was thicker but since he has been active outside, the Omni reflects his own heat back.
Awesome
I am satisfied of the Colunbia Men's Fusion Exact Jacket. The delay of the expedition was  not to long. Thank you.
Liked this coat for color and fit.  Love this coat for lightweight warmth.  Great for skiing and outdoor winter activities.

The fit is perfect, and all seams, snaps and other closures are assembled flawlessly.  I have not and likely will not ski in it ever so I can't say much to that use.  This is obviously designed for layering with other under gear for colder weather.  Very happy.

After use.... This is an outstanding product.  I wore it in 6 degree F for about two hours with only a t-shirt on under it and was still perspiring.  If it was below zero or lower I would say that the under layering would definitely be needed, but would work perfectly.

I can't say enough about how happy I am with it.
Not warm, no tuck-away hood. Not bad looking, but you make a big compromise on warmth.
Lightweight, warm and comfortable.  Good pockets.  No complaints so far.
Super cool I like it very much!

This jacket is great! Very durable and very comfortable. Keeps you dry and warm while you ride. I wore it for my first time snowboarding and was on the ground alot and it kept me dry and stayed whole after taking a beating! Would recommend to anyone!! Also a ton of awesome and very useful pockets!!

This has been awesome jacket so far, fit seems just right. I have used it a couple of times on the mountain in colder weather and it keeps me nice and toasty. Theirs also enough roam underneath to add layers as needed, but it is probably heavy enough for most days. only thing that I would like to have seen in this jacket is atlest one more regular pocket on the inside, it only has one small pocket and a mesh audio pocket. other then that this jacket is great and looks cool going down the slopes.

I bought this for my husband for Christmas. He tends to get cold when we ski, so I thought the Omni Heat lining might be great for him, and it really it.  He commented on what a big difference this jacket has made, in terms of his comfort and warmth on the slopes.

My husband is 5' 10' 160 lbs and sometimes wears a medium, sometimes, a large (arm length is usually what pushes him to the large).  I tried the medium and it fits perfectly.  Plenty long enough in the body and arms, and roomy enough for several layers underneath.

product_title: STS Ranchwear Men s Brazos Softshell Barn Jacket

reviews.review_body: Perfect chore jacket, also looks great to wear going out. Apears to be very well made. My only complaint is that it is very thin and lightweight so not the greatest for cold weather. It's more of a spring or fall jacket. Has lots of pockets and the neckline comes up high to keep your neck warm.

product_title: Columbia Sportswear Men s Powerfly Down Puff Jacket

reviews.review_body: This is an excellent jacket. It is 800 down and very well made to ensure that the feathers don't get moved around in use. It's snug fit wits sleev covers ensures no air movement inside the jacket and the body while also ensuring full comfort of wearing and using it. I used it in iceland in late November as the only layer over the shirt. The temperatures touched - 5 degree C. But the jacket kept me warm even I was out in the cold at night for hours. Strongly recommend the product. It's slightly more expensive than what I would have liked but it exceeds the expectations on all ways.

I've been wearing this for about a week now, which is not long enough to provide a thorough review, but seeing as how no one has reviewed it yet I thought I'd get some early info out there for anyone considering purchasing this jacket.

I've been wearing it in mid-40's and windy weather all week... and it has done the job completely. It appears to be sufficiently warm and completely breaks the wind. One challenge with any down fleece is you can't get them super wet, so you definitely don't want to be stuck in a situation where this will be your only cover in a steady rain. The four pockets are handy (and warm) and the fabric extensions on the sleeves add warmth and cover those spots that are usually left exposed while wearing gloves. The zip up collar does well at protecting the neck and is not uncomfortable at all.

When going indoors it is a must to remove it because you would overheat otherwise, but the light weight and compressibility of this jacket makes it easy to stuff into a pack or bag. It can be compressed to about the size of a football, but at less weight. Wearing while unzipped does a fair job of releasing the heat.

I like the fit of this jacket... I wear medium and this appears to be true to size. It is a snug fit for my slim frame and does not look like one of those overly puffy jackets. The fabric is a matte finish, rather than the shiny finish in other brands.

While I have been evaluating the warmth of this jacket during a trip to Vancouver, BC, the real test will come next month while in Alaska. I'll update my entry after that.

UPDATE - 1/4/13
I did have a chance to wear it in Alaska in December where it was between 1 and 20 degrees.  I had to have a couple of layers on underneath, and then of course a warm hat.  But it was fine (no wind).  Later, while skiing in Washington in January at 25 degrees, it served as a good insulator beneath my Columbia shell. It has a different zipper system than the shell so it did not zip in, but that was not a big deal.
The Omni-heat works great. It reflects your body heat back like an emergency blanket. Comes with a stuff sack. Wor it in 10 below weather.
High quality garment.  The quality is apparent from the zippers to the fabric.  I would recommend this item as a solution to moderately cold days.
This was bought as a present for my son & he loves it.  It is warm and light weight which is exactly what he wanted.  I highly recommend this jacket!
I hung out fishing in single digits all day and only had a long sleeve shirt on underneath. I HATE to be cold and I was more than toasty all day long. I highly recommend this coat for maximum warmth
Best of all I have tried, and I have tried wearing this type of sweater/jacket from other more highly rated manufacturers.
This jacket is very warm, but does tend to loose more down that I would have expected. Compresses nicely to go into a backpack.
Very nice jacket.. I love it  it's  very sporty keeps you very warm .. And I really recommend this jacket it's very casual also so very good for every day use..
I really like this jacket. It is light and comfortable. During active sports it is not hot. ???? ?????????? ??? ??????.

Only wearing this in winter is enough,it's very warm and fashion-forward.The warmth is as good as the north face coats,but Columbia ones are often much more fashionable.I prefer Columbia coats because not like TNF ones,they won't make others think you are from a very cold and wild mountain when you wear them in the city,while provide as much warmth as other down coats when you really wear them to go to the wild.

Very light, warm and slim jacket. Love omni heat. Keeps u warm. No need for heavy sweaters under it. Also water resistant. This is my second omni heat jacket. Love it. Not recommended for someone that wants big jacket. Slim fit.

This jacket has been warm and comfortable thru the bitter winter of 2014 in the Midwest. However, I had to swap the size medium for a large. I wear a medium in virtually every jacket I own, but it would barely zip up on me. The large fits just fine.

I really loved this jacket, the price was awesome for the product. It is very warm in cold conditions, the heat reflector inside the jacket just works perfect. I have read some reviews saying that the jacket runs small and it does, but I could handle it.

I normally wear a medium size, I am 174 centimeters tall and weigh 78 kg. This size is almost perfect, it feels just a little bit tight on the arm pit but as I have said before, I can handle it with no problem.
feathers run out of the jacket, I thought columbia's quality is good, it turn out to be just so so

I wore this jacket in temps randing from 3 degrees to upper 20's and it kept me warm and fit well. In the cooler temps, I wore a tshirt and a henley. I first put it on as I was walking outside and was disappointed at how chilly I felt, but after a few minutes it felt as if an electric blanket was turned on and I was very comfortable. The omni heat system (little reflective metallic dots) really seems to work well. The jacket does a good job of protecting you from the wind, once the bottom is cinched in and the fit was comfortable without making me look like the Stay-Puft man. I'm around 6'3" and 170 pounds with long arms. I bought the large after reading other reviews and it fit with nice length to the arms and torso.

reviews.review_body: Very Warm
Great cozy jacket and an amazing deal!
Very warm jacket and light-weighted!
Love it! Fit beautifully and looks great.
Perfect fit and nice color and design
Jacket fit my husband perfectly. Very lightweight.  We will have to wait for winter to find how warm it is.
I am 6' and 160 and a medium is a perfect fit. Warm but compresses pretty well.

Bought this jacket for my son for Christmas.  He says that even though it feels light as a feather it is amazingly warm.  He wears it every day even though he has other jackets that he likes.  Highly recommend
This is well made and very warm jacket.  I am sure I will get much use of it during the Fall to Spring seasons here in the Northeast US.  The fit is good and roomy enough not to be uncomfortable.
Very good.
Awesome jacket, it's very warm and light weight.

Awesome! I love this coat.  It's a coat, not a jacket.  It's puffy like a coat and will keep you warm in the snow or frigid weather.  It was a tad bit big for me, but I'll call it insurance in case it shrinks in the future or I grow more robust.  Will be a good coat for ski/snowboarding.

Columbia stuff is often good. Sometimes just OK. I have long arms, so that's usually my first concer. These are nice and long. The 'Mystery' color is a nice tea lush blue. Lined to give nice warmth on cold days (unless you're winter camping, or ice climbing). Not too bulky.

I've bought a few Columbia jackets, and would rate this on toward the top, especially at a Lightning Deal price.

Very satisfied with this purchase

Bought the large size... I'm 6' 190lb and jacket fits a little loose which is what I was looking for (fit is perfect if I'm wearing a sweater underneath). Plenty storage for gloves/phone/wallet.

Features
5 exterior pockets (4 pockets are down by your hands, 1 pocket is zippered on the chest)
1 interior breast pocket can close w/ velcro
Hood is also removable (zipper) which is a big plus!

Summary: I had to return it because a Medium was the size of an XL. Not sure if all Columbia jackets are like this but there was enough to wrap around me 1.5 times. Just WAY too big. It is thinner than I thought it would be for a cold weather jacket as well. I have to give it five stars thought because it looked really well made and a quality product. I would have loved it if it was sized properly. I'm not sure it would be for very cold weather but maybe 35 and above it would be enough.
Not a light jacket, not a heavy coat.  Once the colder weather comes it will be perfect.
I CHOOSE A MEDIUM , BUT IT IS TOO LARGER FOR ME.
I'm sure it's going to be a warm Jacket.  Little snug in my arm pits, but felt good and looks good
I wanted something newer for the cold winter.  It's a solid, well constructed jacket.
Fast delivery.  A little heavier (thicker) than I was expecting.  It will be too warm for cool weather but should be great for cold weather.
Has lots of pockets and I really like the way the storm hood was done. Seems very warm for how thick it is, but it's a bit big for me (a slender guy with long arms).
warm
High quality jacket. Fits as expected.

Apparently Jackets are something I'll have to buy after trying on. I normally wear a large but this jacket is just too big. I ride a motorcycle and this is a lightweight all weather jacket that would certainly keep me warm but it literally dwarfs me. I had my 6' son try it on and it was even too long on him also. Unfortunately it looks like my only option is to return it for a refund when I'd really just like to trade it for a medium size. Possibly because I bought it on a Lightning sale.

I bought this jacket because it was on sale one day and my old one like this was falling apart.  Today is the first day I've worn it and it's doing pretty well in low 40's with a 5 degree windchill.  The pockets are fleece lined and there are plenty of them.  It's fairly thin for a big coat and I don't feel like the marshmallow man in it.  I was able to drive well in it as well.

Columbia seems to have a good history of construction from my experience, so I'm hoping this will last a few years at the least.  I still have a Columbia shell from the 8th grade that will not die.  Unfortunately, it's also in neon pink, teal and purple...
Love the coat but must send back. XXL usual coat size this just too big.
I like this jacket, but it is somewhat large for me, so I would like to return to you, if possible,  it could be changed into smaller such as small (S) size. Thank you very much.

Ordered a size S for my 5'8" 170lb husband. It's friggin huge! I also think it's a bit bulky and heavy compared to other jackets on the market that cost only slightly more. Returned for the Columbia Go To jacket.

I don't know what the performance of this jacket is like, having only tried it on, it seems to be a decent coat.  The one I received is , I would guess, XXlarge, although marked large which is what I need.  I think that if one got one with a proper fit it would be a good buy at $70.

this coat is great it keeps me warm in some of the coldest temperatures we have had.

Nice coat for Autumn and Winter. Light and warm.

It's exactly what I wanted in a winter coat. Warm, plenty of pockets with asdjustable sleeves and hood. It's a perfect fit with a little extra room in the shoulders and chest, so I can comfortably wear a sweat shirt or sweater under it.

This is by far the best winter coat I have ever owned.  I keeps me warm in extremely cold whether.  It does not have a lot of bulk.  It looks great. I usually take an extra large and this coat fits very well.

Ordered the large, tried it on in a hurry, then let it sit for a while(not cold in Texas yet). Lo and behold, way too big. Ordered the medium and it,s perfect and warm. Couldn't return the large, so that stinks, but it was my own fault. Jacket is excellent.
I  bought this for my son and he loved it. It was exactly what he wanted wanted.
I'm 6"2 215lbs Xl is really true to size.This coat is not shelled more like a thin down.
I got an size like an extra large but it's actually M. But acceptable because I can wear more inside.
Looks good and feels good, but it is not winter yet, so I don't know yet how it will protect me against really cold weather.
MY SON LOVES IT - Only problem is the hood - it doesn't stay up.  Should have snaps or a string :(
Keeps the cold out a bit. Have to pair it up with a fleece jacket for any temperatures less than 20F, to keep out the cold.
too big

I typically wear an XL but ordered this coat in L after trying both on in the store. I am 6'2" and 180lbs, athletic build with long arms and wide shoulders. I would suggest buying a size smaller than you normally would and it will still be plenty big to wear a T-shirt and hoodie underneath. I wore this coat in temperatures ranging from 30 to -6 ( actual temp without wind chill), and I was toasty warm for a few hours of light walking with quite a bit of standing around. Would highly recommend this for anybody who wants a good winter jacket without too much bulk. Also love the detachable hood and lots of nice lined pockets. I orders the Mystery color which is a steel blue and black..looks awesome! For the price you are getting a great looking, quality winter coat!

Warm enough for walking to school in single digits, but still lightweight.  This is the first top-quality coat I've had, and my only complaint is the outer layer of fabric is very thin and gets caught in the zipper sometimes.  Just have to be careful.

I priced ski jackets at local stores and they were very expensive. I found this one on  amazon and the price was right. It keeps me warm and it is waterproof. It is also lightweight. What more would I want? I recommend this jacket highly.

As previous posters noted, this jacket runs very large to common sizes.  I typically wear a size large but ordered medium for this jacket and it still fits fairly loosely.

As a long time buyer of Columbia, I do not like this jacket.  It does offer layered protection but it is bulky and won't stuff down like I expected for backpacking.  The pockets were lined with a nylon that snagged the skin on my hands and actually hurt in the cold weather.

There is an insulated hood on the jacket (without a place to stow it when not needed) with chin strap but I couldn't figure out how to tighten it around my head and needed a free hand to hold it closed.

If it hadn't cost me so much to return, I would not have kept it.  But looking back I should have because I doubt I will use it much again.

Height : 5'7"
Waist: 38
Weight: 175

Bought this to replace my last Columbia jacket (dog chewed through it...long story, don't ask) which was the Antimony III. The Antimony III specs are similar to this jacket, but the PTA-II runs a tad smaller and feels lighter. I generally wear a large, but this coat feels oversized. However, with a layer, such as a thick sweater, it fits better. The Antimony III ran quite large as well and I decided to wear medium. This worked well, but layering was a chore. The 150 grams of synthetic insulation should bode well for NYC winters and water repellant fabric is a well known feature for Columbia's coats and jackets. Pockets are plentiful on the outside of the jacket with a small zipped chest pocket, two handwarmer pockets, and two large storage pockets. There is an interior pocket on the inside of the jacket, but is the only one which is a bit disappointing. The storage pockets, cuffs, and placket over the zipper close with snaps which I prefer to Velcro but some others may not. The hood is large, insulated, and adjustable with integrated lines. It zips off if you prefer the jacket without it. I'm expecting a similar level of performance from this jacket as I did the last. The Antimony III was comfortable with minimal layering down to the 20's for me. I hope that improved capacity for layering with this jacket with surpass those temperatures. New York has been a cold place to live over the past few years.

I bought this jacket like a year ago. I wear most of medium sized jackets but this one fits little bit larger. More specifically, it is little bit longer if you are short, I am 5' 6", 160lb.

Pros:
Very warm, kept me warm in Michigan winter. lots of pockets, actually 6.  Removable hood.

Cons:
larger than expected, more like a coat, button sleeve fell off very soon.

This coat is great and my son loves it.  He is too big for a kids extra large ad that leaves only a men's small.  This coat fit him well and there is room to bundle him up and still zip the coat closes.  We had some cold days thus far and he says he is nice and toasty in his Columbia coat.  What he likes is the warmth with out the puffiness.  It's also great because it's water and wind resistant.  I was ok with the price. I had just returned a coat I bought for him at a local store which is a national chain store and took it back after
1 week.  The coat that I purchased for $70.00 was loosing it's stuffing.  So that is why I looked at Columbia.  For 30.00 more I got him a better quality coat that will hopefully last him through two growing seasons.

product_title: Helly Hansen Men s Verglas Lightweight Waterprooof Windproof Breathable Hooded 3 Layer Shell Jacket

reviews.review_body: Have used the raincoat to walk on beach during rain and in kayak during rain.  Best raincoat I have owned.

So the jacket itself is a very nice, well-built, high quality, but I did end up returning it, having no front pockets was a deal breaker, it really only has the 2 breast pockets, otherwise was a very nice product.

This jacket uses very good materials and has kept me dry. It is a 3 layer design. Similar to gore-tex pro but not the same. It has a slim fit so size up if you are unsure.

I would pick this over a gore tex jacket if you can find a good deal. If they are the same or close enough in size, I'd go with gore-tex.

Overall very good though designed for hiking and mountaineering more than going to the grocery store. This is why there are 2 chest pockets on the outside and no side hand pockets (where your hip belt would go from your pack).

Helmet compatible, but can also be used without a helmet.
Very high quality product !!!

Anyway I contacted the about the inside of the pack delaminating thinking it would be covered under the lifetime warranty. That’s where I was wrong. Haven't had to wear it yet. Does run small and had to return first jacket. Looks good and we bought it for s trip to Europe. We live in Arizona so no need to wear it here

Bought this for my husband.Nice jacket but runs small.  Definitely order a size up.
Good product.  Keeps me dry in wet weather.
Too small. Gave it to my son who wears xl.

Good jacket with a flattering(fitting) cut. Good for slender folks. I'm 190cm tall(6ft 3") and wearing M and the sleeves are just right past my wrists. Size up if your girth is wider or require longer sleeves.
Went through a storm up a tropical mountain and not getting soaked but perspiration doesn't wick fast though I doubt any jacket will in a 90+% humidity.
The pockets are like bags made of mesh with the openings sewn to the openings of the pocket and you pull the entire jacket through either pockets from inside out and they become a pouch to hold the jacket with a zip enclosure.
Good quality. More fitted than most jackets in this size. Wouldn't use it with a thick sweat jacket-just does the job of a good quality rain jacket.
Great quality, you will never be wet. Perfect jacket for outdoor sports.

Good looking.  I just got it as a rain jacket but it's surprisingly warm as well.  That's been great for a cooler than normal spring.  I hope I'm as pleased in a hot summer.  It runs a bit smaller than other jackets, but as a rain protection, that's not a bad thing.  Overall, I'm pleased.

product_title: Helly Hansen 62774 Men s Verglas Down Insulator

reviews.review_body: Helli Hansen makes nice stuff.

Bought it in the summer and pulled the jacket out recently due to cold weather. I have found multiple large/small holes that have down feathers leaking through. Beautiful color looks young and original
Love this jacket. Makes for a great mid-layer under a shell or my carhartt. Super lightweight and comfy

I bought this for my husband for Christmas. The North Sea blue is a great color and a nice alternative to basic black. It is warm yet not super puffy. I would say it fits true to size. He is between a medium and large but I opted for the large. He tried it on in the helly Hansen store a month ago so I know he will love it!

I will buy it again next time  I think

After way too much time shopping around the internet and comparing features, I chose to order the Columbia "Tree Grinder" jacket over all the other options. I've only had the jacket about a week, but so far, this thing is seriously delivering on every front. Let me tell you some background: I live in one of the top three rainiest cities in the United States. I'm talking over 120+ inches/year. I do not own a car, but commute on my bicycle, everyday. This jacket is 100% WATERPROOF. I took it out of the box, rode down the street, and literally stood in the pouring rain, just to test it out. If any moisture made it through, I would have returned the jacket right away, but my upper half was powder dry. The thick outer fabric is windproof, too. The jacket is loaded with features, like waterproof pockets galore, double zippers in the front, fully adjustable billed hood, adjustable cuffs with extra length at back of hands (which can roll up to create a gutter that diverts water away from hands), ultra-futuristic NASA style reflective inner lining (Omni-Tech)... all kine stuff. I believe the design is geared towards snowboarders, as there is also a powderskirt and buttons to attach to pants. The bottom line is, you absolutely will stay dry in this thing. If I have any gripes, it it is only that breatheability is only so-so with the zippered armpit vents; and because it is a shell jacket, it runs pretty large to accommodate further layering.  But, I am talking about wearing a snow jacket in a tropical rainforest climate, so maybe you will appreciate the extra warmth. It never really dips below 60 degrees here, so I haven't had to wear any extra insulating clothes underneath the jacket. The materials are very nice, construction seems much sturdier than some of the Columbia jackets in the lower price range, and the styling is unique. Again, it does run a bit large, in my opinion, but the extra length just means that more of you is shielded from the elements. All in all, a great coat, and I highly recommend it.
