reviews.review_body: Great Jacket, Good Quality. Like to dress light during the winter and this was more then to suffice with a thermal underneath. The jacket isn't that waterproof, walked through a few downpours with it and the water just soaks through.

my husband likes the jacket but duslikes the hood. there is not a placeto store the hood and it kind of sticks up. this makes a nuce jacket loom not so nice. There are stull of tbings to like about this jacket
Very very thin. Poor insulation

Great comfortable jacket. Looks nice. This is my second one. Fits roomy but not too large. Feels really light but it is warm. Easily can keep you warm in 20F temps for a short while. I use it as my daily commuter jacket. Super comfortable for driving and it handles the short walks to and from the office in any weather.

product_title: ASICS Men s Lite Show Winter Jacket

reviews.review_body: This is a descent jacket but the hood is a major issue for me.  First of all, it is unusually big.  Secondly, it will not stay on my head if even the slightest breeze blows and where I live it is often windy.  The adjustable strings do not stay in place as the jacket is not equipped with the adjustment clips.  I bought it to run in cold weather but need to figure out a way to keep the hood from falling off.  Jacket would have earned a 5 star if not for the hood.
Nice jacket, good for running in cooler (not cold) weather. My husband loves it.

product_title: Columbia Men s Tectonic Access Softshell Jacket Medium Black

reviews.review_body: Very nice jacket. Great for spring and late summer to early fall weather. Very comfortable and well fitting!

The jacket is nice and i've had it for some time now. I've used a lot in all sorts of conditions so I feel I can give an honest option regarding this jacket.

Pro: The jacket does a good job keeping wind out and holds up good against rain. The zippers really nice and don't snag at all.

Cons: Stitching is terrible and quickly falls apart. The interior is needs some kind lining because the pockets are exposed.

Bottom line: Skip it and find something nicer.

product_title: Columbia Men s Modern Logger Jacket

reviews.review_body: light weight(because of the Omni-Heat Shield, not constrictive, solid winter coat. The weather really hasn't dropped into the teens yet but this coat has been comfy and warm on days when it's been in the mid 20's into the 30's. Inside pocket is big enough for anything you really want to carry and the exterior pockets are large as well. The Velcro on the sleeves provide a nice way to tighten up the fit when wearing gloves. Plus, this is just a style of jacket you won't see around much. Overall well worth the cost. I'm 6'4" and the fit is excellent.

product_title: Helly Hansen Mens LIFALOFT Insulator Pullover

reviews.review_body:
Upsides: Quality comfortable item. Warm but not too warm like an Arc Atom (my previous go to). Side zip is a nice touch, too, and it has pockets when most pullovers don't.

Downside: In person the orange is much more washed out and pale, which I didn't care for. Ended up receiving the wrong size and didn't reorder because the color was so far off from the pictures.

I have one of the Bajas from OR and two of these pullovers from HH and I really like all three of them. They fit on and off easily with a quality side zipper and they keep me warm down to 30 degrees F. It might work in colder but I've never had to try that (thankfully). I prefer the HH pullover because it is not as puffy as the OR Baja and also because it has two zip pockets instead of the OR kangaroo/sweatshirt type hand pocket. The HH also lays nicer on the body. Both fit about what I expect and both have decent hoods, too. The HH hood doesn't have an adjustment point though and this really needs to be upgraded. Now, you have to zip it up the middle all the way for the hood to stay in place and there are times when you want the hood stable and not zipped up all the way so please add an adjuster to the next version, HH! Otherwise, this thing is perfect and basically is the nicest sweatshirt I've ever seen. I have it in black and in orange, by the way. The orange is called 'bright orange' and it is bright but its not a neon orange or anything odd looking like that. Its quite nice really and my go-to piece for basically any cold day activities.  P.S. I bought mine on sale prices better than Amazon and directly from Helly. Hope that helps.
This jacket is perfect as a pullover. Really light on cool days but really warm on colder days. Love the waist cord, kangaroo pocket, and side zip features.

product_title: Columbia Men s Assimilate Softshell Jacket

reviews.review_body: The product shipped very quickly and I was very pleased with everything about it. Great jacket at a great price.
The product and the SERVICES was excelente, and the product was that I expect. This is  my first time in use this método of buy. I will be buying more products
SO we have had this coat now for a couple of years and I just wanted to take a moment and write to say this was the BEST purchase.  It's holding up beautifully.

product_title: Columbia Men s Omni Heat Wading Jacket Small Black

reviews.review_body: So far everything everything appears to be well constructed.  It s a great medium to light weight jacket.  If it is 45 degrees or below -- I know I need more layers.  I usually wear a large - glad I listened to the other reviewers and bought an extra large!!

I bought this as a gift for my husband.  He is small, but I ordered a medium so he would have room for a sweater underneath.  The jacket runs so small he can barely get it fastened.  I suggest getting an extra large for a person who would normally take a medium.

Just got this today so can't comment on field performance. This jacket is very lightweight. I planned to layer underneath, but this is like a heavy shell, not a puffy poly fill jacket. Hopefully the Omni-heat works as advertised. Lots of great pockets and hooks. A fisherman probably designed it. The jacket length is cut short, not sure why- maybe it's to keep it out of the water?? But that means it looks funny as a street jacket. Sleeves and chest fit great. Hood has elastic in the cap- great idea, but the fabric up the neck is a little short which pulls down on the back of the cap. I'm 6'3" 205lbs and I got the XL Sage color. Overall solid Columbia quality as usual. More colors would be good, like dark blue or olive - black is a weird color for a fishing jacket.

product_title: Ash City Core 365 Men s Techno Lite Three Layer Knit Tech Shell 2XL BLACK

reviews.review_body: Love this light weight windbreaker/jacket the reflective pinstripes are awesome. I wouldn't say it's waterproof but light rain just beads right off overall great product runs true to size.

product_title: ATG by Wrangler Men s Range Jacket

reviews.review_body: I do like this jacket and it battles the cold wind.  My only complaint is that it seems to fit a bit small for an XLT.  The length of the sleeves is fine, but it is a little tight. But then, I could lose some around my waist.  If the wearer were slimmer than myself and tall, then it would be a perfect fit.
He love's it!
This is a nice puffer jacket. It actually is surprisingly light. The design is simple. The logos are small and the rest is plain black. There are insulated pockets as well to keep your hands warm.

This is a very attractive, lightweight jacket - perfect for a chilly day, but not too heavy.  The zipper has a good, quality feel to it - the glide was smooth.  Quality jacket, for sure.  Happily recommend.

This jacket is light weight. Not warm to use in winter (unless your winter is mild).
Good quality fabric and perfectly constructed. The front zipper and the ones in the pockets works and runs smoothly.
It has a waist adjustable elastic.
Fits true to size, and has a perfect confortable length.
Great for cooler spring nights or autumn.

This jacket is very well constructed and stylish. It fit as expected for my son who is an extra large. The zipper was heavy duty and good quality and the jacket was very comfortable for him on. I felt it was a decent value.

This is an excellent jacket for knocking around in, doing yard work or etc. The zipper works nice and smooth, has side pockets that are a good size (big enough for a phone). The material is smooth and light weight and should keep you warm, this is not a bulky jacket.

The hubby has a new favorite brand for his outdoor activities! This coat/jacket is SUPER lightweight, but ample in warmth output to keep him comfy no matter what he is outside doing! And because this is a "Range jacket" he of course had to take advantage of that name by wearing it to shoot Sporting Clays - and he says that it performed with utter perfection! He also has the ATG Vest, that he just adores!
This new Wrangler brand is a TOTAL hit in our house!

Its poofy and warm. The bottom has a elastic string that you can pull down tight. I'm 6'1" and 210 pounds with a 34" waist and this XL jacket fits nice. Its a very comfy jacket for cold weather. I do really like this jacket and will be wearing it when its cold out side 40 degrees or lower.

If you find this review helpful please press the helpful button, thanks!

I got this jacket for my uncle for the Fall and Spring weather (slightly cool but not cold). Wrangler is a well known brand, one that I have used many times in the past. This ATG Men's Range Jacket, by Wrangler, is very nice. It was slightly tight in the arms, but not so much that it's unwearable. I'm definitely recommending this jacket, if you're looking for something lightweight.

This is my second "puffer" style jacket. This one seems superior in terms of warmth and style. I like that stitching between "puffs" is closer together. I like the collar also comes up high and tight enough that actually helps keep in the warmth and the wind off your neck. The zipper is super smooth and very easy to get the first teeth started without trouble.

Even though this jacket is super light and can compress down, it does not appear to be packable. There is no interior pocket like my other puffer that allows it to be folded inside itself.

This Wrangler puffer jacket is not very fluffy, I was assuming it was going to be like a quilted type; which it does look like one, but does not feel like one. Yes it does have some fluff to it so I cannot say it completely flat, still it is not very puffed up either so its alright. Wrangler is a great company so I know the quality in the seams and fabric are there, but they did cheap out in the insulated department. Overall it does keep you Simi warm, the only downfall it has is the inside is not lined; So therefore you have the same material that is on the outside of this jacket on the inside as well, even the pockets have that same "outside fabric" inside them. The medium does fit him pretty well, for reference my husband is 5'11, 160lb with wide shoulders. Still I do recommend as this jacket is very nice.

The jacket has a fluffy feel which I liked and its very lightweight.  I have been using it for a while and it has become my “to go” jacket now. I cant say about other sizes but the medium size fits nicely and is as expected.

The zipper is pretty easy to close and runs very smooth. The jacket stays pretty warm and is all right for light cold weather. But it is definitely not the right choice for a temperature approaching the freezing point.

I have washed it once in the machine (because I spilled coffee on it and it was anyways looking a little dirty). I was surprised to see that it retained its texture and the same feel. There was absolutely no damage due to washing (but that doesn’t mean, I am suggesting to wash it every week ;).

Overall, it’s a nice light-weight jacket which I live to wear.

My son absolutely loves this jacket. It is so warm and comfortable without being too bulky. He loves the look of the jacket, the fit And the feel Of it is fabulous. As I said it’s not too bulky like some puffer jackets can be. It fit him true to size and was not too tight. The quality of this jacket is fabulous and it’s perfect for cold days.

This is a great jacket for blah weather. When its cold and windy but not necessary raining or snowing.  Water resistant, ultra soft , and very warm jacket.  Has the trendy puff style look.  No hood.  Banded wrists and adjustable waist to help keep blah weather off of you.  Has interior hook attached to easily hang this up when getting to your destination.  My guy is 6’ 250 lbs and this fits him very well, and is slimming on his form.

As soon as I removed this jacket from the packaging and slipped it on I liked it. It has a slightly shiny smooth and soft material inside and out. It slides on without the resistance of the jacket it is replacing which had a cloth interior that would pull rather than slip when putting it on.

This jacket is light weight, not very thick, and feels quite comfortable. I also like the length because I often wear shirts that are not tucked in. This jacket is just long enough to fully cover my shirts.

The side pockets are zippered which is great because they are secure from things possibly falling out. Additionally the pockets are not shallow.

This is a cool weather, not a cold weather, jacket which is perfect for me. We live in an area where the daytime temps rarely drop below 40 degrees. The sleeves have a soft elastic around the wrist which isn't too tight but will keep the wind out. There are drawstrings around the bottom of the jacket which I'm not likely to use but some others might.

The only thing I don't like is the "stand up collar"  which tends to touch my cheeks when the jacket is not fully zipped up. Perhaps the collar will not stand up after some use, or I could put a stitch in it to keep the collar down. I don't think the stand up collar is needed on a jacket of this temperature range.

Being water resistant is also perfect for me as this city does not usually receive hard rain.

I highly recommend this jacket.

I’m a little out of the loop when it comes to Male fashion these days, but I keep seeing these Hollywood Stars wearing a similar style.

This is an excellent jacket. It’s so lightweight, yet warm and waterproof. Made by Wrangler, it’s well sewn and finished, with smooth gliding heavy-duty zippers, and ample zippered pockets. It has a concealed drawstring around the bottom, I suppose, for keeping the wind out.

It fits my husband, true to size, and is pretty darned good looking. For being as padded as it is, it doesn’t look bulky. It’s low maintenance too! Being 100% Polyester, it’s machine washable in cold water/low tumble dry. You can’t ask for too much more than that! It arrived pleasantly packaged also, complete with its own hanger and a full plastic bag – no creases!

I wouldn’t hesitate to purchase this first-rate garment and am appreciative of the opportunity to receive and review it.

Comfortable quality made jacket, the M runs true to size in the body however just a tad short in the arms. Anyone with broader shoulders or longer sleeve length, this could be an issue. Everything other than the sleeves fit great.

This jacket is really warm while also being lightweight. It's not thin, this jacket is definitely on the fuller, puffy side. Full thicker collar for neck warmth. Strong zipper with a good zipper pull.
The hand warmer pockets are good sized, not lined.
No interior pockets, which is surprising. Not a deal breaker but worth mentioning.
Polyester to repel weather.

My son really likes this jacket. He lives in the city and does a lot of walking; it gets cold here and so far this has been a warm and all the pockets make it a very useful jacket. Looks good, too!

I really like this jacket. It is very lightweight and the repellent fabric is great to keep that blowing wind away from your body as well as any light rain/sprinkling. This does keep me very warm on those colder days outside with it's warm insulation design without being as bulky as my super thicker winter coat. I like that the pockets have zippers so that if I need to place phone or keys in those pockets I have the option to zip it up to ensure they will be secure. I also like the vertical zip pocket on the chest area of the jacket so I can put my keys in there and still have the lower pockets available for my hands.
Jacket fit perfect. Looks great. Great quality.

product_title: Under Armour Men s ColdGear Reactor Hybrid Lite Jacket

reviews.review_body: Just received and it looks amazing. Very lightweight

product_title: Columbia Men s Peak II Shell Jacket Small Black

reviews.review_body:
I am 5'8" 175 #,  neck 15.5, chest 40, waist 35, arm 33-34
I have bought two of these shell, medium and large; the medium is a little bit tight, the large is a little bit loose, but if you need layers is better the large. It is  light not thin, strongly waterproof capability. I used it walking La Via Francigena, Italy for three days( 8 to 12 hours) under downpour, 45 °F.  and winds
The Jacket  keep the water from coming in, while allowing moisture to escape from within. The jacket does all of this, while still maintaining the ability to block out the wind. Good underarm zips.
This is the perfect rain jacket for hiking.

product_title: Columbia Men s Compounder Shell Jacket

reviews.review_body: this guy is awesome - 95% waterproof - some leaking around the zipper but the best rain jacket i've ever owned.

I bought a Columbia Compounder jacket in women's size small in 2013, and it quickly became my favorite raincoat. Recently, I misplaced it, and was heartbroken. After Googling it, the closest I could find was this jacket in a men's small. While it's a tiny bit snug in the hip area (and a little long in the arms), I'm making it work because I love how it looks and performs. It's got great style, is easy to pack, and is lightweight. I love the two-toned black and grey color scheme. It's slimming and very interesting to the eye.
Only got this at Christmas. He wanted something that he could walk to work in without arriving sweaty. Seems to serve that purpose just fine.

I am 5'7" and 160 so I'm not portly by any means but this medium size jacket is still slightly snug under the arms and through the body; definitely NOT the generous fit I am accustomed to from Columbia garments.  Still it will work for me, but buyer beware.  As this product is discontinued I don't think there are that many left out there anyway.

A well known gear lab tested this jacket and then trashed it in a review.  I didn't believe them and very pleased I did not.  The Compounder is about 19 oz. compared to their best choice the Arcteryx Alpha SV which is 2 oz. less and $300 more!  Later, I saw the Compounder was highly rated by Backpacker magazine.

The breathability is nearly as good as some fabrics that cost much more.  Unfortunately, I am aware of that...

The XXL is true to size and a relaxed fit with long arms leaves plenty of room for winter layering. The Compounder has an easy-to-adjust hood; soft face lining; and internal mesh pockets handy for storing gloves.

While waterproof pocket zippers all run smoothly, the main zip requires wrestling.
The pit zips are very long...

The Compounder maybe a tad heavier than $600 jackets, but the result is that it offers multisport potential: It crosses over into skiing and mountaineering, yet it’s not too heavy for backpacking.

A great product from Columbia.  Never count them out!

product_title: Columbia Men s Cubique II Jacket

reviews.review_body: Excellent jacket for every moment of The day. Great!! I Love this jacket very much! The colé really stays out !

The jacket Fits as expected.  It's really comfortable and warm. I Highly recomend.
It has a Lots of useful pockets.
Great, very pleased with purchase, all turned out to be exactly. I am very happy to shop this way, so I follow
Nice jacket! I'll go skiing with pleasure. In the battle is not yet tested it, but by the form \ heat resistance - 5 points!
Great Jacket for skiing, very WARM!!!!  I purchased this jacket before a week long ski trip and was very satisfied at how warm it kept me on the slopes in freezing temperatures.
Light, good fitting and water proof OmniHeat! Really great gear for cold days. I'm 6'3 (194 cm) and medium build (92 kg) and XL just fits right...for anyone having concerns about size

I was more than pleased when my package arived on time and in excellent condition. The jacket itself was just as I had expected and was discribed. I had no complacations and I was very pleased with my purchase and would recommend ordering from here to any of my friends.

Fits as expected, warm, lots of useful pockets.  I snowboard with this jacket; no need to layer and it's so warm!  All I wear is a base layer and this jacket.  When I'm taking a break from snowboarding, this jacket holds my goggles, phone, gloves, lock, headband, and it still has more pockets for me.  I recommend

Was a great quality ski jacket that we ordered for our son.  Ordered a size larger than needed to allow for additional layers.  Turned out to be way too large as the jacket was well insulated and he would not need the additional layers.  Returned the jacket. (Update:  got charged$55 to return the jacket.  No explanation given except restocking fee. So buyer beware.  Jacket had all tags and was in same condition as received).
174CM  154lbs , sizing is bigger than the 1st edition, and is still large to me, but very comfortable.recommend if the size fits you.

For some reason the price of this jacket came down from around $260 to $135.  At $135, this is a great jacket.  I was concerned because some of the reviews indicated that a "small" might still be too large for me (I am 5'7", 135 lbs), but it seems to fit very well.  The jacket fits comfortably, looks great, and performs really well.  It keeps the heat in and the cold wind out.  You would be hard-pressed to do better than this jacket at $135.

bought this for my husband for a upcomming ski trip, very happy with the fit. it has tons of pockets. looks and feels like good quality, it should take the falls well with out tearing up. happy with my purchase

I've been looking for one of these since last season and came across this offer that was too good to miss - arrived very quickly - much quicker than estimated all cost covered and rolled in which is always an unknown when buying from overseas and can end up costing more but this was all prepaid and really helps on getting the goods swiftly - so great product, good fit and prompt delivery - well packed and all in the original manufacturers bag and tags - you can't ask for more !

Purchased for CO ski trip, needed better jacket.  This fit the bill.  Skied in 15-20deg F with thermal wicking shirt, long-sleeve cotton t-shirt, and medium/light acrylic sweater, this was great, and a little too warm.  Has front and under-arm vents.  Pocket for phone was nice, along with goggle pocket (used for gloves).  Seems durable, no tears from rubbing on trees or branches so far.  Fairly lightweight, warm, breathable, sleeves are nice with stretch cuffs under gloves, also powder skirt seemed to work.  Did not use hood, or try with helmet.  "reflective" shiny stuff inside seems like a joke, it is just paint or ink dots on inside fabric... either way it was warm.

Returned since the sizing is a bit bigger than the 1st edition. Since I'm size S (5'10" 145lbs) I have to look elsewhere.
But it's a GREAT VALUE for those at the right size, truely an art piece. I don't like the massive collar however.

To be sure of the best fit, I purchased a Large & XL from Amazon at the bargain prices of $110 & $89 respectively.  I would have preferred a different color than Black, but it was too good a price to pass up.  It's still September in Southern California, so I won't be able to comment on its utilitarian properties until my ski trip in January, but there are plenty of other reviews on the subject.
Back to the sizing.  I'm 6-0", 207 pounds, 44" chest, 37" waist, and 33" sleeve length.  The Large was definitely the best fit on me.  The shoulders fit fine, and there was still an extra inch or two available in the sleeve length if needed.  I was able to readily swing my arms around without any restriction in my motion.  There's still room for some layering underneath (e.g. silk undershirt and fleece jacket).  Other reviewers commented on how warm this jacket is, so I doubt you'll need too much layering ... but all bets are off if you layer like the Michelin Man.
Until I actually ski in this jacket in cold and wet conditions, my 5 star rating is conditionally based on the 70% discount price I paid.  Otherwise, the sole purpose of this review is to provide readers additional sizing feedback.

product_title: Helikon Gunfighter Soft Shell Jacket Coyote

reviews.review_body: Very well constructed jacket. Like every Helikon product I've purchased. Well worth the money.
Grate
Great jacket but it was made in China ??
Muy buen producto, excelente calidad y muy buenas terminaciones, Helicontex no defrauda.

product_title: Columbia Sportswear Men s Zephyr Ridge Jacket Deep Woods XX Large

reviews.review_body: Despite being my chest zize as the minimum size XXL turned very narrow arm, however the product is of very good quality and very warm keeps the body just with a shirt underneath

this is my husbands first Omni heat coat and I have had one now for about 4 years.  Lets just say it is best for 20 degrees of colder and I never wear a long sleeve shirt with mine and we live in Alaska!  They definitely keep you warm and I cannot wear mine if I am shoveling or blowing snow as you will sweat.  this is an awesome coat.

product_title: DuDubaby Mens Zip Up Jacket Zip Up Jacket Mens Slim Lapel Cardigan Coat Jacket Light Heated Outwear Windproof Jacket Men

reviews.review_body: Fits snug to my body and stays put.

product_title: Columbia Men s Omni Heat Match Play Jacket

reviews.review_body: I am very happy with my Columbia Men's Omni Heat Match Play jacket.  It is lightweight, but very warm.  The freedom of movement for golf is excellent.  I like the coat so much that I have made it my top choice for everyday use as well.

NICE GOLF LIGHT JAKCET..
IT IS DOOD FOR A QUITE COLD WEATHER
BUT NOT GOOD ENOUPH FOR A REALLY COLD WEATHER

I needed a lightweight jacket because I get in and out of a car all day. I needed warmth because it gets pretty cold here in the Northeast. I needed both wind and rain protection because I am on the road and can't switch coats. This jacket does it all. I was amazed just how warm this jacket keeps me. You can wear it with just a shirt on underneath and you are good to go when the temp is as low as 35 degrees. Since I have to work in temperatures as low as 20 degrees, just layer a thin garment underneath. I have not had a chance to play golf with it yet, since most people don't play when it's snowing. I am sure it will perform just as well. I have never paid this much for a jacket before. It is worth every penny.

A warm jacket, but not warmer than a good shell-jacket with fleece.
Size L is perfect for af man 185cm high, and armlength is very good.
I would prefer af pocket or 2 more.

Not the jacket i would wear on long cold walks og a ski-trip. It is simply not warm enough for me.

product_title: Fjallraven Keb Jacket Men s

reviews.review_body: It fits small

The other reviewer stole some key points about my other fjallraven reviews and this time he even stole my headline. For that reason I believe he is actually a paid reviewer and I will counter his review.

In his review he mentions key features in a positive manner. Those features are true to the product, however, the jacket is not insulated in any way whatsoever. Its basically a durable shirt. Also, the entire back of the jacket is not G-1000 material, which is nothing more than tightly woven polyester by the way, but the parts that are not G-1000 are a thin spandex material that you would see common underwear made of. Its about as thick as underwear too.
The jacket is very well tailored and has nifty designs in places that make it a really good jacket.
But in conclusion, the materials its made out of is just low frequency polyester and a thin layer at that. It is not water resistant at all. I have the entire Keb outfit. Its good for wind protection but in rain it soaks up water like a sandman. This jacket is NOT worth anything more than 180$ in the market compared to other jackets made with the same amount of material.
That being said, if you're willing to pay the price like I did, thats your personal right.

Fjallraven makes great outdoor gear, that's all there is to it.  I love this jacket, but a few items to note if you are considering one:

1.  The torso and arms are generous, so it fits more like a "tall" size.  Love it for me, but that may not be good news for you depending on your preference.
2.  This jacket will resist drizzle, but it is not a rain jacket.  The G-1000 material on the hood, shoulders, lower sleeves, and lower torso can be easily treated with Greenland wax and can be highly water resistant; however, the other panels are a much stretchier material.  I treat the G-1000 with wax, then treat the stretchy panels with Nikwax or Cabela's waterproofing spray.  It will do great in anything but a sustained downpour.
3.  The hood is substantial.  This is great news for wind and the elements, but can take a little getting used to.  Depending on how it adjusted, it can be configured to be a limited-vision tunnel that stands well out in front of your face.  Fortunately, it is highly adjustable, including the ingenious use of a flexible wire inside the front of the hood that can be shaped.
4.  The jacket is a little lighter weight than it appears.  It's no warmer than a standard soft-shell, but far more durable and functional.  The jacket has a trim but not slim fit, so room for layering underneath.

I have received so many compliments on this item!  It really stands out in a good way.

Longer length than the waterproof jackets most commonly sold today. Sufficient number of pockets. Hood has stiffener in brim so it's not necessary to wear baseball cap under hood. Very reasonable price. Only downside is it's designed in the U.K. so the zipper is reversed - just takes some getting used to.

This is as close as you can get to the 1970's mountain parkas. It is long enough to cover your crotch and upper thighs, stout, quite waterproof, rather heavy.  I'm 6'4", 200 lbs and the XL is perfectly sized to fit a fleece under it.  Great rain parka for cold, windy, rainy days. Not an optimal raincoat for backpacking on hot, humid rainy weather. For the normal price of 150 it's a good value. When its on sale, it's a screaming deal.

This jacket was more than I expected and maybe even a little more than I had hoped. I really needed a rain jacket to use with my down jackets and coats. It needed to fit a little loosely so that I wouldn't have any problems with it crushing the down and losing the insulating value of it. I also wanted something that would breath and not break the bank. A hood was also very important and pockets. This was the best I could find that included ALL of those features. First the pluses: 1, the fit is almost perfect for me and for layering. I really could have gone with a large instead of an extra large, if I only wanted to use it for mild temperatures. 2, The looseness also helps in the breathing category because it doesn't completely trap the air and moisture released from the body inside the jacket until your clothing becomes saturated and starts to rob your body of heat. Yes it says that the fabric is breathable, but even the most expensive "breathable waterproof fabrics"  have this problem. 3, The hood is more than I had hoped for. I knew that it zipped off, which is important and which I like but the adjustment cords are very good too. I was a little concerned when I first put it on and tried to snug it down with the two side cords, and they didn't do much. Then I realized that I hadn't done anything with the cord on the back of the hood. It's a system and you need to use all of them to get it really snugged down. There is also a stiffener in the brim of the hood that keeps the hood out further from your face and stops rain or snow (To a degree. Nothing stops horizontally driven stuff. lol) from getting on my glasses. 4, Pockets. Lots of pockets. Two large pouch/cargo pockets on the outside front with Velcro flaps, Two hand warmer pockets BEHIND those (I'll get to that in a minute.), one chest pocket with a zipper on the wearers top left outside and one chest pocket with Velcro on the top right inside. Now the negatives. 1, It's a lot heavier than I really wanted. Solider, rugged and well made. I was hoping for something that "could be" easily carried in or on a backpack. This is rather bulky and heavy for that. In certain situations I certainly "might" strap this on top of my pack. It is definitely lighter than my mountain parka soft shell (Which cost about 3 to 4 times what this did.), but that is for expected bad weather in more extreme environments. I was looking for those swing season, I never expected THAT to happen situations where I needed something better than the fits in your pocket rain coat. 2, The hand warmer pockets BEHIND the pouch/cargo pockets on the lower front. Here's the problem. The opening into these is only as wide as the pockets are tall. The pouch/cargo pockets will hold quite a bit, but they are not all that deep. My bare hands fit in just fine, and with a pair of light gloves on They will still fit, BUT if you have on anything that has some real insulation, you CAN NOT GET YOUR HANDS INTO THE POCKETS. I understand exactly why the manufacturer did it this way. It is a cost effective way for them to get a lot of pockets onto the jacket without raising the price to high. The pouch/cargo pockets are simply sewn on top of the outside of the coat on only three of the four sides. The top, bottom and inside edges are sewn and the outside edge is left open for a somewhat serviceable hand pocket underneath. Clever and cost effective, however it creates two problems. One, it is hard to get a gloved hand into the pocket and two, if you put anything of any size into the pouch/cargo pocket on top of it, it will not expand to allow use of the pocket under. 3, No pit zips. These are almost mandatory for a coat of this design. Thigh length, waterproof, heavy duty fabric, with two way zipper, Velcro storm flap over the zipper, high, stand up collar and full hood and bungie pull cords on the bottom hem to keep out the elements. It is ment to be battened down to keep out the storm, and that means trapping in the heat and sweat. 4, The zipper is on the left instead of the right side, but then this was obviously designed in Great Britain, and they even drive on the left, so what ya goin' ta do. LOL. Now that my ramble is pretty much done, I want you to know that I love this rain coat, ESPECIALLY for the price I paid for it. I can and will live with all of the negatives I listed and would have easily up my score to FIVE STARS if it had pit zips.

I was looking for a longer rain coat for every day wear.  It is important that the material will keep the water out but allow body sweat to get through.  I wore it for two weeks now, it has been raining a lot lately.  The material is light and the sweat wasn't trapped, body stay dry.
The jacket is long enough to cover to upper tight.  One thing I really like about this jacket is the pockets.  If you look closer to the pictures vendor provided, you will notice that there small pocket outside and inside for cell phone or wallet or anything for easy access.  the front pockets are large and designed to keep water from getting inside.  It even has a pen holder.  The hood is pretty large, it covers well.  You can pull the elastic band to tight up the hood so it will keep the hood from blow away from strong wind.  I hope the elastic band material will last, only time can tell.
I wish they design it to add a down or thermal liner for winter.  Overall, nice design, great materials, I would recommend this to others who looking for a good quality rain jacket.

I read a review to size up, so I ordered an XL.  I am 5’ 10” 175lbs and am between an American medium and large.  This XL allows for plenty of room for a thick sweater underneath.  It is a longer coat, so I appreciate the bottom zip so I can easily drive with the coat on.

The main benefit of a jacket is a hood! The hood has a perfect design, excellent protection of the face. Bought this at an outdoor equipment store.  went straight for a XXL because I have a big chest (45"), and I'm 6'2" in height. It fit well but I'll have to be careful what insulation layers I put underneath. It is well manufactured with some well thought out features. The hood can become huge which no doubt is useful in certain situations. The 2 external pockets are only at chest level but have a large volume. As you would expect, there are decent features/drawcords to tighten things up around the hood, neck, wrists etc. and great ventilation zippers at the arm pit that extends quite a bit down the side of the jacket. The G-1000 fabric is really hard-wearing but require a good amount of waterproofing wax to seal you in. Soon after purchasing I was caught in a light shower and all was good. The first sustained rain I experienced wearing it, and it leaked, mostly around the seams. I have since applied copious amounts of their proprietary wax to all G-1000 sections, doubling up on the seams, to waterproof the jacket. This takes a solid 90 minutes to do and a hair-dryer to evenly distribute the wax and melt it into the fabric. I know from experience with other wax jackets that this will need to be repeated once or possibly twice per year to keep the jacket waterproofed if you use it regularly. That's is the "caveat" in the title. There will be on-going upkeep with this jacket that extends beyond wiping with a damp cloth, or a wash and re-seal with Nikwax products.

I worked outdoors as a geologist for a decade in the '80s and my parka was my most important piece of equipment. Since then I hike, mountaineer, bike ride for fun.  I get a new contemporary parka about every ten years. I live in the Pacific Northwest and hike twice a week. I have a two year old top of the line North Face Parka... the Fjallraven is an order of magnitude better for all but a full day of heavy rain. It is some much more breathable than Gore-tex it is not funny. It is so comfortable and quiet, I frequently forget to take it off when I get home. I use it with the Keb pants, which have cargo pockets that compliment the Jacket (no pockets where the pack waist straps go). The brown open weave material is so breathable it is like not having any material holding up evaporation. But hit the blackberry patches and the lighter colored material is impervious to thorns. Pocket layout is outstanding for wearing a pack. To make the Ocher colored material more waterproof you wax it... so you can adjust the "waterproofness". So the range of conditions where this jacket is comfortable is really large.

I really like the quality of all Fjallraven products and this jacket is built with great quality. The soft stretch material on the chest arms and back will allow for moisture to be wicked away. The chest pockets are huge, which I like. The hood is also very big, but appropriate for its function: it will keep out precipitation and provide full head coverage and protection from wind.

The quality is, as promised and usually kept by Fjallraven, superb, down to the smallest seam.
I like the practicality of the two big (really!) front pockets. One has to get used to the absence of side pockets for your hands, but that's a detail… There are a few inner and other small pockets, great for storing and keeping organized your gadgets.
The combination of G1000 and stretch material makes it very comfortable to wear, despite the snug fit (good if you want to keep a slim silhouette when crawling through the bush). The hood is an amazing feature, retaining decent vision while really keeping the elements out.
Overall no regrets whatsoever, the price is not outrageous either, especially as I expect this to last many more years...

I got the jacket as well as the Keb pants.  They are really excellently crafted, styled, and constructed, and are a joy to wear.  Given their choice of materials however, I will be somewhat challenged to decide when I will wear them.  Being not fully waterproof, not fully wind-proof (the stretch fabric portions), and not lightweight enough to be good for multi-day backpacking and mountaineering, they seem best suited to day hikes in cool conditions where heavy and prolonged rain won't be likely.  I have the wax, but have not yet applied it (don't know how I can get it inside of the big front pockets to the G-1000 fabric there, either).  I may try out the jacket as a ski shell this winter (not when wet snow may be falling however, or in high winds).  It's a shame that such a beautiful design is hindered by less than high-performance fabrics.

As far as size, I'm #190 and 5'11'', with large shoulders and chest.  The large was too tight across the chest to allow me to layer a fleece or light down jacket underneath, so I returned it for an XL, which seems about right.

Fjällräven has a longstanding reputation of making great, innovative and typically long lasting products. True to its reputation this is an awesome jacket: it fits snugly, yet offers great range of motion for the user and quality seems to be very good overall. I also like the hood which is HUGE and using a metal cord in the lining it allows you to shape it to fit. Pockets are well placed and the jacket can be opened at the sides for improved warm weather (or activity) ventilation.

The following however must be noted:
-----------------------------------------------

1.) This jacket offers virtually no insulation and must be regarded an outer layer only,
2.) There is more stretch fabric on this jacket than G1000 and protection against the elements is accordingly,
3.) If you are not in better than average shape this jacket will be too tight (I exercise 5 days a week and I am 6ft tall, 180lbs, 6% body fat and size Medium is perfect).
4.) The jacket is 'Made in China'

The last point, 'made in China' is really getting to me; material costs can't be more than 2 dollars (this is just cotton and synthetics) and even factoring in supposedly high R&D costs, if you manufacture this jacket in a low cost country like China, charging this price is just TOO MUCH. Had they made it in Sweden it would still be expensive, but in China? It's nothing short of outrageous.

This was probably not what it was designed for; but the breathable back and windproof front, amazing huge adjustable windproof hood, long sleeves, 2-way side zip vents and 2-way front zip ventilation options, and big chest pockets all add up to a fine winter bicycle commuters jacket. Get it a size larger than usual so you will have room to layer under it, it runs small. Not waterproof but will stop wet snow and light showers, and unless your commute is very long or you are riding in a deluge you will be OK for most commuting. I love it for this purpose and use it all the time. I can't comment on other uses, but the lack of windproof-ness in back would make me hesitant to use it in the backcountry unless I had something else to wear over it. And it is pretty heavy and heavy duty, I would not want to carry it in my backpack very often but the durability is a plus for urban use. I have not found anything I like better as my outer shell for cold winter bicycle commuting.

i would prefer a bit lose

All in all an excellent product. One snap on lining sleeve was defective - the plastic grommet seems a bit flimsy, but not a huge deal.

I wore this jacket in Minnesota this winter...I've gotta say, this is the warmest coat I have ever owned. I only wish I'd owned it sooner! Thanks, Ma!

I wasn't a huge fan of this jacket.  I bought it last minute for a ski trip that weekend and it ended up being very bulky.  I bought an XL based on the sizing charts and I definitely should have bought a large.  I ended up buying a solid feeling Northface jacket instead.

It fits very nicely. I'm a little worried about the part that holds the collar and sleeves on because it is being held by a small flimsy piece of cloth. I wished the inner color was plaid, but it was worth the price.

Very warm jacket for skiing and day to day life. It was warm even during the polar vortex last winter in Wisconsin
lost one star because a button broke off of the plaid inner jacked. It was plastic not a big deal.

I bought to for my brother as a Christmas present. He liked it very much. You might want to know that the inside is shiny. That's not a problem for us, but other people might want to know. It is a tad expensive, but that's Columbia.

Nice and warm jacket, but fit is small. I thought everyone else reviewing this product were just whining about the size, but no, it is a slim fit. I still fit the jacket it's just tighter than I would like, I would order next size up next time.

This is a well-designed jacket with a lot of hi-tech features. The liner can be zipped out and worn alone and the jacket can be worn w/o the liner. Plenty of pockets,waterproof, and has the latest in warmth technology. The reason it does not rate 5 stars is because the hood is not removable.

This jacket keeps me very warm and if it's too warm i can remove the flannel liner. The Liner zips in and the sleeves have snaps at the cuffs so when you pull your arms out, it stays put. Its not extremely waterproof, but i never felt wet in it..maybe a scotchguard treatment is in sight.

A great jacket over all... I am more than disappointed that the buttons on the inner jacket broke within the 2nd time opening the pocket.  These cheap plastic buttons are horrible in comparison to the tried and true metal snaps. I"m also disappointed by no hand pockets for the inner jacket. since I plan on using the inner jacket as a fall coat not having the pockets to put my hands in was a major disappointment.

Its very warm and worth a look. Just don't count on pockets or the snaps.

When I came home from Work and found box on my steps.  I tried jacket on and found it was a very good fit.  The coat was cold from being out in cold for hours but warmed up quickly once I had it on.  Since I had the Jacket on and I was feeling like some exercise I took a walk to test it out.  Comfortable even in cold and windy conditions.  Extra length in the back made it better then my previous jacket.  Pocket high in front of the jacket perfectly positioned for my smartphone to comfortably connect earbuds.  Came home after walk and kept jacket on and did not overheat in the house.

This is a fabulous jacket, however, it arrived damaged. The inside liner of the jacket had a 3-corner tear on the right arm.  The tear is all the way through the material, leaving a sizeable hole in the sleeve. The material around the tear is fraying and most likely will be difficult to fix. It does not appear that the tear was caused by inadequate packing, as it is on the inside liner and the outside shell/jacket is not torn.

The jacket itself is true to size and fit well.  The inside liner is shiny (looks similar to aluminum foil) so beware if you think the "flannel liner" is truly "flannel."  The jacket is VERY warm.  The liner looks great zipped into the jacket, as well as by itself.

The only reason I did not rate the jacket 5 stars is because it arrived damaged.

I have been in need of a new jacket and liked the looks features and price.  The shell is perfect and on its own deserves five stars. The material has a nice feel, the pit vents have mesh panels in them, so they only open about three inches, but i like them. The hood is adjustable and works great in the rain. The Five external pockets, three with zippers and two with just velcro flaps, and the three internal pockets, one zipper chest pocket, one media player pocket, and a large google pouch that i stash my hat in.
From other reviews I new the liner might be an issue. This jacket would get five stars if it had the classic Columbia fleece liner. The liner is lumberjack on the outside and disco on the inside. Yes it looks like a flannel shirt, put has more of a wool feel to the material. The heat reflective interior is shiney and makes it very warm, and i would probably substitute a plain fleece jacket underneath until Minnesota hits 0 degrees ferenheit. The liner fits a bit tight in the in the shoulders and arms, i would not be able to wear a sweeter with it.

I normally don't write reviews.  However, there is a lot of misleading info in the comments that might make deciding on a purchase difficult.

1) This jacket DOES have two zippers.  The inner set of zippers is used to "zip in" the liner.  If the liner is taken out the second zipper set is usable.  You can also un-zip the liner but keep it in the jacket.  This will give you the liner zipper, and the double jacket zipper (3 in all).  It's pretty obvious that the reason it is designed like this is to avoid putting a total of three zippers into the outer shell.  Navy issue NWU parkas have this exact same design, I'm pretty sure it;s not a flaw.

2) The inner liner collar does "pop out."  However, this can easily be fixed by removing the collar, washing it as instructed, pressing the collar down, and tucking it into the shell after reinstalling it.  After doing this the liner should not prevent the jacket from being zipped all the way up.

3) Sizing is difficult, but you can always return.  I suggest getting the two sizes closest to you and returning the one you don't like.

4) The liner does make the jacket a bit bulky, but it is extremely warm.

5) The liner is not a shirt.  It is an actual zip up liner that looks like a shirt.  Whether or not you like this is up to preference.

The reason this doesn't get five stars is because:
a) I just bought it,
b) While the liner zipper is reversible, the inner shell zipper is not.  This makes it harder to hid the left inner zipper after zipping in the liner (this would make more sense if you actually had the jacket in front of you)
c) The hood can't be tucked into the collar of the shell.

Overall, it's a good jacket and it looks a bit more fashionable than other cold weather jackets (in my opinion).  However, mileage may vary.
Terrible. Wrong coat, wrong color, wrong size, wrong price!
The jacket is comfortable and warm, and I love all the pockets.  My only issue is the arms feel tight when you're first putting the jacket on, but once you've got it situated they're fine.

The coat is pretty good winter coat with plenty of pockets and it's meant for winter storms.  It was a 'Deal of the Day' but it runs small.  I'm a Size 48 when it comes to coats.  This XXL coat was tight under my arms with a just a T-Shirt on and had short sleeve lengths to boot, I'm a 36.5 with Dress Shirts.  It's going back to Amazon but it would've been a keeper if it didn't run small.

I've had this jacket for 2 months now living in chilly Madison, WI, and it handles cold weather and wind very while also being good looking. I was able to stay comfortable warm in temperatures as low as single digits Fahrenheit with a windchill as low as -10. It holds up well. The only thing I'm not completely happy with is the fact that it's a little puffy when worn with extensive layers below the jacket. Overall it's a great product and I'm glad I bought it.

I bought the Back to Hells Mountain jacket this past fall as I was preparing for another brutal Chicago winter. I had no idea how harsh winter was going be, but this jacket made it through like a champ! In addition to the day-to-day comings and goings in Chicago, I also took this with me exploring in northern Wisconsin (snowshoeing, ice caves, frozen waterfalls, etc.). This jacket offers excellent warmth without the bulk, and has everything you need to handle the outdoors. I've only used the lining separate from the jacket a handful of times, but it's a great feature to have when you want it. I have nothing but good things to say about this one.

My previous Columbia jacket (Ballistic Parka shell / liner combo) is now over 15 years old and I'm sending it in for warranty repair just because the pull tab on the shell's zipper finally gave out. When temperatures were below zero for severaI weeks, not being able to zip my shell up wasn't very fun! I purchased the Back To Hells Mountain jacket so I would have a jacket while I sent my Ballistic Parka in for repair.

The Back To Hells Mountain jacket is very nice. It's not nearly as bulky as my old Ballistic Parka and is also weighs a bit less. I did find that the liner from my old jacket would NOT work with this new shell.  One side zipped in fine, but the other side, the teeth do not line up properly.  The Omni-Heat definitely works, maybe a little too well sometimes. I've found myself taking the jacket off if I'm going inside somewhere for more than 20-30 minutes or so.  The shell does an awesome job at cutting the wind and rain.  The liner leaves a bit to be desired though. I'm not a fan of the plaid design, but what really bugs me is that the zippers to zip the liner into the shell don't continue all the way up the collar of the liner. So when the liner is zipped into the shell, the collar sticks up and pokes you in the face. In the photos on the product page, the collar is tucked down. I've tried doing this, and within a few minutes of moving around or walking, they pop right back out. I've read another review where the user changed out the included liner with a Zephyr Ridge liner, which looks like the zippers go all the way up the collar on. I may look into doing this down the road, but it will make the overall price of the jacket quite a bit more.

Overall, this is a great jacket for the price with only a few minor annoyances (to me anyway).  I remember paying nearly $300 for my Ballistic Parka over 15 years ago, but considering how long it lasted I think it was a pretty good deal. Hoping this one will last another 15 years!
Nice material and very warm. Somewhat tight around the arms with the inner lining -  I removed and just wore the outer shell (although I am 6'0" 235lbs former athlete - ordered the XXL)

This is my second winter jacket from Columbia and it's far superior to whatever model I had before (donated it already, so I'm not sure which one it was).

Pros:
-Proper fit.
-A good assortment of pockets located in the places I like them.  I use the front pocket with the vertical zipper all the time for my cell phone.  Jacket also has a large pouch-type pocket on the inside for glove storage, which was a requirement for me.
-Quality zippers that are fairly easy to use even with gloves on.
-Armpit ventilation for the outer shell.
-Comfortable outer shell and comfortable liner.
-The plaid liner is very comfortable.  The reflective "disco" inside lining is very effective at retaining your body heat; I can usually only wear the liner for brief periods.
-Hood is comfortable and useful.

Cons:
-Plaid liner jacket doesn't have standard side pockets.  Wasn't a deal breaker for me.
-This jacket model appears to be discontinued and therefore has limited availability and correspondingly high prices now.

I highly recommend this jacket if you can still find it at a reasonable price (less than $150), but if not, try to find the updated version from Columbia that is the most similar.

I RECEIVED MY ORDER AHEAD OF THE EXPECTED DATE AND WAS WONDERFULLY SURPRISED AT THE EXCELLENT QUALITY OF THE JACKET. THE COLOR WAS EXACTLY AS DEPICTED IN THE PICTURE AND THE FIT WAS PERFECT, (BY USING THE SIZING GIUDE MEASURMENTS) NOT TO MENTION THE VERY GOOD PRICE. EXCELLENT CHOICE.

My 16 year old wanted this jacket after seeing the commercials on T.V.  We got it as a Christmas gift for him... He LOVES it!

This is a very nice jacket and my fiance loves it, we were glad it came in XX. The only thing I didn't like was how shiny the inside fabric was.

This jacket serves my needs from cool spring and fall days, to the bitter cold of the winter. I was looking for something warm without all of the bulk, and this is it! If you pair this with a good winter hat and gloves, you will be very comfortable in the winter without sweating to death in a big, bulky coat. Also, you won't be too hot on more mild days either. It's like this jacket adjusts to the climate and knows just how to react. I love it!

Recommended for all occasions

The product is great , but the XL is pretty big for this size..

This jacket serves no purpose. It is too light for walking around, and not styled right for heavy activity.

Despite being an Omni Heat jacket, it provides no resistance to cooler weather - and you can forget about sub freezing temps, may as well wear a poncho. The problem with the jacket is that is has no thermal break. Yes, it has Omni Heat, which is normally functional. However, because the jacket is so thin, anything cold touching the OUTSIDE of the jacket is immediately transferred to the INSIDE of the jacket.

So if you have snow on your jacket, the cold from the snow travels by conduction to the inside of the jacket and to your skin. Omni Hear works by holding in heat from convection, but does nothing for cold transferred by conduction. That cold will come from cold snow, cold rain, cold wind, cold banisters, cold shovels, cold doors, and pretty much anything with which you will have purposeful or casual contact.

I can confirm the jacket is wind proof and water resistant, and breathable - but unless you're going to use this as a car coat, you will be disappointed. I bought mine during a Flash Sale, and paid significantly less than the Amazon listed price, but I still think I paid too much.

You will be cold in this jacket in any type of winter weather. I understand it may be more suited to fall. But if it's a fall jacket then why is there Omni Heat in the shell? If it is meant to be a shell under which you wear warmer clothing there are more functional and less expensive options. If you want to wear it to snow board or as a ski shell, you'll sweat. May work to toss a football around in 40 degree weather, but that is about it.

Upgrading the jacket with a light layer of Thinsulate between the outer shell and Omni Heat fabric would make this a great jacket.

But if you want to walk down to the local cafe and just look good, for that it is perfect. You'll be cold while walking, but you'll look good.
Fits great. Very warm. The wind protection works great. The heat lining helps keep you warm. Plus the coat looks good.
The jacket is very nice but the sleeves are a bit long compared to the size i always bought, nice, comfy and warm jacket, next time i'll try a smaller size though
I love this jacket.  While it isn't the warmest by itself, layered with a fleece it is plenty warm.  Water rolls right off and it stops the wind great.  Nice modern fit and looks great.

It's stylish, functional, and accommodates my long torso much better than North Face jackets do. It's warm and well built, the zippers are very sturdy, the cinch cords around the waist work well, and it feels like it will be able to hold up through a lot. The only thing I hate is that I lost mine and have to buy a new one for this winter.

Got this for my dad and he was thrilled.  I bought a size larger than he normally wears. It fits him well and keeps him nice and warm.

Professional, Fast, Excellent Service, Reasonable Costs, Perfection in fit and warmth a great way to sty warm and comfortable without bulk, Colorado was cold this season and this jacket saw me through!
I am very pleased with this jacket.  It fit my 6'4" husband perfectly, and is very warm even here in NH where winter's can be extremely cold.  Would buy this again!
Excellent product.
I bought the Heat Elite jacket in a large tall for my husband.  It fit great with plenty of sleeve length for his long arms.  He loves it and enjoys wearing it in 10-30 deg weather.

I've worn this jacket in windy, below  10F weather, with only a T-shirt and sweatshirt underneath.  I don't know about just sitting around, but I was comfortable working the snow blower.  Good quality overall.

I live in TN so this jacket keeps me so warm in the WINTER time i wore this and a under armor winter grade and i felt great it was about 10 degrees above zero every one was complaining and i was warm.

I bought this as a replacement liner for a waterproof outer shell.
The fit is nice,but the performance is very disappointing.When the temp dipped below 40 degrees with a little wind.I was nothing but COLD.
It was a bad choice on my part.
Nice jacket  Liner is a bit itchy if your not wearing long sleeves but it keeps me warm snug enough to wear as an under layer.
if the only thing is that it is hard or rough but I finally stalk well and I like ... the only thing that would change is make it a little more up ... is a good product ...

I bought this as a gift and they have been so happy with it. It is great in the winter and fall and eary spring weather in the north east climate.  Only thing is for an average sized male get a large, I think the medium would be snug.

Disappointed with jacket for several reasons. The collar does not stay down, you have to pull it flat when you are wearing it, nuisance. The outer cloth material seems to catch various pieces of lint/animal hair - which on a black jacket means you are constantly checking it. Seems to be comfortable when the weather is not windy, then when the temp drops you need to run the zipper all the way up to keep warm. A well made fleece lined jacket may be a better choice than this jacket. Probably would not have purchased it if I had gone to a store to try it on.
I bought this jacket for my son it looks so nice on him.  The fabric was a fine quality with nice zippers.  Glad I bought this Columbia jacket.

this is my third and favorite columbia jacket .it is a great medium weight jacket,probably good  for temperatures 30 to 50 degrees.it keeps all wind out .it is a great jacket and i got it on sale which was an added bonus.

My son loves this jacket other than is he says that it gets really hot for a light weight jacket. I am glad he is able to stay warm in the winter without having to have on a big, bulky coat. Definitely worth the money. He has worn this jacket for 2 years now and it still looks new.
wasn't what I expected.

My husband is a pretty standard xl - he's 6' tall, 175, not big or bulky, but has always worn an xl because his arms are long and it fits better. This is one awkward jacket. The xl is huge - the seams on the shoulders hang  far off the shoulders and the jacket is enormous in the body, but the large is painful to wear because of the seams under the arms. The large mostly fit, but the seams were so hard and awkwardly placed. He really wanted to love this jacket because it's lightweight yet very warm, but it just didn't work. After returning these, we even found them in a store and tried on other xl and l to make sure he didn't get a one off.

I tried this on at a store and I decided to buy it on Amazon because it was the same price and I own an Amazon rewards cc. The product came in a box and it was well packaged. I tried it on and it felt a little stiff in the arm and chest area. I'm 5'9 178lbs and I wear a medium in my other omniheat Columbia jacket but this one felt a little tighter. I'm assuming it felt tighter because of the additional material on the jacket that makes it a little wind resistant. The jacket feels like its made of good quality materials and it felt very warm in seconds. However my problem is the size. I recommend that you go one size up unless you are skinny.

Polar fleece definitely a light blue ...was thinking it would have more of a grey/greenish tinge ...hard to tell with my monitor...that said..the "silver lining" was a big hit for my son....not meant to be waterproof...need a shell for that...and like the nylon darker blue material...helps cut down on wind.. But again...not a coat for super cold weather....perfect for 30 degrees and up...good layering coat for under a shell for really cold days as it's not too bulky...Washes like a dream. Not too "dressy" for my son...can go from the LaCrosse field to dinner out!

I am 6'1 and weigh 165lbs and the large tall is a great fit. I ordered the large tall because I thought the extra large would be a bit baggy. The shoulders on the jacket feel a little snug but not to tight. It is a great jacket for late fall and early spring days. It doesn't block the wind very good but keeps you dry in light rain.

product_title: Craghoppers Men s Track Soft Shell Jacket

reviews.review_body: Perfect Jacket for So. California weather. Heavy enough to cut an morning/evening chill. Nice enough to wear to the office; I have had compliments about its style and fit.

Love this coat...Fits perfect and very comfortable...
Great looking & very comfortable, nice material & surprisingly warm. Have bought 3 now.

product_title: Columbia Sportswear Men s Zephyr Ridge Jacket

reviews.review_body: I was looking for a new jacket for a trip, I'm going on this fall and need something to break the wind and keep me warm at the same time. I tested this jacket out art a sorting good store to check how the sizes fitted me and the medium fits perfect for my body. I really love the way this jacket hugs your body. I got the mystery color which is the best looking one they have.

My 17 year old son was looking for a three seasons coat. He spent all kinds of time on the web looking and researching. We went to a store that had this one, the North Face and Patagonia etc. he put this one on and said "this is it" its comfy, warm and cool with the zippers in the back. And on axon I got it for $115 instead of the $180 in the store. So we both scored
This jacket is great - the reviews seemed too good to be true but the technology for both heating and cooling seem to be true. It fits, it's attractive, what more can I say.

Excellent 3-seasons jacket. Wind blocking very effective. Light. Fits very well. Warm and comfy for late autumn and early spring. Not for winter though ; below -10C you gotta move to keep you warm. Excellent breathability. I use it for bike riding on cold fall and spring evenings and I was pleasantly surprised by its performance since I previously thought it could be too warm for aerobic exercise. Reminds me of the North Face Denali, in a more bulky version. Very pleased with it so far.

I got this jacket to wear on its own and also to zip inside my other Columbia jacket. It fits perfect inside my other coat and is very warm. I'm 6' 7" and about 260lbs. I got the XXl and it fits very well, it's a tad short but I'm also a tad tall. The Omni heat technology is great, you can actually feel the difference between this and a normal coat. I live in upstate NY and it has been in the single digits for about a month and this coat combined with my other coat keeps me pretty warm. It is very sharp looking and is built well. I have used Columbia products for years and they all stand up well, the zippers, the material, etc. I actually have a coat I purchased in 1994 and it still is in great shape. I would recommend this jacket to everyone, and right now it's just over 100$ and for a good jacket that is unbeatable.

AWESOME JACKET
I didn't buy mine from Amazon, I have bad mine for over a year now, I wear it for wind proof, for cool and cold days, by cold I mean down to 25 degree.
The Omi Heat is awesome, it keeps the warmth where it should be, This Jacket is 100% windproof, I tested it with a compressor at work, at 120psi the wind did not go through the jacket,
I have the Abyss blue jacket, I wear it almost every day, has ample room in the pockets and the collar is high enough to cover your neck, it is nice with light rain, but not with a down poor. This Jacket is by far my go to jacket for almost any weather condition, with adjustable Velcro on the sleeves, the wrist cuff to seal out wind, and the underarm zippers if it gets to hot, I love this jacket

pros: it's light and easy to hold/wear.
cons: it is not keeping as warm as I have expected. at about +5C degree  it was on the limits. I think it is crazy to expect from this jacket to  keep you warm under 0 C degrees.
And its zipper is not in the usual side. when you want to zip this jacket, you should pull zipper with your right hand and hold the jacket with your left hand (in opposite of all other jackets). or if you wear the jacket when the shiny omni-tech side is at the outside, then the zipper is normal.

I purchased this jacket to replace the liner for my bugaboo shell. I found the other liner and was going to return this one when I got it in the mail but it is so nice. Much warmer, even though they both have omni-heat.  Inside is a little softer than mythe other oneto and the sleeves are like silk. Can't beat it for the price.  Ended up keeping both. Only reason I put 4 stars is because I haven't washed it yet and am hesitant because the inside is so soft I feel like the reflective omni-heat might start coming apart.

Nice warm jacket considering how lightweight it is.  As others mentioned it does run a bit tight. I would suggest going a size larger if you plan on layering underneath. This is more of an active wear coat and not really a standing around in the extreme cold coat.

pros: warm and lightweight.  Great wind resistance.  I love the venting zippers under the armpits.

Cons : no I side pockets or media pocket.  Tight fit.
Excelent
This satisfied 100% my expectations.!
Nice coat
Exelente producto, exelente atencion, gracias

Love this jacket.  I love Columbia jackets compared to North Face.

This is the warmest jacket I've ever owned. No wind is let in and no heat is seeped out. Awesome!

Excellent jacket that completely blocks the wind keeping you warm and toasty.  I love this jacket.
what i like about the jacket is that it isn't bulky but it's very very warm and comfortable. true to size. I would highly recommend this.
The first time in the amazon to buy clothes, buy a small, return afraid after shipment is too big, the result is quite satisfactory. Good work, fabrics is comfortable.

Great jacket!  I'm impressed with how well this jacket blocks the wind! I ordered the Large and it's perfect (I'm 5'11" and 198 lbs).  Very impressed with the omni-heat technology.  Will buy more of this line.
Good i like it
smaller than it should be !

I got this for my dad and he loves it.  He says he loves the style, the color and it's very warm and yet not bulky.  My dad is about 185 and has a beer belly (I hope he's not reading this) and I got him and XL, it fits him very well.

I was hoping this would be a great deep cold winter coat.  It's not, and really wasn't meant to be...  But it IS an excellent cold weather coat (40 degrees and higher).

The vents in the arms, while sometimes difficult to open and shut while wearing, are a lifesaver, and really makes this jacket versatile!

probably the only fleece jacket I've ever bought that exceeds what I expected.  Actually wind proof and I'm talking 40 mpg on a 4 wheeler in 20 degree weather with nothing but a tshirt on underneath the jacket.  Going to the northpole on an expedition soon and I'm taking this thing with me!!

Wore this jacket for years without any issues.  Ended up getting a newer Columbia so this one has been staying in the garage.  Love the under arm zippers to allow more air flow and the omniheat lining really helps.  Won't buy another jacket that doesn't have the omniheat lining.

Great lightweight yet very warm jacket. The cut is for slimmer guys so I can't comfortably wear a sweatshirt under this jacket, but it's great with regular weight shirts. Love the chest pocket and velcro sleeves.

I bought this coat to get a lighter weight jacket, but windproof, that I could use to walk my dog in the winter.  It has performed great.  On some days, when it is not quite so cold, I can unzip the armpits and cool down without taking off the jacket.  It is not rainproof, but it works great in the snow and wind and has plenty of room to move around.

This is a comfortable light weight jacket. Great for a stand alone base layer or as a layer under a water proof jacket. I just wish the outer was water proof and the soft shell material was through out the entire jacket.

I highly recommend this jacket to anyone else. It is very warm, even in the wind. I especially like the vent panels in the underarm  area.  When it starts getting a little too warm, I just open up the vent panels

Love the jacket with a few small quirks...

Pros:

Cons:
