My son was looking for a new winter jacket and decided on the Zephyr Ridge Jacket.  He like the styling and the fact that it is not a bulky jacket.  It has a special lining that helps retain heat and it really does work.  He has been warm enough during this extra cold NC winter.  The jacket arrived when it first said that it would.  It is well made, I am very happy with the quality of the jacket.

Even though the weather here has been "normal" and by normal I mean today can be 60° and tomorrow night 10° , you can stay ready by getting this coat...it is the best ever...I will agree w other reviews that the elbows can get a lil itchy at first but I think that's how u will know its authentic.. Lol...otherwise the sizing is about right .. Zippered pockets that keep you warm ...front part of collar is a kinda high but its OK ...cuff things are pimp , no wind gets in...the only thing bad I can say about this coat is that it should not be worn above 55° zippered you will get too hot very quickly...but I guess that's a good thing ! So that's why I say 5 stars !!!

I've been using this jacket every day since late Sept with temps in the 30's in the morning and afternoon temps in the high 40's to low 50's with a breeze. I bicycle to and back from work, so wind chill is a concern. But with the Zepher no problem at all. The jacket is warm, breaks the wind and is comfortable to wear while riding. Had a temp in the 60's the other day going home had to take it off it was too warm. Good Jacket all the way around!
Satisfaction

Quality wasn't good - the sleeve cuffs are too tight by far, and one was a good bit tighter than the other, to the point where wearing a watch is a no go.
It was warm though.

This coat is excellent at keeping you warm. Blocking the wind is critical in keeping warmth in and this coat does the trick. The only complaint is that the arms are tight fitting so when you slide your arm in with a long sleeve shirt, the inner material of the coat tends to push out of the coat sleeve.

This jacket is really warm, light and flexible exactly what my husband was looking for.  He says it does get a little static y sometimes but he loves it.  It protects really well against wind and the cold.  The little cuffs that extend out of the jacket are an awesome feature.  He is tall and skinny so a lot of times jackets don't fit well because the sleeves end up too short but the little cuff makes it perfect to keep out the cold and to give him the proper length for his sleeves.  I would definitely recommend getting this jacket if you're thinking about it.
Warning...1.Order one size Bigger!!  2. NO HOOD, what good is a nice coat like this with no hood???

I didn't know what size to get for my husband 6'4 and about 230lbs.  I decided on the XL just because I was thinking sweaters would need to fit underneath.  It is really lightweight, it feels slightly heavier than a fleece.  It fits him great and keeps him really warm during these crazy cold Chicago winters.  He even says that it almost keeps him too warm while he is on the train (I explained that is what the armpit zippers are for!).  The inside definitely is flashy, the silver tends to catch everyone's eyes and they ask about it.  Another thing I like about the coat is the deep pockets, so gloves wont be popping out of his pockets.  Really glad I got it for him for Christmas.

Needed a midweight wind breaker and saw this jacket at a local sporting goods store. The $190 MSRP wasn't cutting it but Amazon listed it for $115! The jacket is well made using quality materials. It's warm and keeps out the wind. The cuffs have an elastic inner sleeve to help seal off your wrists from drafts drawstrings at the waist.

The outer shell is constructed of two types of polyester; one is smooth and the other is fleece which, unfortunately, acts as a lint magnet.

The lining is also polyester but manufactured to look like a silvery mesh. I believe it's designed to reflect/retain body heat. It seems to serve this purpose but has one drawback; friction. If you're wearing a long sleeve shirt or sweater that isn't made from a very smooth fabric, your shirt sleeves will bind inside the Zephyr's sleeves when you put it on. Basically you have to grab your sleeves with your hand as you slide your arms into the jacket. Other than that, the jacket is stylish and comfortable.

product_title: Columbia Men s Summit Rush Full Zip Jacket

reviews.review_body: love it
........and still warm and comfortable.  Even fits nicely as an extra layer under heavy coats in this extremely cold winter weather we are currently experiencing.

This is light weight enough to wear all day over an under shirt or as a mid layer.  Close fit also allows a heavier jacket to be worn over.  I'm "cold natured" and my office mates keep it colder that I like it indoors.  I was looking for specifically a jacket instead of a pullover when I found this Columbia item.  I really like the attention to detail Columbia puts into their clothing.  This jacket is what I would describe as "slim fit" and sized perfectly for me (Medium). Yes, the color is "bright" blue as pictured.

Living in the northern northeast US, and being outdoorsy, I have an vast assortment of fleece and fleece-like garments from lots of vendors. I generally shy away from Columbia, as they don't really innovate anymore, they just copy what everyone else is doing, but this was a "deal" and I was just saying "I need a new full-zip fleece". There's nothing wrong with it. It has been very warm as a mid-layer during a couple near-zero shoveling excursions this past week, and doesn't overheat me once inside and it is the top-layer. I haven't worn it in the Spring/Fall yet, but I have no reason to believe it won't work well then either.

It's as good of a full-zip lightweight fleece as you're going to find.

Oh, and there are pockets! They're not horribly useful, but to stash keys, chapstick, or other small items, they're perfect.
Excelente
love the feel and texture of this coat. use it under my puffy coat for extra warmth and comfort. nice!
Got for a friend and for me self. like them and liked the price so we are happy and glad.

Overall, it is a good product. The weight is pretty light.....
Comparing with columbia products that I brought before, the sleeves are longer......
Good design, stylish, good quality fabric, fits very well. Its main flaw is the zipper, which is very small, does not fit easily, is fragile.
I brought it on sale, very reasonable price. Light weight, warm, good for cool morning or night. Yes, it has very long sleeves.
I thought I was getting a fitted jacket in the sleeves and the body portion, however, not even close. Poorly manufactured. Sent back immediately.
The fleece is very, very thin.  For the price I expected better quality.  I ordered it gor a gift, would hsve returned it if it were for me.

I get so many compliments on the color and fit of this jacket.

I am 6'1 and 180 pounds and I chose medium . Fits perfectly!
I like the dress, it makes me look more attractive, the size of the clothes is accurate, convenient, it is what I need, is what I want, I love it
This is a Columbia jacket, so not really the nicest looking jacket but it's awesomely warm and has a snug fit. Perfect addition to every wardrobe as a casual jacket

It's thin ,lightweight and fits snug but does the job.
It doesn't take up much room when it's rolled up and stored in my backpack.
Good on mild days or used as a layer.
It's not a replacement for a regular fleece jacket though.

This is a very nice looking and inexpensive jacket that keeps you warm on cool but not cold nights, like those we have in Southern California.  I find I rarely need anything more than this, and this is nice because it is much lighter and thinner than other jackets that do about the same job.  I have washed it and it came out perfect.  Recommend it.

product_title: Columbia Sportswear Men s Evergreen Shell Jacket

reviews.review_body:
I purchased this jacket while on a ski trip. It performed great as a shell but I bought it with the hopes of "interchanging" with other gear.

It does have the interchange snaps in the sleeves and collar, and the extra inner zipper. On returning from my trip I ordered a Columbia Go To Jacket, which is also interchange compatible. However the zipper length is too short to reach the top of the Evergreen's collar (see picture). I called the customer support line and they first stated the Evergreen isn't interchange compatible. After getting them to look at this web page they talked with their manager and recanted their original statement, but they still couldn't give me a list of liner jackets that are known to work. Nor could they provide any indication why the zipper is too short... is the Evergreen Shell too long in the zipper, or the Go To jacket too short. So "interchange compatible" doesn't appear to be a claim that Columbia is willing to stand by.

It is a shame, Columbia looks like a lot of bang for the buck. But I'll stick with other brands if this is the best Columbia can do with their product and customer service.

First of all, my last Columbia © brand jacket kept me dry in the harshest of conditions, at sea and on mountain for 23 years. Unfortunately in it's 24th year it failed to keep me dry in a torrential downpour so I purchased this jacket as shown here as it's replacement.

I need a jacket that offers some insulation but keeps me from overheating when I'm at work (Outdoors).
The jacket is very light and does not restrict my movements at all.
There are zippers to open vents under the arms.
There is an inner and outer front zipper for severe weather.
It is designed to allow layers underneath.
The jacket waist has an inner snow guard, a band that can be tightened around your waist to keep snow (or cold) from going up and under the jacket.
Sleeves can be tightened with Velcro straps around wrists.
When hood is on and jacket zipped up completely it is snug around the neck and warm.
Highly visible color pattern is attractive and functional for being seen. (good for my job)

I've gotten plenty of compliments from co workers and friends whom have threatened to steal it from me jokingly. The price here at $120 can't be beat.
ok
Great jacket
this is perfect
Fits as expertes,Nice and warm
Extremely fast shipping, fits great.
Very comfortable, very warm, but a little too big
Nice shell, works great for skiing.  Plenty of room to layer,  pit zips add good ventilation.  Color is nice, too.
good
Good value, would purchase again.
Love this Jacket :) It is the shell which is exactly what I was looking for that way i can layer :) If I stand in the Sun it get very warm :) Great Jacket :)
I got it promptly. looks good and sturdy. Im 6'8", broad but not big and its a little baggy in XL, thank god for elastic wrist and waistband. Unbeatable price, nicely played Amazon!
LLegó rápido, es como se menciona en la publicación, lo recomiendo

I ended up sending this jacket back.  It's definitely warm, but it's only a shell so it requires layers or zip in jacket from Columbia.  I love Columbia products, but this jacket seemed to run big and long.  I'm 5'5" so the small was still a little long.  Had to return, but might be good for other people.  It's waterproof and breathable.

However- I thought the Interchange system would allow it to work with my Columbia Ballistic II fleece. It does not. The fleece will not zip into the shell. I finally went to a local store that sells a lot of Columbia products and found a fleece for $55 that would work perfectly. The penny pincher in me told me to put it back and just wear one of my existing fleece jackets underneath without worrying about the zip in feature. So- I saved the $$ and walked away from it.

The shell is good- it sheds rain like a champ and is pretty wind proof. The pit zips help regulate the temperature. I can see no actual benefit to the foil-like material on the inside that is supposed to trap heat.
The takeaway- a good shell- but Interchange does not necessarily mean what it says. Buy with caution if you are mixing and matching.

this jacket was HUGE. the large was more like a XXL. also, it was more of a windbreaker than a jacket you could use in the cold. yes you could put a liner with it, but it just felt so cheap and thin. only cool thing was the zipper.
I love this coat.  It fits well and is comfortable to wear.  I recommend it.

No storm flap over zipper. 3 good outside pockets. three good inside pockets. fairly new.
I like the outside material. Omni water proof. I have 3 other Omni waterproof Columbia jackets,
all have failed after about a year. all outer shells. This one has a tougher outside material than all the
other ones which I like. I am hoping this one does not fail in a year. If it does. I will never recommend
Columbia and or buy any Columbia products ever again. I will bash them every chance I get. This stuff
costs way to much to not perform as advertised. I gave it 4 stars because of the lack of a protective flap
over the zipper. I paid $63.38 shipped.
Nice jacket keeps out the cold air and keeps you warm also works as a rain coat to me
i got this to be a shell coat for skiing, but i doubt i could fit anything under it

Looks great, fits perfectly and keeps you warm. It is well worth it's retail price.

It's got pockets for iPhones and androids, and the inside is "smooth" to slip on. So overall 5 out of 5 stars cause of the color, style, function and brand. The only thing I don't like is the hood is big, and made for a bike helmet or something, but you can just tuck it down.

i liked it but was too bright.

went a size up for hubby to allow for long sleeve bulkier shirts. He loves it, light weight packable.

Ridiculously warm for its weight.  Great travel jacket.  A light shirt and this jacket keep me warm in almost any weather.
Much too big for my son, who normally wears a medium.
My husband hates bulky jackets, the weather has been mild this winter so far, but he says it blocks wind great and good fit.
Very lite and comfortable for cool spring and fall days, or evenings.  It regulates heat well and keeps you dry.
It is thin material, it already has a small rip in it.
Great jacket warm. fits true size don't buy a size large it would be baggy buy the size you normally use
Perfect as I expected it; Looks great, being thermal can be used in the cold
Divina
I love this jacket. It is lightweight and pretty warm. I just throw on a few base layers underneath when it gets really cold out.
bought for my son 18 who would not wear heavy coats or puffer coats; he wears this one all the time; loves it
Love this coat.  I'm a bigger guy and it fits comfortably to size. Very lightweight.  And WARM.  Would definitely recommend.
AWESOME ASS JACKET!!!!! I JUST GOT IT RIGHT NOW!!!...But the price went up high...lucky.. i got mine for like 66$... The price is 106!!!! Anyway... Awesome Jacket!!!
Perfect
Excelente producto
For how thin and light it is, it's surprisingly warm. It's cut big, I'm 6' and 190 pounds and it's a bit large on me.
Jacket fit and was comfortable.. Only issue was the color displayed in the picture was very different from what I received
Bought it for my father. It fit perfectly and he really likes the lightness and the fact that it is not bulky.  I recommend it for anybody.
Good enough. Fits as expected. Maybe a little bit thing for winter, but with a hoody or smth like that, it'll be ok.
Light weight and comfortable, reflective liner does make a difference, use it as a layer under another coat or on its own depending on temperature and level of activity.
too fat
It fit as expected but I didn't realize the insulation would be aluminum
It's ok.
Great
Like it.Warm jacket.
This jacket is great! I'm a tall guy so the long sleeves are a plus. It's very light and very warm. It's been great to wear to football games!
177cm 78KG  size L is too big
I bought this for my husband and he loves it! It's really thin, but the inside lining keeps your really warm. It comfortable and looks great on him.
Too simple as a sportswear .
I wish it was alot more like the womens mighty lite 3 jacket that is better so much better than any mens jacket
The jacket looks great. fits well if a little long in the arms. not cold enough to year it where I am but I;m sure it will be a great sailing jacket.
Buy a big point, but still OK, good quality
Runs large, but a great deal for the money.
Great mid jacket, not too warm not too hot and big. I would no recommend for a full on winter coat.  Great for cold fall days or not so cold winter days.
This was a gift for my father-in-law who is a Texas working through the winter in PA.  BIG difference in weather.  He LOVES this jacket.  Fits him perfect and keeps him toasty-warm.
Lightweight but extremely warm. Can def be used as a primary winter coat w a fleece underneath. I wanted a winter coat that was warm but not to big and bulky, and this coat totally delivers.
Great jacket but it came it way too big for me.
These  jackets are the best I have 2 and just bought this for my husband, light as a feather but keep you very warm, they wash great also bought 1 for my niece can't say enough about these
I purchased this jacket for my husband.  The omni heat feature is very warm.  The jacket is lightweight and perfect for traveling. It does run a little large. Not enough to size down however.
Great jacket! I've purchased Columbia omni-heat insulated jackets before and this one is the best one yet. It is light, warm and stylish. I'm 5'6 and the fit is as expected and snug to the body.

Excellent light weight coat. Very warm! I live in alaska and I can wear this thing everyday and not get very cold. If you where a sweatshirt underneath then there is no problem wearing it skiing or hiking in the mountains
liked the large out side pockets not thrilled by the angle on inside pocket . nice and warm
No complaints - survived the February polar vortex to -20F (ok, I didn't go outside until it was -10F).

Fits great.  It's incredibly warm for its size.  I wore it a lot as a thermal layer when snowboarding and was anything but cold.  It also packs up very small if you need to.  Plus who doesn't like hunter orange!
The warmest jacket for it's weight I've ever had. It gets only 4 stars because it's a little pricey.....But I'd buy it again.

My husband wears a 44L and I originally ordered a large. Had to return for an XL because it was a bit too tight in the shoulders and not quite long enough in the sleeves. He loves the XL and loves how it's not "puffy".
Was perfect for my son who works outside a lot in the winter and a ski jacket is too heavy and cumberson.

Bought this jacket to go snowboarding in Colorado on March 1st. The weather was in the 10s and snowing, I just wore this jacket and a Volcom thermal underneath and I was worm the whole time. Even when I fell from snowboarding the snow/water would just wipe off.
Light
Great jacket. I was able to get this on sale for $49, but I would’ve been satisfied with it if I had to pay full retail. The Omni-Heat is like magic!
This jacket is lighter than expected. The material seems like it will hold up good, but I don't know exactly how warm it will be since it is currently summer here.
Nive and warm, very light weight duie to the new apace type silver lining. Two large side pockets great for jamd warmers.

Extremely Warm.I have stopped using my NorthFace jacket. Good thing about this Jacket is its super light and extremely warm as is it has Omni-Heat along with this it doesnt stick to inner clothes likes shirt or Sweater. My NorthFace jacket always stick to sweaters or shirts as my jacket has web type structure (Thermo Ball?).

Size large was a perfect fit for my husband who typically wears a large in most shirts.  He does not wear lots of heavy thick layers under this, so maybe that would change the fit.  Husband likes it and says it's plenty warm for those few 30-40 degree days with just a long sleeve tee underneath.
This jacket is quite thin, but fairly warm for its size. Husband wore it during -8 celsius with a sweater inside, and he wasn't cold. Be warned that air can enter from the wrist area on the sleeves.

My husband loves this. He was resistant to getting a new jacket as he liked his old tattered one. But this came quickly, fit well, felt good on, very light. He says it is warm when needed but not too warm when the weather is better. He has been showing it to all his friends, proud of how nice it looks.

Received the jacket today.  Ordered the jacket, it runs way too big.  I ordered a large.  I am 5'8''  180lbs.  I work out a lot so I have wide shoulders, and even so this jacket just hung loosely around my body.  It was also a tad long, and is poofier than the picture gives off.  I did order an M to follow up hoping it will fit better.

Columbia has some sizing issues. Completely random! Before buying this jacket I tried in a Columbia store both the Go To and the Shimer. I was a large. But on some other model (interchange) I was medium. Large on the Mighty Lite in too big (compared to Go To and Shimer me tinder jackets, which are very similar)

The jacket itself it's great but it bothers me not been able to trust their sizing guide.

Good quality jacket. It's basically waterpoof and very warm for how thin of a jacket it is. My only complaint would be that it isn't very fitted for skinnier guys like me. I've seen some jackets from more expensive brands like Patagonia that have a much more tapered fit. However, for the price of this thing I can't complain too much.

This was a great gift for my boyfriend's birthday.  Super lightweight for traveling, warm enough for year-round camping, subdued/stylish enough to wear in an urban setting, and will be great in winter.  Got the XL for my XL fella and it fits like a glove.

I bought this for my husband for in Christmas.  He has a bad back and wanted something light weight.  I feared it might not be warm enough in the Winter, as we live in Colorado, but he's comfortable in it even in very cold weather if he wears a sweater under it. I'm toying with the idea of finding a woman's jacket made of the same fabric.

I used this jacket in South China's winter, I find it is very warm under 5-10 degree condition with a baselayer; it is also warm enough for 0 degree weather with a thin mid-layer.  It fits well, I am 168cm ,63kg, the small size fits me greatly. This jacket is not thick,  I recommend this jacket.

Great jacket. Incredibly light and warm. I bought for a month long trip to The North Slope in Alaska. Never needed anything more even with 50 mph winds.
Cons: the elastic on the sleeves would not hold the coat at my wrists. I had to take it to a seamstresss and have her tighten up the elastic for $20

I purchased this jacket in black for my husband, and an orange one for his brother. They both love the jacket. It works great as a ski jacket too. The size chart is very accurate, so please be sure to go by the guide. My husband normally wears an XL, but I got the large since it seemed to run a litter bigger.

Great jacket for cold days.  This jacket is good to maybe 20°F.  Look for 750 power down for colder.  This is like 590 power down.  The silver disco biscuits help, but only if your active.  If you are being active, then this week obviously go colder depending on your activity level.  Stood most wind but not all.  Very water proof.  Very packable.

Really like this jacket except it was a little too small. I'm 5'10 and 190 lbs and the medium size was a little short
in length in the arms and snug at the waist. I reordered a large size and fits better. This was the first time I returned
anything to Amazon and was pleasantly surprise that there was no problems revising my order.

They make such tight or wacky colors for women and it's even worse for plus-size women so I went searching. The color was great and the fit was what I was looking for. The sleeves were a bit long so I rolled them under and secured them with a couple of safety pins.  Don't now what is happening with clothing sleeves these days where they are so out of portion -- but I worked it out.

My son is tall and skinny. 29" hips...However at 17yrs old I don't foresee him getting too much taller so I bought the size medium thinking he would grow into it...fill it out.  But dang it runs big.  Can not find a small in this coat so we are going to keep it and use the draw strings around the bottom of the coat to make it work....to try to make it a little snug to his frame

I have this same coat in the womans long hooded version and love love love the warmth and coat in general

The Omni-Heat NASA space blanket technology seems to work a lot better than North Face's Thermoball/Primaloft insulation. The Mighty Light is also less expensive than North Face, which I think is just more expensive because of the brand name. I normally wear Medium, and decided to try the Mighty Light/Lite in Small. The shoulder/chest fits fine (I'm 6'2" 155 lb) and the length is actually better than North Face. The sleeves are a tad short but the overall torso fit is much slimmer and neater than North Face's ultra relaxed fit.

I can wear just this Mighty Lite in 40F, and my torso and arms would be warm while everything else not covered would be very cold. It also works extremely well as a liner for a soft shell jacket.

The stitching isn't exactly the best. It is already starting to unravel near the main zipper

Overall: 4/5 stars, would benefit from better quality stitching

This coat is great for travel as you can pack it very small - it stuffs easily into small carry on backpack along with raincoat, book, and other essentials.  It is warm for the weight and the bright color makes you easy to find in a crowd!

As other reviewers mentioned, I laughed a little when I received my jacket in the mail. It's so light weight and thin that the mail courier was able to roll up the parcel and jam it into my small NYC mailbox. Upon first sight and feel, this jacket appears to be a spring or autumn jacket...not worthy to wear in winter weather. Well, I put it to the extreme test yesterday. It was an absurdly cold night (7 degrees, felt like -10 here in NYC with 30mph wind gusts). I wore this light jacket with a sweater and you know what? I WAS WARM! It retains your body heat just enough to keep you warm without overheating you or leaving you with frostbite. Kudos to Columbia for making such a great jacket! My only disappointment is that I wish I knew they came in tall sizes. I'm 6'5" and thin, and bought the large size. While it fits, I think I'd have been best suited for a tall medium. I'm still completely satisfied!!

I normally wear an XL but bought this in LG and it fit perfectly. I find this jacket to be very warm considering it's so light weight. It's very comfortable and easy to wear. It's quickly becoming one of my favorites. In fact I bought one for my wife and she loves it. PERFECT !!!! I thinks it's going to be good as an under jacket liner too.  I would highly recommend this jacket -- it's a beauty !!

This my new favorite coat of all time. I am 6'7" with an athletic build and a super long torso. I ordered an XL Tall and the fit is perfect, no more cool breeze on my back! The color in person is not quite as bright and is much more appealing than expected. Have worn with a t-shirt only underneath in 30 degree weather with a pretty strong breeze and wasn't cold! If other colors come available in my size I will be purchasing!

My girlfriend was in need of a new coat so we went looking around locally. She saw the women's version of this one and loved it. After seeing how happy she was with the purchase, I decided to get one for myself. This jacket is great. Very lightweight but still keeps the body warm. I used it all winter without ever feeling I needed something more. A bit pricey maybe, but works fantastic.

I bought this lightweight jacket for my hubby for a trip to New York City. It folds into a very very small space in the carry on luggage. I ordered a small. My hubby is 5-8" and 150 lbs with a 38 chest. It fits perfectly with room for a lightweight sweater beneath. My only, tiny complaint is that it has no inside pockets for a wallet, iPhone, or glasses. The exterior pockets are roomy, lined with a warm material, and have sturdy zippers. Columbia is such a good brand, I was sure the quality would be good, which it is. And a good value for the price.

This is an excellent jacket. At first you would not think you would be warm in this jacket because it is very light, but it is very warm because of the omni-heat technology. I live in city so my form of transportation are my legs, after a few blocks you get very warm in this jacket and it really does hold the heat in. I am very impressed!!! I got lots of compliments on the jacket and my fiance even got one after I had my for about 2 weeks. It is worth the price.

I love this jacket. The name speaks for itself: Mighty Light. This jacket is not heavy, however, it really keeps you warm. I've used it for a couple weeks now here in the winter of the northern Midwest and am very impressed. I bought this jacket to wear in the windy conditions anywhere from upper 40s to around freezing. This jacket does not disappoint. Also, if you are not spending a lot of time outside, or if you are staying active outside, this jacket will surely keep you warm enough even down into the mid 20s. At least that has been my experience so far. If your looking for a lighter jacket that keeps you warm in conditions anywhere from 25-50 degrees I would recommend this product. This is definitely not a winter jacket, though so keep that in mind.

product_title: Red Ledge Men s Free Rein Parka

reviews.review_body: I trusted putting my phone in the hand pockets, and after it stop raining i went to take my phone out, and it was sitting in a puddle of water, the zipper had been closed the entire time. I do not recommend this product.

Apparently someone in the manufacturing or quality control departments allowed an incorrect label to be sewed into the jacket that I received, because if this thing is an Extra Large ... I'm the Pope. According to product description "Generous fit for broad chest and shoulders" ... I didn't even attempt to zip it for fear of busting out like the Incredible Hulk. I own another model rain jacket from Red Ledge that is XL, and have been pleased with it for more than 5 years.

The Jacket looks to be quality made and very nice though.

I work out in the dirt and I'm always hiking and fishing in the rain and this shell works perfect. It's rugged and protects you from the elements perfectly. I wear mediums and this jacket fits me perfectly which lets me move without snagging myself on branches and brush.

I have been wearing Red Ledge jackets for all my mountaineering expeditions since 1996, they have been with me to Bolivia, Alaska, Iceland & more. I just go their latest waterproof jacket & its even batter than the original designs. I have slept outside on a forced bivouac with only this jacket to keep me warm, the hood can accommodate a climbing helmet or a bike Helmut. My wife wears hers while she trains for her first Ironman triathlon. Great for hiking & caving even sea kayaking. I love Red Ledge products, highly recommended!
Parka looked good but "orange" is too neon-like - fine for safety, but to bright for regular wear. Returned it.
Who needs gore tex with red ledge available? Stays water proof even after a couple of seasons commercial fishing.

This is for the Free Rein Jacket!  Great jacket.  Rain literally beads up and falls off the jacket without saturating the jacket.  Dries quickly.  Well made.  Adjustable velcro cuffs, cords at the hood and bottom of jacket.  2 zippered pockets with mesh lining.  2 zippered side vents.  Lightweight.  Not bulky.  Great jacket.  Definitely recommend.

This is the nicest rain coat I have ever owned.  I'm used to the heavy ones that do not breathe at all.  I was surprised at how well made this Red Ledge rain jacket is.  The rain jacket is a good material thickness for the cooler rainy days, but I also don't think it is too hot when it gets muggy out during the rain.  This jacket has pit zippers which open up a huge area to let you get some fresh air in and the hot air out.

I find these a must now that I've worn a rain jacket with venting areas.  This just makes you so much more comfortable.  I was also able to keep these completely open during the rain and I never got wet.

I also really like the hood on this rain jacket.  Most rain jackets have a hood but it is always in your face and if you turn your head it gets in the way.  The hood has a shock cord running through it that can be tightened, above your ears where a baseball cap is worn, and it keeps the hood in place.  This is great and I found it to be very comfortable.

I am 5'10" and 154 lbs. I read a review that said the rain jacket runs a little small so I ordered a large which is a size up from my normal jackets.  I found this to be just about perfect.  The back is longer than the front of this jacket, which I like for using on a bicycle and the sleeves were just about an inch or two long which is great for reaching for the handlebars on the bike.  I would recommend one size up from your normal size as it also allows you to put another layer on underneath if you need to in colder weather.
Not true to size. Cut way to small.
Great rain gear! Used several times over the last month.
Like the color and parka style.
Great product
got this for my son who works in landscaping.  it came just before weeks of rain.  he loves Red Ledge.
Great product ! Lost my first one...received my second !
My first lasted four-years and getting a new one just made me happy. Quality at a great price.
We've been Red Ledge fans for years. Their rain gear is hard to beat. Both Quality and workmanship are excellent.

Great jacket. Loved the fit and feel. Wore it around Alaska for a week and it was the perfect garment.

John Bollman
Looks great, but haven’t use yet.
Lightweight for light rain.
Perfect jacket!  We wanted something small & lightweight and waterproof to leave in the boat!  I will be ordering a 2nd one to have at home!
worn on the AT kept rain off and heat in. very light and packable
as good as its description
Perfect
I loved this jacket when I got it, until about 9 hours into an 12 hour shift when it snagged on a piece of wire and ripped wide open.  Very disappointing
Seems a little large but did not use it yet will be trying it out a couple of weeks
Effect tive water proof jacket of very light weight.
Fits just like jacket. Does a great job with the rain.
I use the free reign jacket working in the oyster farming business and.that usually tears the hell out of heavy rain gear but the coat is awesome only had to buy 1
Perfectly dry in NW rain.
Fits a little small for an extra large, bought for upcoming hiking trip will update review when I return
Great breathability, good finiture, made for working-sport not for fashion.
Wouldn't use this in huracane weather rain, but for medium heavy rain works great. Good quality and very stylish

Very nice jacket, does its job well only problem I've had with it is that the color orange online is not the same color orange that I received... It's more of a neon orange then plain orange which has caused me to be know as the traffic cone among friends
been using this to ride to work. handles 45 degrees and rain pretty well. still warm. i wish it was longer or came in a call. xxl fits ok at 6"2 and 260lbs
The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that it should have a double-zipper, so you can open it from the bottom if you're riding a bike.

It is advertised as waterproof and breathable.  It has been waterproof, so far.  It is not very breathable, however.  If i wear it for any kind if light activity, there is a coating of moisture/perspiration covering the inside.  I would not purchase again.  I would return it, if I wasn't so lazy!

The coat holds up well to the elements and is very comfortable to wear.  The side pockets are a great feature when you want to vent or put your hands somewhere.  The velcro straps on the end of the sleeves are a huge plus when you really want to insulate yourself from rain/wind/etc.  All in all a great coat.

Good coat for the price.  Seems to be as breathable and waterproof as more expensive brand names (OR, Marmot) that I tried.  Pockets somewhat unusual: one large one on each side from roughly chest to hip.

First bought medium  had to send it back for a large. The cut was tailored not blousey. As soon as my husband put the second one on......he said. This is more like it. Did great in any weather. Can’t say enough about it. Returning was easy

I loved it for the first couple of days I had it, I stayed dry with a fleece underneath it but working construction is very ruff on it. It has many small tears, But on that note I will buy it again just NOT for work

I've been through several rain jacket over the years and this tops the list over other expensive brands like Marmot and North Face.
Pros:
- I like rain jackets more slim fit and this fits perfect (I got a large, I am 6' 2" and 160 lbs)
- pit zips are very large for more breathing
- sleeves are perfect length (6' 4" wingspan)
- the small bill on the hood perfectly protects your face
- thick enough so it won't rip with everyday use on other objects but thin enough so you don't overheat

I actually have no cons for this jacket as i love everything about it. Hope this helps

There is no doubt that this jacket is packed full of great performance and features, at a low price... but the material is just way too loud for my taste. If you plan to hike with the hood on, be prepared for a substantial crinkling sound everytime you turn your head. I'm honestly surprised that many other people haven't commented about this. Beyond that, the jacket runs a little smaller to size; I ordered a medium. This was particularly noticeable with under layers. I'll be returning mine, unfortunately.

We bought these to take to on our honeymoon safari in Africa. They are a super lightweight waterproof shell that folds up nicely and takes very little space. In hindsight we should have bought neutral colors for a safari... but didn't realize it at the time.

My husband ordered this. It fits great. He has taken it on trips and it works just fine & Dandy!  As advertisted so read the details.
The color is pretty cool too.
The weather forecast says it won’t rain for three months, but I drought it.

I really like the sturdiness of this jacket. I've worn it out a couple times now and was very glad to have it. It's well ventilated and the vent zippers are tough and placed where they are very easy to use. As some of you may know, the weather in the Pacific Northwest can change quickly, so when the rain and wind kick in, this jacket lets you really batten down hatches and offers fantastic protection from the elements. NOTE: I ordered the orange, this is a really bright international orange much brighter than the product picture on Amazon.  Also, this jacket fits slim. I usually wear XL shirts and jackets and originally ordered this jacket as a XL.  While I could try on the garment there was no room to add any thermal layering thicker than a tee shirt. I reordered as a XXL and this fits much better with plenty of room to add a base layer and a fleece. The larger size also gives you much better freedom of movement.

Purchased for So. Cal. hiking once El Nino arrives. Love the arm pit zips. Those along with the zips that go way up on the sides provides great inside air flow venting. Seems to stay cool, too. I like cool. It's nice and light be very tough. The color is a bit much, but that color was a great sale price, so it's worth it to have such a great deal on such a quality rain coat. Very happy.

This is the second Free Rein I've bought because I like this jacket so much. The first one kept me dry for 6+ years before the inner waterproof membrane started to deteriorate around the neck area and the zipper jammed due to corrosion. It will probably last longer for most people since I flat out abuse my equipment and expose it to saltwater almost every day.  You should be aware that this jacket is not breathable. At all. If you want air you open the vents. It's also shockingly waterproof. I have worn it in the pouring rain and pounding surf for hours and was still dry and that's why I love it.

Good jacket. Breathable and water proof as advertised. Will see how durable it is though.

Update :Has held up well. Used throughout fall clean up season (commercial landscaping) where rain is more the norm than shine.

This is a really nice jacket, I got the green color and love it. it looks really nice, very modern color LOL...in the woods who cares about  it's color ya know? anyway, I take the bus and I don't just use it for backpacking, I use ot on rainy days too when I have to go someplace and wait on the bus. I stay nice and dry, it doesn't make you sweat like you're wearing a trash bag or something (looks a hell of a lot nicer than wearing a trash bag too just sayin) the hood is adjustable too so it's not hanging down in your face and field of vision, there's zips in the pits to veltilate it, the pockets too are made of mesh so if you don't carry anything (I'd be careful about that, don't carry anything in your pockets with sharp corners in it you don't need to anyway, that's why you have a backpack but your phone is good in there, easy to get to, safe in side  and dry)  but anyway, those pocket sif you don't carry stuff in them open the jippers and you've got even better ventilation. the length of it it comes down to my crotch, I'm 5' 10" weigh 180 and I got the large witch  fits good, not tight not baggy. Wish I would've gotten matching rain pants not only for the color but because these are good quality rain jackets, but I got a separate rain pants, also Red Ledge but sort of bronze/brown color anyway, I stay pretty dry,  I've never hiked yet in pouring rain that lasts all day with this jacket yet, but I'm pretty sure anybody's rain jacket and rain pants, if you're in the rain hiking all day longyou're goig to to be wet, from either rain or soaked from sweat because it's so hard hiking up and down mountains with a pack on, you're going to sweat like a hog in any rain jacket in the summer.

Despite the fact that it is a raincoat I bought it as outer layer for skiing and it works well. It gives very good def from wind and the material looks like polyurethane - absolutely waterproof. The size of the pockets with long zippers is very comfortable. The straps on sleeves are good, but sometimes hard to handle with wearing gloves. It is not breathable and since I didn't use vent zips it always was wet inside, when I undressed after skiing. It was not a problem for me, because I dressed jacket over fleece layer, but there are special vent zippers on sides and you can open pocket zippers to vent too. So if you don't afraid of cold you will be dry :) I prefer warm. The back is longer and this is good for them, who wear pants, with bibs it doesn't matter much.
Two things I miss. 1 - small pocket on chest or sleeve for ski pass and 2 - possibility to close and open zipper two ways - from top and from bottom.
My son wear NF Resolve Jacket and his is looking expensive and costs a little bit much than mine, but I still prefer my Green "Red Ledge", because it more comfortable.
I am 6'4" height and 100kg, XL fits me perfect.

product_title: Dominator Waterproof Jacket TT86

reviews.review_body: Got it for 15.00 at a local small business clothing store.  What a steal!  It is hooded and comes with synching on the bottom for a snug fit.  Reflective lines and a neat pocket on the right breast area.
I nice waterproof jacket but I found that side L is a bit snug.  Would advise ordering the next size larger.
Nice quality jacket. Fit as expected. Kept me dry in the rain.

product_title: Columbia Sportswear Men s Evaporation Jacket

reviews.review_body: great?
Good
Just what I hoped it would be
good goods
Good quality and looks.
Good quality product
Light and airy. Perfect for college. Great protection from the elements.
Fit perfect fast shipping
Nice jacket to use when caught in an unexpected rain storm. Looks pretty good too.

The jacket was too small .It was suppose to fit to 46 in in the chest I'm a 44 and I couldn't even get a sweatshirt on under it .The zipper was low quality .And the inside pockets didn't have a bottom. Things would just fall out. Why even bother? Very disappointed in quality of a Columbia product.
Its ok
This is a great lightweight jacket. Very comfortable to wear, it dissipates sweat.
good value
I'm very happy with it. The fabric is all they say!!
Good product
Very nice jacket. Vented and waterproof
Great work jacket

It performed well in a rather heavy down pour in south Florida.
It can still get warm but then again it’s hot down here.
It has that plastic feel and sound to the material, but it is a raincoat.
The vents are a nice addition.
Thx!!!

I bought this jacket for my husband.  He appreciates the underarm zippers for ventilation as his body temperature tends to run on the warm side.  The jacket fits as expected and has a cut that is neither too modern or conservative.
Awesome, excellent quality and very fast shipment!

Husband the Fisherman was soooo happy with this parka. It will get hot but the zippered underarm area provides some cool/ventilation. The light linng prevents some stickiness.
Easy to fold small & tight to fit in backpack. You know hunters & fisherman need to pack light.
Wish it came in bright colors for safety.

Solid product, nicely constructed and stylish. Has some insulating value but it's not going to warm you up too much if you are just wearing a tee shirt under it on a cold day, you'd need a few layers additional lawers for those cold days and night.  Happy with purchase.
Zip pits and correct size.  This was a great deal that I got on a lightening deal.

Fits well, comfortable, nice appearance, looks well made. Product recommended by Siverseas Cruises for Galapagos trip. They offer it at 30% more on their site, glad I  checked  on Amazon found it at a  great price.

product_title: O2 Rainwear Men s Element Series Hooded Jacket

reviews.review_body: Double ply much more durable then the single.
I'm 5'10" 155 lbs. Medium was way too large. Returning for a small.

Light and reasonably compact for the price.  Have not used it in the rain but it made a wonderful packable windbreaker on the peak of Cascade Mountain in the ADK.  If I get a chance to evaluate performance in the rain I will try to remember to update
Jacket is lightweight and sheds water well.  Enough room to layer a sweater or vest.  Two large pockets can hold a wallet or cell phone.

I ironically bought this as a disposable rain jacket-I bike daily here in New York to/from work 18 miles round trip). When the temperature started dropping into the 40s I thought I'd give this a try as a cold-weather garment. I wore it one day when it was 45 wearing only this jacket and a t-shirt. It was fantastic. I couldn't believe it. This morning when I left the house I thought I'd add another layer-a fleece vest. So in 28 degree weather I wore a long-sleeve generic tee, a fleece vest, and this jacket up top. I was perfectly warm! This thing traps heat like nobody's business. I can't tell you how surprising this has been. I love biking in cold weather wearing a minimum of gear. It's fantastic. Highly recommended. Will buy more as a backup-I've found my new winter biking jacket.

Can't give it any stars since I returned the jacket before testing it; way too large--I usually wear a slim medium (my arms are long enough for a large), and this jacket is bigger than my large down jacket. Returning for a small.

I use my rain jacket for cycling and live in the Pacific Northwest where its rainy but the weather doesn't get too cold. For this reason, I wanted a simple, inexpensive, unlined rain jacket that would keep the rain off me. I thought I should be able to get something basic that doesn't cost the earth. This jacket fits the bill.

product_title: Vince Camuto Men s Carbon Coated Quilted Jacket

reviews.review_body: Absolutely love it. Had a similar by Murano from years back that would garner compliments, and this is just the superior superior version of the same. Especially all the extra details, like the pattern on the snaps/buttons just give that extra something to it. As does the quilting.

product_title: Helly Hansen Mens Urban Long Waterproof Jacket

reviews.review_body: Great quality. My husband loves it.
So far so good. Very comfortable and warm
is great quality Helly Hansen is the best, fit is always right !...
It is an excelente parka . Confortable and warm
Love this jacket. Super comfortable. Extremely warm. Never go out on a cold day without it.

product_title: Helly Hansen 53145 Men s Chill Parka

reviews.review_body:
Zipper failed in the middle of second winter.  Jacket we purchased 12/1/19

Update to first review.  Added two stars for customer service.  Returned damaged jacket to local HH store and they offered me a new equivalent jacket no questions asked.
Very nice jacket

I wish this jacket was warmer.  I’ve had it now for one season.  When it arrived I was on the fence about whether it would be warm enough for winter (Central Massachusetts).  I ended up keeping it, but it is not warm enough and I ended up staying with my old worn out north face jacket instead.

I bought this because I wanted a winter coat that wasn’t insulated with goose down (it’s cruel).  My old north face was also insulated with synthetic materials and was plenty warm enough.

It’s made well and it’s comfortable and it looks good.  Pockets are comfortable for your hands.  It’s roomy enough to wear over fleece pullover.  Materials are nice.  Just wish it was warmer.

Note that they put the zipper flap only on the inside only.  Not a huge deal, but if you wanted to use this in active snow storm like while skiing, nothing is stopping the snow from crusting up the zipper.
Great purchase! Absolutely satisfied!!

It looks nice and has (what seems to be) a durable outside fabric. I guess I must be getting overly sensitive to the cold. I ordered two other parkas before this one and each seemed to provide the same amount of warmth.

The first was an $80 parka from Walmart with polyester lining and the second was a down-filled $180 parka from L.L. Bean. I still have a ten-year-old Helly-Hansen ski parka that is shorter and just as warm as this one. The zipper on it was cheap plastic, otherwise, the quality was excellent.

I spent $300 for this parka and I'm not sure that I see a real difference in warmth between the three even though there is a great difference in price.
A little tight in the arm pit. GREAT jacket.

Fit is true to size. I'm 6'4", and went with XL and I have some room to layer underneath. This jacket is very warm. Admittedly I live in Texas. But at about 30 degrees I don't feel any cold in this. It maybe doesn't breathe the best, I can overheat in about 40 degrees weather. But maybe it breathes better when you're in 10-20 degrees. The hood is removable.

Great coat. It runs a bit small. If you are usually are on the top of the size ”range” or wear heavy sweaters, I would suggest sizing up. That’s fairly normal for HH. It’s been in the teens for weeks and I can wear this with a t-shirt and be comfortable.  Using a snow blower, 15° F and a Tshirt on, I was sweating in 20 minutes. The vents in the chest worked perfectly.

product_title: Columbia Men s CLG Sideline Parka

reviews.review_body:
Logo different from that of advertising.
It's horrible look at the photo.
The sizing on this was inaccurate.  Ordered the M and it was HUGE, ordered the S and it was snug.  Worse yet, months for refund.  Love the Spartans, but this coat, brand, and store were all wrong.

product_title: Columbia Men s Grade Max Softshell Jacket

reviews.review_body: I love this jacket. I am not one to wear coats during the winter but wanted something that was not too bulky. I got tons of compliments on the jacket and people are always curious about the reflective dots on the inside.

First off, I want to note that I bought mine at a Columbia Outlet and it's identical to this one except mine shows "Columbia Titanium" on the logo and this one lacks the "Titanium" designation - they are otherwise identical in construction, materials, features, etc per the description and picture, so I assume it's the same jacket & Columbia at some point decided to make it a part of their Titanium line.

That said, I have mixed feelings about this piece.  First off the positives: the biggest draw is that it looks really nice.  The wooly outer finish makes it look a bit classier than a standard softshell or fleece.  The stretchy sleeve accents and cuffs, however, give it a sportier technical looking edge.  It really rides the fence between sweater and jacket, with the look of a pseudo-cardigan but the sturdier fabric & weight of a jacket.  In any case, it's sharp and handsome.  Second, the fit is accurate with the XL fitting me just like I would expect.  It's not an athletic fit, but not overly baggy either.  A clean design with sleeves that are amply long for this long-armed guy.

Now the negatives:  first, the Omni Heat feature doesn't seem that noticeable.  I wore this outside playing with the kids on a damp overcast day in the low 40s with a long sleeve tee underneath, and was still a bit chilly.  In particular the jacket isn't especially wind-resistant, with occasional light breezes cutting through it a little.  I hoped that with the "Omni Heat" technology it would be toasty in what I consider moderately cool temps, but I was still a bit chilly.  Second, you HAVE to wear this zipped up unless you want to take a major beat down from your friends for the disco shiny silver lining.  Seriously, I think Columbia will go farther with this Omni Heat thing if they can tone down the glitz.  Lastly, this jacket lacks much in the way of technical features.  No extra pockets beyond the two hand pockets, surprising since Columbia is usually great about giving an extra pocket on the chest or sleeve.  There's also no drawstring to tighten the waist, so cold air can find its way in around the midsection.

All in all, I think this jacket works really well for casual use like a sweater.  Is is less effective, however, as a cold weather jacket.
Within that context, it's a good casual wear value at a lower price point (I snagged it for $32!) that you'd expect for a nice sweater.  But if I were spending closer to a hundred bucks or more on a jacket to keep me warm, this one wouldn't make the cut.
Most soft shells seem to be pretty bland, but this one has some style and modern technology.  Nice jacket!  I'd recommend it.

intially purchased jacket at bass pro shop for $130 dollars. after looking online found better deal at amazon for $85. Very warm, living in chicago okay to wear with a t-shirt outside and not get cold.
Very we'll made coat kinda more of a dress coat but still nice to wear out for doing anything.  Also coat is very warm with the omni heat shield in it.

This is my favorite jacket for daily use.  I live in Denver, and this jacket is warm enough for very chilly temperatures, as long as you are somewhat active.  I really do think the "solar blanket fabric" on the inside does reflect heat back into your body.  On occasion, even in below freezing temperatures, if I even jog, I feel my arms and exposed skin start to sweat.

Lightweight, warm, comfortable, fashionable, this coat has it all!
Sleeves too short for my 6' body. Bought a small but the fit was poor, not something I've found with other Columbia products.

This jacket with Omni-Heat technology is not a warm jacket by any stretch of the imagination. I wore this jacket outside in 30 degree/light wind and it provided less warmth than a common fleece hoodie. I would not recommend this jacket if you need something that keeps you warm even though it sports this shiny heat technology.

I was't shocked to find out that it was not warm but I was surprised that it didn't even block light wind. I have cheap lightweight jackets that do a much better job in this category as well. I don't recommend this jacket if you need a wind breaking jacket.

But it really is a sharp looking jacket. Everyone that has seen me in this jacket has commented on how nice it looks. I do recommend this if you are looking for a fashionable sporty type jacket.

I cannot comment on how dry it stays but it looks like it might be OK in that category.
ok

Completely waterproof despite its sweater-like piece predominantly covering the jacket.  I have had it over a year now and what I like most about it is the omni-heat.  I seriously can take this out on a windy, 35-degree day with a t-shirt underneath and stay warm.  Also, you can also wear this jacket in a business casual environment, which is really nice if you are in outside sales or an office environment.

A large can tend to be a pretty snug fit, so if you plan on adding layers underneath, or you are over 6' tall, get a size up.

I seldom leave a review of a product (I know, I'm one of those terrible people that will only say something if it's a bad product), but this one deserves it.

This jacket is probably the best jacket I've ever owned.  It's warm, but not overly warm, and blocks the wind just fine.  Yes, if you leave your jacket unzipped, wind will get in there and it won't function that great as a windbreaker...who would've thought...  I live in Oklahoma and, similar to Kansas, we get tons of wind here, so I'm not just talking outta' my rear on this matter.

I also like it because it doesn't look like another North Face jacket that all the dudebros wear, nor does it look like a clone of one.

Most importantly, this jacket holds up to some serious wear-n-tear.  I do a lot of Geocaching and, like I mentioned about being in Oklahoma, there's a lot of thickets and underbrush I have to push through.  This jacket hasn't torn, the wooly parts haven't been disintegrated, etc.

Great quality, great function, nice style.  5 stars, Columbia.

product_title: Oakley Men s Crescent 3 0 Shell Jacket

reviews.review_body: My husband and son was elated with the style and fit of the jacket!!

Overall I'm 5'7 ordered a medium it was alittle big. Returned and got a small still alittle baggy but feels very comfortable. I got myself a small. Other than that.. good enough. 5 star bc I returned and ordered a smaller size and it came in 4 days later.

Oakley shells are my new favorite outerwear. Built for real people without sculpted bodies. Plenty of room for articulated movement in the cold and undergarments, but not so large that it looks ridiculous
Bought it for my husband for Christmas. He loves it! Both the fit and the color scheme

I'm 6'3, 220, fit and muscular. The XXL was perfect on the shoulders. Length was perfect on sleeves and waist. Jacket is light and windproof/waterproof, but avoid really wet conditions with this one and keep it to more moderate and drier snowfalls. Good pockets, pairs well with the matching Oakley pant. Expect compliments, especially in the white.

product_title: Port Authority Tall Lightweight Charger Jacket TLJ329

reviews.review_body: I'm 6'5" tall and this jacket fits perfectly. Nice long sleeves and lightweight. Tall guys; take note of this brand.

I am 6'3" with long arms and this jacket fit perfectly. It is well made and has a large zippered pocket inside which will come in handy when I travel. I rate products honestly and this is well worth the money. If you're tall like me, you know how difficult it can be to find good fitting clothing, especially on-line. This will fit as expected.

product_title: DRI Duck Men s Outlaw Jacket

reviews.review_body: I’m 6’3”, 218.  Normally can fit a large, but like a large tall.  Dried I has had any of that size in stock, so went with the xtra large tall.  Glad I did.  These jacket do run a little small.  Washed it twice in hot water and dried it on high.  Fits perfect!  Well made.  Softer duck than Carhartt, but still well made.  Love it!
Great coat

Great value, love this jacket.
One of my best jackets!
Awesome product
Very Bad Coat, the back size of the coat is higher, than the front.  Bad quality and not the same stile as in the picture.
nice and warm
Great cloth, great stitching, great design !!
My husband loves this jacket.
Excellent, fits like a glove and it is very warm.
Love this jacket.  Warm and very sharp looking

perfect fit, great quality exceeded expectations.

Great jacket.  Fit my husband perfectly. He loves it.
Warm, comfortable and looks good. Purchased this for my husband and he loves it
Great quality jacket for the price. Really warm too.
Great jacket! Kept me definitely warm on 30 degree temps. Kept out the damp air and some.
Perfect fit and very warm, love the 2 inside pockets!
I love this coat. When 20 degrees out and windy.. I am comfortable. Great for layering as well. Looks good as it works
My husband has thoroughly enjoyed his jacket and I believe will do so for many years to come - provided he does not gain weight!
Warm jacket comfortable fit,
I returned the jacket because the fit was weird. Kind of tight in the armpits and just didn't set right on me. I think the cut is off.
Great jacket! Medium weight and stylish.
size runs a little small
Great jacket, fits like a jacket should and the quality is second to none.
Awesome jacket at a great price.

My husband liked this jacket very much-until we washed it. We washed and dried as directed but now it looks tie died where the die has washed out in spots. And no...there was no bleach, color safe or otherwise, used.
Not as warm as made out to be on reviews
Great jacket. I compared and it is better made and better fitting than Carhartt at a franction of the price. Looks good too. Highly recommended.
Really like this jacket. It does fit a little large, but that's a good thing because you can dress in layers.
Color was off a bit from the picture. Looked more green than it really is. It is a solid brown.The fit is fine.
Good and sturdy would have liked to have the coat be slightly longer. Bought for a big and TALL man.
this is my second jacket, i love how it fits. Last one lasted a tough 3-4 years. would highly recommend this product.
Very good
Great fit.
Fits as expected.  No issues staying warm in this jacket.  Like the length in the back.
Claims lightweight but it has a heavy lining. Definitely a colder weather jacket.
The color is some different
Seems durable and well made. Wish a snap-on hood was available, though.
Just got mine today. Looks really awesome in black. Heavy feel, sturdy, lots of pockets, and so far it's really warm. Great jacket that will likely last for many years
I like how it feels to bad I bought it for my dad

Shipping cost to Australia caught me out. Speed clicked through the checkout and got burned.
The jacket seems very durable, but early days yet. A bit bulky and stiff. Should soften up with wear I hope.
I had a similar jacket, once, from Timberland.  I've not been able to find a replacement but this one has been great.  I would like a few more pockets but that's my only complaint.
Nice jacket for 23 bucks!  Warmer than I thought it would be.
Great jacket fits perfectly. Not to heavy but not to thin. Great jacket ordering another just to have on hand.

I live outside of Fort Worth, TX so having a heavy winter coat is rarely needed. However, I took this jacket with me to Des Moines, IA in February and was able to comfortably walk outside. A great jacket and worth buying.
Nice coat at a very reasonable price.  Seems to be sturdy and well made.  Fit little snug across the shoulders.
Great size and it keeps my boyfriend warm! Came in quickly. Kinda has shoulder pads though.
exact replacement of work jacket lost on the job. yeah
The jacket was heavier than I expected but it will be useful this fall and winter.

I like this coat as it is very comfortable, keeps you warm.  I tend to overheat in coats this one breathes well and keeps you dry.
It was delivered today, took it out of the box and wore it immediately, received many compliments.
Nice coat  but  pockets  are very shallow.

it looks seriously good, but mine looks better than picture
