Normally I would take a large but had to exchange it for an XL. Runs a little small. This is a fabulous jacket for the money. Roomy and very warm and non restricting. Highly recommend.
Over fit is ok but a little big around the waist.

I am 5'11" 185 lbs. I ordered size Medium, as all of my other jackets are. The sleeves on this jacket are nearly 2" short of covering my wrists.
I JUST HAD TO PAY $13.50 to return this jacket!!!
In 10 years of shopping on Amazon, I have never had to pay return shipping on anything.
Therefore, I would advise ordering a size larger than normal, unless you have deep pockets. Which I do not. (nor does this jacket)
Other than my being gouged on the return costs as mentioned above, it seems to be a nice, thick, warm & Heavy jacket.
One last thing- the plastic bag it came in states that it was made in Bangladesh, not China as stated in the product description.
The fit is amazing and the quality is outstanding. It’s roomy for layers but true to size with a nice fit. I’m expecting to have this jacket for a long time.
Delivery fast, package was intact, size M is suitable for 176CM height, 80 KG weight. It would be perfect if the zip was solid brass. It's very warm for Shanghai's winter.
Great jacket for the PNW. This over a hoody is perfect for the slight wet cold out in the PNW. Not all that waterproof, but extremely rugged. Good seams, strong zipper.

Have you ever bought a jacket that when you put it on....it just fits perfectly? I wear it to town, I wear it riding, and I wear it in the snow and cold....perfect. I own a Carhart as well, this is even better.I orded one for Christmas for my daughter and son-in-law and they say the same thing. Thankyou!!
nice and warm, seems like sleeves are too short as compared to same size jackets i normally purchase
sure - he would love a brand name that starts with car, but for less than half the cost, it will be perfect! bought XL, He is between L and XL, XL fits perfect.
Runs small which is perfect since I’m a small dude lol small jackets usually fit me a bit larger but this fits like a glove. And it’s warm too!
The most comfortable jacket I own. These aren't like other work coats - you won't need a decade of uncomfortable wear to like this one, it was perfect right out of the box! I'm a Dri Duck convert!

This was the oddest-fitting jacket I've ever seen. The XL size fits perfectly in the chest and trunk, but the sleeves end two to three inches above the wrist. I have normal-sized arms, an XL has been the size I've worn since I was 18, and that size has never failed to cover my arms until this jacket arrived. This is a lined jacket for all-weather winter use, and even with gloves, it would leave two inches of arm or shirt sleeve exposed. I asked for and immediately got a return authorization from Amazon. But two weeks after UPS tracking showed that the package arrived at the seller's door, no acknowledgement of receipt from the company, no notice of when or how a refund would be forthcoming, no communication at all, After 2 contact-the-seller emails went unacknowledged, I contacted Amazon, and they IMMEDIATELY processed a refund - out of their own pocket. I presume they will now go after the seller for the money. Meanwhile, I've resolved to NEVER patronize this seller again...
Nice Jacket.Only complaint is I think the pockets are a little shallow.I think the side pockets should be deeper.

It did not fit someone whose size is M as the jacket size nor someone whose size is L. Problem with the shoulder line and sleeve length for the M, and everything else for the L.
I couldn't make a return because I exceeded one month, it took time to have another friend to try it before deciding the return finally!

From the description and photos, I assumed this was much lighter. I find it to be to heavy, stiff, & bulky. It's spent more time in my closet than on me.

Also, it's more coyote brown than it looks in the photos-I was expecting an olive or sage green color.

Other than that, it looks fine and some people complimented me on it.

I didn't return it but I would not buy another.
review_topics: I find it to be to heavy

reviews.review_body: I was looking for a jacket suitable for spring and fall north east weather, when the temperature is between 35 and 50 degrees. This jacket fit the bill perfectly, it is warm and comfortable . I would recommend it to anyone with a similar need.

It may be a wonderful jacket for many people, however I found it to be too short.  Well construction and a good fit otherwise.Just not long enough.  I usually find that manufactures have a tendency to make things wider around, but either not long enough or they don't make in a tall size.  A conundrum to say the least.  Had they had a tall size and it was available, I would have ordered it and been totally satisfied.
Looks nice enough to wear around town, but tough enough to use at work. It is a rather heavier jacket, which I like. Inside pockets, triple stitching, what's not to like?

This jacket is more than expected , the quilted  lining and inside knitted cuffs makes this a very warm and durable coat. This coat is not stiff like carhartt  and other brands. This coat would easily cost $140 in other brands a steal @  $67.

I ordered this jacket in a Medium as a gift, and it arrived in an XL. I had purchased this jacket when the price had gone down, so was disappointed that I didn't have the option to exchange it for the correct sizing that was ordered. I would've had to send it back, get a refund and then purchase a new one altogether, where the price had gone up again already. I also wished the jacket was actually olive green as it's pictured, but the field khaki is a dark muted khaki color instead. The material was very heavy duty and the lining was nice. The shape of the jacket was also boxier than it is in the photo, and isn't as refined / nice looking as pictured. I would recommend this as a very casual rugged working jacket.

Outstanding mid-weight jacket!  Very well made.  I originally ordered black.  I liked it so much and the price was so good, I ordered another one in tobacco.  The drop panel across the back waist is a nice touch.  I’m a 48 inch chest, about 225 lbs and the XL is a great fit.
Good coat down to 30 degrees. I like that it doesn't have a hood I'm not a fan of hoods and it has nice sleaves and has a decent mining overall nice fit.

Jacket appears to be well made and is reasonably priced. Fit and function are good, I bought 3X and its in-line with other items I've purchased, fit is appropriate and size is right on. I would buy this again without hesitation. This is a little on the heavy side to be a jacket but that does not bother me at all.
Love the coat!! Fits great!!
Fits as expected.  A little heavier than expected, but that's okay.  Seems like good workmanship and less than half the price of a similar Carhart.

Great jacket, this replaces my favorite 1980s carharrt  quilt lined detroit jacket finally. I never was a fan of the Carhartt blanket lined jackets that came out in the 90s, been looking for a replacement and this one is great. I am ordering two more in the case they decide to change as they all do. So goodby Carhartt hello Dri duck. Also fits well the large is a 44 and I don't know what some of the reviewers were complaining about this is a very nice looking jacket I am ordering two for my boys also.

I don't love the feel of man made material - ski jackets, puffer jackets, etc... Large is a perfect fit for me at 5-10, 175lbs. Feels like wearing a (not yet broken in) blanket... It'll get there though. Only complaint is that the side pockets are a little shallow. Otherwise, perfect.
yep, a decent work coat. Does tend to run small in larger sizes.  may want to consider up a size. every thing I buy is an xlt this coat I needed to have a xxlt then fit fine.
Bought the jacket for a hunting trip. Temps were in the low 40s and windchill in the mid 30s. Jacket was great - comfortable and warm (with a couple layers under... Great jacket for the price!

I cant imagine a better jacket for the price and this jacket is not cheap in any way. The only "cheap" is the collar ie colors do not match jacket e.g. brown collar black jacket is not the best...but do not regret the purchase. Very warm but not too warm like a Carhart is. Still but not too stiff....if you like rugged canvas. buy this jacket.

I’ve been using this jacket for a lot of outdoor work and it’s held up very well. Keeps you warm, can fit a sweatshirt underneath, and is still comfortable in the cooler parts of fall and spring. I’ll definitely come back to Dri Duck once I wear through this one. Fits well and looks good for wearing around once you clean the mud off of it.
A little tight, and sleeves a bit short (6'3", 200lb).

Okay, so I paid $37 for mine. That might have a little to do with my love of this jacket, but still its a really good quality jacket. The inside is comfy, arms are a smidge long, but I got a 3 xl for a 5'10 260 lb person. The arm space is adequate, plus some. The pockets themselves are of good quality construction. The outer shell has been better than expected. The length is spot on. I bought a carhartt Detroit jacket in 2 xl and it felt like a fat guy in a little suit. This is twice the jacket for a quarter of the price. No complaints, wore it a month before I took it off.

I like everything about it, especially the lower back that doesn’t roll up if I’m driving a truck or tractor for a few hours. Sometimes it feels a little short on my torso, but I can live with it. This was my first non-carhartt outer wear purchase and I am pleased.

Well made jacket and nice design for work clothing.  Not as nice as some of the pictures, though.  Material is fairly tough and happily not as stiff as I expected.  I would give it 5 stars except for the sizing.  I'm 6'1" tall with a 41" chest, 32" waist, and weigh 164lbs.  I usually take between a 34" and 35" sleeve in a shirt.  I bought this jacket in size medium.
The width of the jacket fit nicely, though there would be no room for layering.  However the sleeves were too short so I am returning it.  I wish the sleeves had been longer.  I recently bought two Carhartt jackets in medium, an the sleeves were plenty long enough for me.  I think Dri-duck needs to update its sizing, because men are taller than they were in the 70s and 80s, when medium was meant for a 33" sleeve, whereas these days many clothing manufacturers design medium to fit a 34" sleeve.  Too bad, I really would have liked to keep this jacket.

Buying online, without trying is always a risky business, but in my case this was like a tailor made jacket.
Longer in the back is a practical feature, plenty of pockets, robust construction. It is not as light and warm as a down jacket but on the other hand it will not melt near a flame or hot object, also I can hardly imagine how it could be torn (a reviewer mentioned it could stop a grizzly attack).

I have been spending a great deal of time looking for a jacket to replace my decade old canvas cotton bomber-style jacket from Camel Collections.

This jacket, in the core elements, looks similar to my beloved bomber. It has a contrasting color collar, although in the case of this jacket, the collar is made of corduroy (not leather). It's a camel (khaki) color for the main body. It lacks the leather accents on the side pockets.

Well, since I had spent upwards of 15 hours in shopping malls and online searches, I decided to go with this jacket, and accept that I would never find another canvas cotton bomber that combined subtle accents of style with the comfort and toughness of canvas cotton.

So, I decided to roll the dice and hope that this jacket would be a suitable replacement for my old bomber.

Here are the Pros and Cons.

Pros

- The Canvas Cotton material feels tough, durable and breathable
- Just the right number of pockets (2 side, 1 breast, and 1 interior)
- Tough, well constructed zipper
- Large sleeves with ample room and a tight cuff which won't let wind through
- The nylon lining is warm and suitable for winter wear

Cons

- The jacket is a bit on the heavy side (as another commenter mentioned)
* The description of the jacket indicates it has a "bi-swing" back, which turns out to be extra "flaps" of material on the shoulder blades section of the jacket, which, in my opinion, look ridiculous
- The "drop tail" back looks a bit like the coat tails of a concert pianist, or the tail of a duck
- The description provided on the page uses terms like "bi-swing back" and "drop tail design" which the average consumer would be unfamiliar with and be unable to conjure up an image of. A picture of the back of the jacket should be provided (so I did. check out the customer photos for shots of the jackets back)

After having actually touched and seen the jacket up close, tried it out, and looked at in the mirror, I have come to the conclusion that this jacket is really NOT intended for casual wear. Rather, this jacket is designed, specifically, for guys who are working in construction and heavy industry.

The "bi-swing" back, with its flaps of extra material, does indeed provide additional freedom of movement for the arms and seems specifically designed with the vigorous movement required of guys working on the job site in mind.

As indicated in the title of the review, this jacket is very similar in construction, material and style to a Carhartt. It's a bit more stylish than the typical Carhartt, perhaps not unsuitable for being sufficiently flattering in appearance to ask out a pretty girl from the local building supply store, but it is definitely not suitable for taking said girl out for dinner and a movie.

Did I like this jacket? No. But I was expecting a jacket I could wear as a casual jacket for going out and about. I think this jacket is very suitable for construction, both contractors and journeymen.

I would be happy if I knew that this review helped guys to have it crystal clear to themselves that this jacket is NOT suitable for casual wear, and to purchase it if they are in the market for a warm jacket to use working on the job site, or shopping for building materials.

As for me, my quest for a stylish, canvas cotton bomber, continues.

P.S : On a quick side note, I purchased a very cool bomber from Mark's Work Wearhouse which looked like it had been taken from the closet of a WW II bomber pilot. Unfortunately, the material was PVC, and as I learned, PVC does NOT breathe at all. If you are looking for a jacket, don't buy PVC, unless you want to remove your jacket at a party and find that your shirt has unsightly sweat stains marring its appearance.

I received a large hooded DriDuck jacket through work and it fit great. However I originally ordered this jacket in a large thinking it would fit the same. It didn't. The fit was tight so I sent it back and ordered an extra large. I'm very happy with the fit this time. It's a warm jacket and it is very well made and the ribbed wind sleeves are comfortable. Overall once I got the size right I'm extremely happy with this jacket. Be aware that all jackets fit
differently. My advice on this jacket is if you are border line on size, go high rather than low.

I bought 2 of these jackets since I impressed with the quality and fit.

I first ordered the field khaki version. It's really a coyote brown color like a different reviewer mentioned.  Still looks good. The second jacket was tobacco in color.  I like the dark brown in tobacco better.

My deal was close to 50.00 dollars a piece if I recall off hand.  That is great price for the quality being on par with Carhartt.

Jackets are very sturdy.  Personally I don't think the material is too heavy for it's obvious intended use.  It's a work jacket that can pass for casual wear. These jackets will last for years.  Wish I lived a colder climate to get more use of the two jackets I bought. I''ll simply keep one for real work and the other for casual wear.

On that note, the styling is good.  I'm not the most fashionable person but this is a guys jacket.  Make no mistake, your not getting metro-sexual styling.  That's a plus.

The fit was excellent.  I'm broad shouldered and the jacket fits in an XL size.  Typically when I buy a suit, I buy 48 regular.  Based on the Dri-duck sizing chart, that seemed right on.

I definitely would recommend this jacket as a good buy.

Love the jacket, seems very tough and comfortable. I bought an extra large which normally fit me big but this jacket fits great and your not swimming in it. If you want to wear layers under it I would recommend to get one size larger. It's a very warm jacket, happy that I bought it.

This is a great coat at a great price.  The duck material is thick and rugged, and the color is great.  The sleeves are also really well designed.  They have elastic fabric at your wrists that is covered by the sleeve.  This makes them really warm and great for working with your hands.  The coat is well sized to allow full movement.  The waist is curved, longer in the back that in the front.  This allows you to bend over to work and pick things up while not exposing your lower back.  The ONLY reason this coat didn't get a 5-star rating is because when zipped all the way up, the neck opening is too loose around your neck.  For me, this is not as warm as I would like on a cold winter day.  I would give the coat a 4.5-star rating if I could.

Ordered this as a replacement for my older Carhartt Detroit jacket I’ve had for many years.
Overall very similar to the Detroit, less expensive and better overall quality and getting it shipped to me in a week instead of waiting until March for another Detroit jacket was a plus.
I work in construction and has kept me warm with a regular sweatshirt underneath and has held up to the daily work grind and yard work at my house.
Probably will stick with Dri Duck vs Carhartt going forward.
I ordered a small, I’m 5’9’’ 130-140 lbs fluctuates and this fits me perfectly. Not super large or baggy and enough room to wear hooded sweatshirt underneath. The bottom of the jacket comes down a little bit below the top of my back pocket.

I bought this jacket in Khaki, size medium. I'm 5'10", 160. Fit is perfect.

Khaki is an odd name for this color. I'd call it a lighter shade of tobbaco (its got brown and a bit of Army green hint to it). It's very good looking. Now, this is a working-man's jacket, so, yeah... it's heavier than a nylon yuppi's jacket. The bifold shoulders do the job properly and retract perfectly, the heavy 12oz canvas's weave is tight enough to minimize the wind cutting through it, the corduroy collar is comfy and doesn't sit tight on the neck (though if you zip all the way it wraps tight). The back of the coat has a bit of a drop-tail so when you bend over you don't expose above the belt but it's not excessive. There are two nicely done inside pockets (one's zipped for a cell or small note pad, the larger one is terrific for placing a flashlight or tools... whatever). It's also got an exterior zippered breast pocket. There's an elastic cuff in the sleeve, the inside has waffle-sewn insulation with a black nylon covering so it slides on and sits well over your work clothes. Lastly... this baby is using YKK zippers and they glide like a Caddy!

The only thing I hesitate on is whether it'll be warm enough with the 1/2 inch of insulation. It gets to -20F here so there's no cotton jacket in the world that handles that! So, I'm prepared to use layers. The good news is the jacket's wind resistant and provides enough roominess to wear at least good shirt and Polarguard sweater underneath.

I run a tow truck and need something that fits comfortable, is tough and washes without having to pamper it. I don't mind looking good while I'm at it. I can honestly say I was 100% happy with this jacket in every regard. And especially happy I didn't go with a Carhart for 3 times the price.

product_title: Port Authority 1 2Zip Wind Jacket J703

reviews.review_body: I ordered this jacket because I have the same one (J705) that I bought about 10 years ago and still wear it and I love it. However, when I tried it on, it was too short at the waist and sleeve length; shorter than the XL that I already have. I want to believe this is a genuine Port Authority jacket, but when I ordered another one from a real Port Authority distributor, it was sized perfectly. So, if you are looking for a genuine product, then perhaps you should look somewhere else.

My husband owned one of these jackets already and liked it so much that I looked for the coat online.  Our kids each wanted a jacket for themselves.  I was excited that I could buy them through Amazon.  After they came we had them embroidered in the space on the left upper chest.  The look awesome! These coats are perfect spring and fall coats.  My daughter wears hers in the winter as well.  The jacket is medium weight, nice fabric and warm.

product_title: Striker Boys Climate Durable Windproof Water Resistant Insulated Outdoor Ice Fishing Jacket with Removable Hood

reviews.review_body: This is the cold weather gear you want. Flexible warm and durable
Great jacket. Keeps you very warm.

Update: After spending the day getting snowed on for approximately 4 hours, the jacket was starting to soak with water. The claim that these jackets are waterproof is a bit misleading and once I dug a little further into the Striker Ice website I came across their explanation. Bottom line these jackets are not waterproof by definition. They are to a point. The waterproof rating is 1/5th that of Gortex. They also claim the zippers to be waterproof yet the pockets did have some water in them. A jacket at this price range to me should have better protection, but maybe I am just asking too much.

Love this jacket. I haven't had a chance to really test it and I pretty much use the liner or the shell. The liner is good for the mid 40s for general use. I have worn the shell by itself as low as 27 degrees and though I could feel it a little bit in the sleeves, my core area stayed comfortable with just a t-shirt. My biggest gripe is for a 4xl the sleeves are short when my arms are extended. Maybe that's by design. I dont use this jacket for it's intended use (ice fishing) so maybe there's a reason. I have a long torso and this is one of the few jackets that fits me good. Only other thing I'd like to see is this jacket made in the US and not china. I'd expect to pay 320.00 for a US made jacket but not a Chinese jacket.

Great coat however runs small. I went up a size and it was still small. I'm a big guy and I wear a 3xl in most coats for extra room. I ordered a 4xl and it fits snug. I have a big chest and shoulders. The coat fits well with my chest and shoulders but tight in the waist area. I still recommend this coat to anyone.

What can I say about this product other than I love it.  I purchased it for an ice fishing trip in Wyoming and it got a great test, fished in blizzard conditions with sub zero temperatures.  This thing is warm, almost too warm.  Luckily it can be worn inner, outer, or both so matching conditions has been great.
Coat is great. Its warm repels water. Even looks great until you zip up the coat. I’m in a wheelchair and can’t return maybe I’ll find someone to make repairs to the front zipper.

It's perfect
thanks for the good item and fast deliver

product_title: Salomon Men s Insulated Jacket

reviews.review_body:
Its warm but it doesn't let the sweat out... after a few min. I was all wet inside.
The size is all wrong, I have another salomon, L size as well. This one is either too small or the fit is just wrong.
The stomach area is ok, the shoulders are too tight/narrow. I can't move my hands freely. Seems like around the arm/shoulder it gonna tear apart.
The pockets are way too small to be usable.
The wind-block cuffs are not elastic so air does come through the sleeves.
I usually wear M-L sizes, XL sizes make me look fat and are not comfortable. Fit-built is plain wrong on this item.
I noticed that if I don't wash it after 1 day it will start to smell... even when using deodorant... it seems it doesnt have anti-odor/anti-bacteria deodorant built-into it like other products I have.
Too bad. I really love this color :(

I have the hooded version of this jacket.

It is a very comfortable jacket, (albeit with slightly longer arms). The collar is fleece lines, as are the pockets. The sleeve cuffs are elastic and very comfortable and prevent drafts going up sleeve. The synthetic fill is warm, but comfortable (not too warm, in my opinion).  I find the jacket breathable, and use it as a mid-layer for very cold days under a shell, and as a stand-alone jacket on mild fall or early spring days.

However, it is a nice warm jacket, that is warmer than my fleece.  It has a good weight to it as well.  I think it will break in nicely and last a long time.

Awful lining.  Plastic and makes you sweat like inside a sauna.  Even w/ moderate effort.  Completely defeats the breathing ability of wool, which is why I like it.  Going to cut the lining out of mine which will probably ruin it but its no good the way it is now.

This is one awesome jacket! (Coat?) It is very warm simply because of its Omni-heat system aka: the silver heat reflecting lining that makes up the first layer inside the jacket. I have only had it one day but I can already tell this jacket is a winner. Oh I am 6'3'' and 250 lbs and I bought an XL which fits me perfectly! (even in the arms)

I like, except you need to wear a long sleeve shirt under the jacket. The silver lining is like plastic. Not breathable and causes skin to sweat and stick to your skin when wearing short sleeve shirts.

One of my favorite go-to jackets. The Omni-Heat incombination to the Omni-Wind makes it great for when things hit 30 degrees Fahrenheit around here with around 30 miles per hour wind while staying a light package. I hate wearing bulky jackets, it does get a little uncomfortable below 20 be just wearing a sweater underneath is enough to keep warm. It's also slimmer fitting then other Columbia jackets which I love.

Great jacket that provides significant amount of warmth. My only complaint is the metallic glittery liner that's a bit too flashy for me. I'm not sure If I would have purchased this product if i knew about the liner. I gave it a four star, but it's more like a 3.5 star for me. because of the liner.

The fit of the jacket is good. I'm 6'1" and 215 lbs. The sleeves seem a bit long, but has a Velcro strap at wrist area.

First watch the item for a bit, Amazon is all over the place with the price on this jacket. I ordered an XL in Abyss for $39.70 and currently it is $62.94. Beyond that, I love the jacket. I was in Chicago recently for work, walking around at night is was under 40 degrees and very windy. This jacket performed very well and kept me warm and I did not feel the wind on my core. I love Columbia products and have a variety of their clothing. This performs well and is probably still a great deal at $60, but was a steal at under $40. Next week I will be taking it to Denver and the expected lows are as low as 18 degrees and I am confident I will be fine with this as my top layer.

The omni-heat radiant barrier is a nice touch but my 8 year old daughter refers to this my "disco-ball jacket" and it is pretty accurate -LOL. The lining is a micro dot pattern of shiny-reflective thermal dots. Again, given my experience in Chicago last week I could careless about the nickname.

The sleeves can bunch a bit if you are wearing layers, it just takes a second to adjust them, and is not a deal-breaker in my opinion.  The jacket runs large, but I like that feature as I am going to be wearing layers often anyway if I need this and I want my top layer to run a bit larger to go over everything. If you are going to run around in this and just a t-shirt, then you will notice the size a bit more.

The only thing I wish was different was the hood. I will never wear it and wish it was just a standard collar like their fleece or other jackets, however again at $40, I really have zero complaints.

I ordered this jacket for myself Off season in July of 2014.  The description said it was wool, I was surprised when it came it looked like a nice, hooded sweater. The fit was great (XXL) kept me warm down to about 20 degrees. It's thin, light weight comes down to about the middle of my butt and seals great here as well as velcro sleves which are a little long.  The inside is reflective and looks like the extremely material they make ladies evening gowns out of - kind of  looks like a mirror (reflective material) I'm sure it helps reflect body heat to keep you warm.  The material doesn't seem to chafe bare skin

Here's the problem after a few months of wearing - it looks awful, it even has a wore out appearance. The outer wool is now COVERED with those little balls of fibers like an old sweater gets.  I see why they offered it at such a great price less than forty bucks.  Now it becomes my yard raking-mowing jacket instead of the great looking Columbia jacket I'd hoped for. Good thing I didn't have to pay full price.

UPDATE:  10 years later ... As I mentioned in my original review, the sleeve liner catches on your clothes, and eventually the seam gave out.  Interestingly, the zipper also failed.  I stopped wearing it a couple of years ago when these things failed, but then as I was going through my closet, I came across this jacket and remembered the warranty.  I thought, "what the hell" and I sent it in.  Much to my astonishment, the jacket came back to me a couple of days ago and somebody had literally restitched the seams that came apart and they had sewn a new zipper into the jacket.  I had to come on here and increase my rating for this jacket, because I am so impressed that the company hires people to fix clothing that has failed - not just send out a new item.  I am still completely flabbergasted that they believe in their clothing so much that they think it is worth hiring somebody to fix it.  Boy do I wish more companies were like this!  I am still not crazy about the design flaws, but it's hard to fault them when they are willing to fix the jacket.  Fair enough - it's been 10 years, but I'll keep wearing this jacket as long as they keep fixing it.  Game on!  GO COLUMBIA!

I like Columbia because of their return policy and the quality of their product.  What I'm not crazy about are the sleeve liners, which move independently of the sleeve and catch on clothes.  It makes putting the jacket on a challenge because you have to try to get all the layers (the shell, the liner, and the long sleeve shirt you are wearing) to behave themselves so that you don't end up with the various layers bunched up and uncomfortable.  It's not a deal breaker, but it seems like a design flaw to me.  Also, the zipper doesn't lay well--it's like there is too much zipper for the material that is attached to it, so it creates unattractive waves in the material.  I know this sounds negative, but I do like the jacket!

product_title: Mountain Hardwear Men s Stratus Range Full Zip

reviews.review_body:
Fit: In dress shirts, I wear a size 15 32/33 shirt. In suits/sport coats I wear a size 38 short. I ordered this in a size small.  Shoulder fit is good, chest fit is a little snug (good for a 2nd layer IMO), stomach area is a bit lose on me, sleeve length is PERFECT (not too long like on so many layering pieces). Collar fit on me is good and would be for a 15.5 neck size too.

Why I ordered: Years ago, I bought a MH Monkey Man 2nd layer "jacket", my first piece with the grid lining - and I fell in love with that piece and it's effectiveness/performance so much, that I bought the same for my son and daughter. I have since found the grid fleece interiors for a 1st or 2nd layer to perform far better than a typical fleece interior - better wicking away while also holding heat (without feeling wet).  What I like better about this piece vs. the Monkey Man: smoother exterior fabric makes for easier layering (putting on and taking off) and also the fact that there is not a hood that is uncomfortable after putting on subsequent layers (I never need a hood on a layering piece - that's what my outer layer or a hat is for - IMO).

I am a layerer, typically wearing 4 layers (base, 2, 3, outer shell). This piece is on the moderate or thinner side as a 2nd layer (this is neither good or bad, just that it is what it is). It will hold/trap heat, but also wick and breath due to the grid pattern (my experience). On super frigid days (ie. <5 degree F), I would opt for one of my heavier 2nd layer pieces (or wear an insulated vs. shell outer layer).

Overall - the fit is very good for my body and preference. I like the look and comfort of the "jacket" and am glad that I purchased it as another option for a 2nd layer piece.

I've owned a fair amount of Mountain Hardware products over the past 15+ years. Sleeping bags & pads, pants, tops, jackets. Overall, I've been exceptionally happy with the quality of their products. But I have heard that more recently, their quality has diminished (becoming more like The North Face - away from performance and more towards fashion). I can see a little bit of this in this piece, the seems on the sleeves are a bit larger than they could be - but of course, going smaller and lighter would add to the cost (if this is of utmost importance to you - look at the Arc'teryx 2nd layer pieces).

Mountain Hardware has excellent after sale customer service. I am in the process of sending in a 10+ year old soft shell winter jacket where the zipper has started to come open in the middle. I contacted them asking what the price would be and was informed the cost would be $30, but that it will likely be covered under warranty. Outside of this zipper issue (which to be honest, I don't think they should fix for free for a 10 year old jacket), the rest of the jacket is in like new condition - exceptionally pleased with it's performance and the other products I've owned from Mountain Hardware.

Sorry this is such a long review for what is really a pretty moderately priced mid layer piece, but for others who want more than just the normal - loved it, hated it, didn't fit, etc. I've tried to provide useful info.

Really liked this jacket. My husband is allergic to polyester. This jacket is 100%cotton. Great choice for him.
Great quality for the price. Lightly insulated with flannel type liner. Would be nice if it had inside pocket. Really appreciate the two zipper external pockets.

Love this jacket. Insulation isn't enough to qualify it for a "winter" jacket, but for mildly cool autumn temps it's perfect. I probably could have gone up a size - but that's my own vanity's problem, not the advertised fit of the jacket itself. More motivation to drop another inch in the waist...
The large fit my shoulders and arms great but it's extremely baggy in the waist. If you have a bit of a gut it would fit great.

This a nice light weight jacket for spring and call yard work. Stylish enough to wear around town. Very comfortable and nice for driving. If I had to list a complaint I would say the lack of an inside pocket and inclined pockets. But it is still anger at value.

The jacket is made from a good weight material.  The use of rivets at the pocket corners and sleeve ends add extra reinforcement.  The double stitching at the seams adds to the functionality of the jacket.  I am looking forward to wearing this jacket a long time.

I live in Minnesota. So, I need a good jacket that works for me from 20 - 40 degrees, usually late Fall and early Spring. This jacket is comfortable and stylish. I marked it down one star because it really needs at least one inside pocket

Great jacket, The outer canvas layer is nice and not stiff like other jackets. I’m 5’10” 165 lbs and the Large fit perfect. This jacket fits and feels great. You can’t beat the cheap price for a well made jacket. The only bad thing is no inside pocket.

Cotton flannel lining, sturdy canvas duck exterior, sturdy zipper, large riveted pockets hold more “stuff” then typical,  collar stands up well, or lays down. It’s a little roomy in the torso (and I am not slender) and no elastic or draw string at the bottom or cuffs. A nice durable old school “field coat” for chores, if not as warm as the pricier nylon, spandex, synthetic filling alternatives.
5 stars.

I really love this jacket...I'm 5'11" and about 220...got the XXL and it's a perfect fit. It's perfect for fall, and there's enough room to layer underneath if I want to when it gets cold...the jacket is very comfortable and looks great. I may go back and order the moss green as well as soon as they have an XXL in stock. Very pleased!

Backpacker Full Zip Canvas Jacket is well made - not a stitch out place, and looks good and solid overall. We had to return it, however, because it did not fit my husband right: the length of the jacket and the sleeves was too short for him. It was also a bit too wide in the mid-section, but just right in the shoulders and back.
If the "tall" version was available for his size, I think it may have fit better.
For reference, he's 6ft2in, 220 lbs and I ordered this jacket in XL as this is the size he wears most often.

This is a really nice jacket.  It says what it is, and it delivers.  Sure there’s no inside pocket but so what?
There are two outside pockets.  If you want a lot of pockets get a different jacket but you will miss out.
I got the Stone color and it is real nice.  The flannel lining is not heavy but it is not supposed to be. It’s a fall jacket not a winter jacket, or early spring when it’s still chilly.  I really like it!

product_title: Port Authority Competitor Jacket

reviews.review_body: Mi hermano quería esto para su cumpleaños y le encantó... Y llegó super rápido el producto
Bottom line is the jacket felt a bit cheap.  It's hard to explain but the jacket just fell short of my expectations.  I sent it back for the Port Authority Challenger.
love the fit, color and the price..best deal around
Nice jacket for the price.

While the jacket looks good on, it was much lighter than I had expected.  The photos make you believe that there's some substance to this jacket; well there's not much.  I think it'd be great about 30 percent cheaper than it sells for.  Thus the lack of stars...
Warmer than I expected it would be. Repels light rain well. Not bad looking.
It’s a nice year round jacket. I like the colors, that the pockets zip and the quality.

product_title: Wildfowler Men s Contoured Fit

reviews.review_body: Bought it for the price. And it was worth the money. Like it a lot. Good deal for sure I feel like I won.

I love the design of the coat only thing is my coat was the white snow wildflower outfitter which is supposed to have fleece in it not mesh! Not happy so now I have to get a fleece coat and hope and pray I make it threw winter with it!! False Advertising!

This is not a parka.  It is a wind breaker at best.  Mine didn’t have fleece it had mesh.  I live in South Dakota and would only use this with layers and as a camo outer.  Calling it a parka is false advertising.
This item is not a parka, its a camo rain coat- kinda disappointed for the cost / vs value
I've been wearing 4xl for years and this is tight in the belly area and sleeves are Abit long. Seems to be sturdy.
Sent it with my husband to deer camp. He loves it!

product_title: Columbia Men s Thermodynamic Softshell

reviews.review_body:
February Snow in Manhattan, NY (25 - 35 deg)
Feb 8, 2011

I wore it for 3 straight days, Feb 3rd to Feb 6th, 2011, in NYC, before returning to NC. I purchased this with the intention of not wearing a heavy coat in Manhattan, NY, which I never did. I wore long underwear, blue jeans, wool socks, t shirt, thin wool sweater, and this jacket, along with scarf and gloves. I did not freeze in 25 to 35 degree weather, but neither was I warm. When the wind blew, I really felt it on my arms. At this point, I shivered and was not warm. Hence, it cannot replace a heavy coat. But without the wind, I managed to stay warm. The style is great! I look professional in very a sporty jacket. The fit is perfect. I am 5'10", 185 lbs with a 33" waist. The reflective technology (inner lining) is suspect.

For the look, fit, and versatility, this is must have jacket.

I use this for:

Rain, light wind, cool weather, not cold weather
I wore this jacket during the winter time, in 30 degree temperature, it felt like it was nothing. Definitely worth the money and really good quality.

this was my first Columbia jacket, and since then I love the brand, I still have it, and the color remain like new.
The inside remains intact after all this years.
Great product.
It's a warm and great waterproof jacket.

Great Buy!  Was impressed with speed of processing and delivery of product.  Item was shipped quickly and very well packaged and arrived in perfect condition!  Warmer jacket than most other heavy/bulky jackets.  Great for staying warm on the slopes and always warm
This coat is awesome so that i can wear that when i ride my motorcyle. It is %100 water resistant.

I was going back East for the holiday and was looking for jacket that was warm and wasn't going to be too bulky to put in my suitcase.
This jacket is perfect I often found myself sweating in 25 degree weather its light weight and keeps me warm what else could one ask for
crb

This jacket is very warm and lightweight. The water resistant feature is highly satisfactory.  The only drawback about the jacket is that it is not always
easy taking it off.  One's arms do not easily slide out of this jacket as in most other jackets.  It can be difficult to take off.

I've only had this jacket for a short time now, but it has really helped me with the winter weather. It's light, portable, yet very warm, and I can't imagine not owning it and making it through the winter.
Got this jacket for Christmas and it's the greatest!  Very light weight but keeps you warm in colder weather while still letting you breath and not overheat.  Form fitting so, be forewarned.

This seems like a well made jacket (I can't vouch for the new "omni-heat" lining - I never wore it outside), but unfortunately I had to return it.  This jacket runs small.  And not just proportionately small, but in an oddball way.  It almost seems like this was patterned for women and just upsized.  I ordered an XL, and the sleeves and hem were the right length, but the shoulders, upper arms, and areas around the armpits are all very very tight.  This is while trying it on with just a t-shirt - not good for a jacket that is marketed for cold weather and as having a new patent pending ultra warm lining - I usually wear something more substantial tha a t-shirt (base layer & fleece or long sleeve shirt) in winter.  That being said, it is attractive, the innovative lining seems like it will work, so I will try and re-order in 2XL, and see if it fits (hopefully the sleeves won't be too long, with the hem below my crotch).  I'll update the review accordingly.

I put it on to get the mail as soon as I got it home.  I wore a t-shirt and a flannel LS shirt under it.  It was 42F outside with very slight air movement.  As soon as I stepped outside into the garage I could feel the cool fabric on my back and arms.  The reflective liner may work but it needs an insulation layer to trap heat and to keep the cool surface of the material off your body.  No extra warmth feeling at all.

I expect if I were hiking or moving more vigorously it would have kept me warmer but then so would any other cheaper jacket.  A really expensive rain coat.

I purchased this jacket after reading the manufacturer's claims about the high performance of their new technology. Boy was I disappointed. The jacket is not any more effective than a good fleece pullover. I don't know where these guys do their so-called testing, but I tested this jacket for a month in Stockholm in the early spring last year and at about +7 degrees Centigrade it was pathetic. I had to use an insulated jacket over it to manage. In fact, there wasn't much difference between wearing the two jackets together and just wearing the insulated jacket by itself! Also, the velcro straps on the cuffs of the sleeves cut into your wrists and catch on other clothes, sometimes damaging them. Very over-rated and over-priced! Just a gimmick!

Unlike many of the other people reviewing this jacket, I found it to fit superbly. I am 6'3", 180 lbs, and I ordered a large. It was a perfectly snug fit that kept me warm during the harsh Colorado winter. It's space-blanket liner does just as advertised, keeps you pretty darn warm even when it's 30 degrees outside and the wind is blowing in your face. The pockets are soft and nice, and I like the breast pocket for keeping my valuables. The charcoal grey was a nice color, and less tan than the picture on Amazon shows. It gets a 4 star rating simply because it was a little stiff. It had nothing to do with the fit, but the material. It didn't want to move very much, and the hand holes were far too big. Maybe I just didn't use it enough, but it did almost feel like I imagine a straightjacket would.

I know that sounds grim but it really is an awesome jacket and if you live somewhere really cold, it's definitely worth trying.

My college-aged son suggested this specific jacket after "window shopping" on line. He had not actually seen this item in person, but liked the features as described. He needed a warm but light-weight jacket. I trusted the Columbia name, but rather than buying it directly from Columbia (the link he provided me), I found it on Amazon (same color, correct size)for much less in cost. He was absolutely thrilled and had an opportunity to try it out right away as he ventured out into the snow on a frigid night to go sledding. He returned singing the praises of this jacket which comfortably kept him warm and dry. He is very slender and the fit is perfect on him. A great, quality jacket; especially when purchased through Amazon for a significantly better price!

I love this jacket!  Its very lightweight, but warm (especially when you consider how thin it is).  The lining looks looks and the jacket fits nice.  Its one of my favorite jackets that I have ever bought.

Its not going to keep you warm in brutal conditions, but for normal use its great.  Its much warmer than it should be.  Its very light, but still warm.  It keeps the wind out, and the waterproofing is awesome.

product_title: Columbia Men s Lush Plush Jacket

reviews.review_body: ok
Can someone please help me. I am so confused. Some colors of this show thumbholes and some do not. Does this jacket have thumbholes?

According to the Columbia, the "lush plush" jacket is only made as a woman's and girls fleece jacket!! MEN'S LUSH PLUSH DOES NOT EXIST. Please take this into account when choosing a size. Check their site for more info
Very flattering, very warm, very comfortable jacket.  I wore this for a ski trip in mid-20s temperatures and it was perfect.
This is a great jacket. My wife loves it. The only complaint that we have is that it gets dirty pretty easily. But you'll have that.
Very warm and cute! Haven't tried to wash it yet, so not sure how well it washes, but so far it's even better than I expected!
I like this jacket very much.  Fits just right and I know I will get a lot of wear out of it. Great price also.
Very warm and well made. I've used it in any really cold temperatures and it always keeps me warm. I might recommend going a
Really good and warm! I use almost everyday here in New York, and, even with the hard wind this jacket can handle the cold really well. I used bellow 0ºC (32F) and it's really good too.
Fit was a little small.  Nice jacket overall.
Fits tight in the arms and shoulders. I have a medium, I'm 5'6 and 135. I wear it mostly everyday, warm.

I will start by saying it's not a bad looking jacket.
It's the function that I question.  The side panels allow some much air to get in that it's almost like, you're only wearing a partial jacket.  The sleeves are also way too long.  I've found that to be the case with a couple columbia items.(I wear a size medium).

I am slender and tall (5'9", sz 2/4) and always have a hard time finding jackets where the sleeves and body are long enough but yet not too wide. This jacket is perfect! The sleeves are even a little extra long which is a nice change for me. On top of the awesome fit, it is much warmer than I expected. I wore it over a short sleeve t-shirt today while sledding with my kids at 25 degrees and was plenty warm enough. Love this jacket!

This jacket is extremely warm but really form fitting...It works great over light weight long sleeve shirts or short sleeve...Don't plan on wearing anything heavier then that!...I got the large and I am 5'5" 142 fit pounds and it just fits!....I really love this but if you have heavier arms, it may be a little snug....
Update:  I am now down to 132 pounds and I would still order the large.  Sleeves are very form fitting but I can now wear a light weight sweater underneath.

I love this jacket in mystery. I get lots of compliments on it. It's so soft! It does run a little small. I ordered a large and it's pretty tight. I would have never thought I needed an X-L. I do like the way it looks a little snug, but it doesn't leave much room underneath. Nothing bulky to be worn underneath for sure.

This claims to be a men's jacket, but when mine arrived I could not put it on because my arms would not fit through the sleeves.  I should emphasize that I am not a body builder.  My hands would not go more than half way down the sleeve and would not come close to fitting through the end.  There is no elastic cuff so there is no give.  I normally wear a medium (small in some items) and the tag claimed this was a medium.

I notice that other reviews are from women.  Maybe this thing is cut for a slender woman who's trying to be stylish even though it says "men's."  I bought it to keep me warm in the outdoors and I really don't care about what some magazine says is stylish.  I would often wear it over some other garment.  This isn't possible when a bare arm won't can't be forced through the sleeve!

It is lined with a strange reflective material that looks like aluminum foil.  The effect is startling but I can't say if it works since I couldn't put the jacket on.  The jacket also has some panels that are just fabric and lack any insulation other than the foil stuff.  It seems that this would not be very warm.  Since I couldn't put the thing on and it's 98 degrees outside right now I can't test that.

Based on other reviews that this item runs small, I decided to order a XL size since I also wear sweaters and such in the winter. Wow am I glad I got the bigger size!! I am a size 6 and generally wear a size small or medium top (depending on the brand) so I am disappointed that Columbia's sizing is so horrible with this. I have a different Columbia fleece that is a small and it fits the same as this XL. Also, I ordered the "plum" color, and it did NOT come as pictured... there were NO thumb holes, but the sleeves were longer (which I guess is ok).

I think this is a great product.  Seams very well insulated and very well made!  I am however a little turned off by how small the men's small is.  I wear a small in women's and thought if I bought a men's small it would give me a little extra room with layers underneath(I tried on a women's small in a store but it was way more expensive).  When I got this jacket and tried it on, it was the same fit as the women's small.  I'm keeping it because I love the jacket and dont want to mess with exchanging and returns.

I love the way this jacket looks!  The main problem is that the thermal reflective lining is NOT comfortable on your skin.  It is slick and it sticks.  I find myself constantly tugging on the sleeves to loosen it so it's not so sticky.  If you wear long sleeves then its great!  Also, about half the pictures of this jacket show different sleeves with thumb holes.  I was extremely disappointed that the jacket does NOT in fact have thumb holes and that the sleeves are different than shown.  I am still debating about returning it for a different jacket.
it fit perfect,  just a  little bit small armhole. it's warm and  beautiful. it meets  all my expectations . .
The jacket was so tight in the shoulders I could barely raise my arms and this was after I sent back the first jacket and went up a size. Like the jacket but the fit was awkward.
My wife loved this Jacket.  Warm and fits here perfect.  Ordered two other jackets until she found this one.  Glad she found this one.

I'm unclear what the first reviews are talking about - - this review is for the Columbia women's jacket pictured above.
I am so in love with this jacket that I'm buying two more; one in a different color and one as a backup!
Columbia is using new technology on the inside of their jackets that uses your own warmth to insulate and warm you.
And it really works!
In addition, I love the plush feel of the outside of the jacket. Most plush jackets are shapeless, you sacrifice style for comfort, but this jacket has both.
The stitching and the seams are flawless. It has great shoulders and looks amazing from behind.
It runs a little small. I'm 5 foot eight and a size 6, and I wear the large so that I can layer other clothing under it.
For cold women who want to gorgeous jacket - - you can't go wrong with this one!

I gave this product five stars because I love it so much! The exterior is sooo soft. The inside is cool, I haven't worn it outside long enough to determine if the "omni-heat thermo tech" stuff is any good, but I like to layer any way. I purchased it in a large because I read all the reviews and everyone said they run small. I checked this jacket out on so many websites and some listed the model's height & weight and all said the model was wearing a large. I put this jacket on and I look like a turtle. I am a 5'3" Asian girl 125lbs. A lot of people said they usually wear a size small too and purchasing a large was a good fit. I like that it has the hem drawstrings to tighten at the waist, but it didn't tighten all that much. Maybe because I purchased it so big. Overall I love this jacket. I ordered a medium to see how the fit is. Very happy with it :)
This jacket runs very small. It is also not as warm as advertised. Its a pretty color, and usable on a forty degree day  under a vest.
Very nice, warm, comfortable, snug fit (if you wear size small order the medium).  Great jacket for the price. Good quality and great value for the money.  Arrived quickly, as described.

product_title: 100 Polyester
product_description: Gloves Eyewear Ear Protection Masks Clothing Country of manufacture China Manufacturer Occunomix Package Dimensions 30 31 L x 17 32 W x 1 18 H

reviews.review_body: very warm and protective.

product_title: HAZARD 4 Action Agent TM Softshell Urban Jacket R

reviews.review_body: The perfect jacket for me.

The item is very nice and has what I found so far 9 pockets.  I am about 5' 7" and 140 lbs. and I got a large (cheaper price) sent it back and got a small.  The small fits me just fine and if anything just a tad big.  It has snaps to give an extra inch or so of expansion.  The quality feels and looks great I would recommend

Man, I wish this jacket fit better!
It's a very nice coat, and I'm a pretty standard large but this coat fit like an extra large on me.

I’m a Scouting volunteer and find it very practical to have velcro loops on clothes and gear. There’s always another patch for another purpose, and I have lots of different volunteer jobs. The velcro shoulders let me customize the jacket for different events without needle and thread.

The vast number of pockets make it really practical for carrying thingamajigs and widgets.

As others have noted, the fit is weird. I tried both a Medium and Large; kept the Large. Though it’s still a little tight across the chest, the sleeves are too long.
Very good product

Great jacket,
I only wish you could zip a liner in

Great, professional looking jacket. However, whoever was put in charge of sizing during development needs to take a serious look at the length of the sleeves. I ordered a size down to see if that would resolve the abnormal length. About 2-3 inches need to be removed from the sleeves. Glad I only bought this jacket when it was marked down to $40. Now I'll have to spend some money to have the sleeves hemmed up.

Bought Hazard4 products in the past, never been disappointed.
Got this jacket the other day (Hazard4 is based in CA. Watched order go from KY, to all over CA before me.)
So, there are a ton of pockets on this jacket. 11 total. Hidden ones on the sleeves, chest pockets, inside pockets. The bicep patch is huge, lotsa room for patches and hangie uppies.  O/A appearance the jacket doesn't present as a "tactical or tacticool" jacket.  I bought the coyote one (size medium was $64 at time of order). Only concern/complaint/question..was the jacket arrived with all it's zippers parked in the center. If I went one way the zipper was off track and didn't open like it should. So I had 10 others to play with.
Be aware, it fits bigger than sized (i.e. small fits like medium, etc.)
Absolutely love this jacket. Order a size down from what you usually wear. Fits great, so many pockets. I’ve gotten tons of compliments on this jacket. Ended up buying 5.

product_title: Columbia Sportswear Men s Smooth Pursuit Softshell Jacket

reviews.review_body: Very classy

Buy it L size (im abouth 1,75mt and 82Kg).. Fit a little baggy on the chest/back but not that much.. Maybe an M size will fit to somebody with my measures, a little thighter...wrist cuf help a lot... Will purchase it again... Dark Moss is a nice color, very similar to black.
very nice
Excelent ítem and good price

Very good jacket exact size, good quality and excellent line.

It feels very comfortable ..
This is a great jacket for our Portland weather.  It is nice to be able to order at a good price from Amazon.
It is a great coat, great fit and looks even better. Im a big guy with long arms so sleeves are always an issue, but this fit great!
I get a lot of compliments on the jacket but I don't really care because it's just comfy. It was the only coat I needed this winter...but I do live in Florida.
A bit warmer than expected, everything else was just as described

I lost my north face apex jacket and needed a quick replacement for the crazy weather in Pittsburgh. This jacket proved to be better than my north face ever was. This jacket has a slim fit, but roomy enough for sweatshirts, and is perfect for the rain, always keeps me dry. I wear this to work at my office job everyday, looks very nice and performs perfectly.
Columbia - you always expect high quality, this item is not as expected.

A wonderful jacket. It's a good snug fit and yet relaxed enough to allow great freedom of movement. Wearing it during a Chicago winter showed me this jacket delivered on many amazing fronts: water and stain resistant. It does indeed contain body heat to help keep you warm during physical activities (shoveling, plowing, etc.) This is an awesome jacket.
My husband loved this jacket! The material is comfortable, the sizing is as-described on the website, and the price was a total bargain! It was a great buy for the in-between jacket season.

Update 8/25/2014
Dropped 2 stars.  The jacket is no longer shedding rain that well.  Columbia has offered to replace it as they have lifetime warranties on their products so this is why I'm giving 3 stars, or I'd be giving it 2 stars.  I just haven't sent it in.  The other solution is to reapply waterproofing to it, but I shouldn't have had to do that within a single season of purchasing it.  I'm probably going to have them replace it, but I need to cover shipping so I haven't decided yet.

Original Review 4/5/2014:
I was looking for a jacket that was light but able to shed Seattle Spring rain and winds, looks casual and stylish without looking too sporty or like a shell. I wanted a go-to jacket for everyday wear to take to restaurants, walk the town or to wear to church.  I wanted a jacket that wasn't too warm, but not too light that it offered no protection to the elements.  It took me a while to finally settle on this jacket simply because I was looking for one with a hood.  I finally saw this on sale for an amazing price and couldn't pass it up and I'm glad I didn't.  It is perfect for what I was looking for.

I don't wear the collar up like in the photo, I wear it down and my daughter says it looks great that way.
The Omni-Heat only covers the inside back and arms so you don't see the shiny silver if you wear the jacket unzipped which is great.
There's enough room to wear a long sleeved shirt without the arms feeling too tight, I'm able to move around in the jacket without feeling restricted.

I purchased the Buffalo colored version and when I received the jacket I thought they sent me the wrong color.  Under my house lights, I could have swore it was a dark forest green so I thought I was sent the "Moss" colored jacket.  I thought it looked fine, but I was wanting the brown as pictured.  I then showed my wife and she said she wasn't sure what color it was, kinda looked gray, or dark green, or maybe even brown... then I took the jacket outside in the daylight and it was definitely dark brown.  Totally weird, but kinda cool.  Still not sure it was the Buffalo, I went to the Columbia website and lo and behold the color there for Buffalo was darker than what is portrayed on Amazon, but it does kinda look like that color in the sunlight. So just beware.

The zippered outside hand pockets are very spacious and I love how they zip up, so you can keep things secure without fear of stuff falling out, though I doubt they would even unzipped as the pockets are deep.
The button breast pockets are also great and useful, but much smaller than the hand pockets.  Good for ticket stubs, parking passes, etc.
The only thing I miss is an inside pocket, it doesn't have one.  So the breast pockets get more use than they otherwise would.

I bought it on sale in an excellent price. It's great quality, size L is perfect (little fitted but not too tight, I'm 1,78 m, 85 Kg). Dark moss color is great (dark grey similar to black).
It seems to be warm but not as warm as expected, haven't wear it yet in very cold weather or in rainy days. Omni-heat is not in all the inside of the jacket, just in your back. Could be used formal, semi formal or informal which is an advantage.

this jacket is not only a great fit it is also a perfect jacket to wear with or without an under garment.The fact that it is windproof,water and stain resistant makes it a keeper,but having the omni- heat lining inside the jacket makes this jacket a must have.The look of this jacket is even better when you see it and try it on in person,have recieved many compliments and been asked what kind of jacket it is my only problem is that they didnt have the dark moss colored jacket in my size as i would have purchased that one to.That being said the Abyss colored jacket that was in my size is an awesome color and i wouldnt give it up for anything,cool jacket..........

product_title: Helly Hansen Men s Mono Material Hooded Insulator

reviews.review_body: Love the fit and material, but the zipper does not have any fabric to cover it when it is zipped all the way up. Therefore the zipper chafes at the neck.

Great Form Fitting Helly Hansen product. I wear a small in most things and this one is a little smaller than the other articles of clothing but the Medium was a little big for my taste. If you want it to fit nice and snug order your regular size. For a little looser fit go a size up. I'm 5'10 148 Lbs if that helps make your decision easier. I ended up keeping the small but just know this runs just a tiny bit smaller than usual HH.
High quality! And very nice!

Having worn this Helly Hansen hoodie for about 7 months now, I've found it to be incredibly warm, of high quality build, and aesthetically sharp looking. It's has the right amount of length, the accents add a nice pop of color, and the tall collar does a remarkable job at keeping my neck warm and protected from the elements. It works well in inclement weather or to pull on over a dress shirt in an office or coffee shop that's air conditioned like the arctic. This has been such a welcome addition to my wardrobe that I just ordered a second in a different color. NOTE: I'm 6' tall, a trim 188 lbs and typically order a MED in garments such as this however I found the LARGE Helly Hansen fits wonderfully.

product_title: Nexgen Heat Men s Standard Mpm111762set Grey Zipper Soft Shell Jacket

reviews.review_body: I could go on for days . This is NOT what we expected the battery is junk. Does not stay charged.
item is a 5 x byt fits as a 2 x.  seller wants to charge me return shipping and 10% restock fee and will not answer my messages through amazon.

product_title: Columbia Sportswear Men s Horizons Pine Interchange Tall Jacket

reviews.review_body: I bought this coat for dog walking and it has serviced me well. Rain rolls right off and keeps the cold out.
I highly recommend this coat and the Columbia products. This is the best coat I have had before. The coat fits as expected and the purchase experience was easy.

I bought this for a cruise from Canada to fort Lauderdale in the end of October and so was looking for a coat to keep the wet and wind out. I could not have been more satisfied. Started the trip with the liner in place and used it all the way to Norfolk where it finally started warming up

Feels very lightweight compared to most of the winter jackets I've owned and keeps me warm most of the time. When it gets below zero or there are strong winds on a cold day you can definitely feel it. Wearing long sleeves and an extra layer helps on those days. I certainly wouldn't recommend getting into a shirtless snowball fight or making snow angels in a bikini like in the Omni-Heat commercials because it won't warm you up that fast unless it's almost Spring. Also the Boulder is slightly darker than in the picture but not by very much. I'm glad I bought this jacket.

product_title: Columbia Men s Tipton Peak Insulated Omni Heat Waterproof Hooded Jacket

reviews.review_body: The sleeves are always extra big every time I ordered costs and jackets luckily I have adjustable straps on the sleeves but the coat fits nicely waterproof and good insulated feature silver lining inside the coat good for fall season and some days in winter

Superlightwieght but ohh so warm.
Wasn't initially a fan of the hood but came to love it, especially useful in Chicago. No need for a long sleeve shirt under this jacket !

product_title: Under Armour Men s coldgearÂ Reactor Hybrid ½ Zip

reviews.review_body:
I just about have every color offered now except white. These are by question one of UA best cold gear products out there.  Warm and they give with your movements.
I just got the white on 1/20. They are great
No pretty!
great cold weather wear
Very comfortable and warm. Would like to have zippers.
Bought for my son for Christmas, and he loves it
Beautiful.  Sleeves lighter than body which my husband said is great for the swing!  He loved it!
Great item for winter wear under a outdoor parka, keeps you warm and dry!
I've got 3 in different colors.  Love them
Very nice product.
really like the fit of this product, feels really good on and off the course

This reactor shirt is quilted and three times thicker than the Cold Gear Infrared equivalents. I have not put it to the test yet but I am betting the Reactor is the warmest shirt in the Under Armor line.
Only the bad thing is the black current color zip I bought is price down after one day I bought. The bass blue is ok. Two zip are great and fit my size.

I don't understand why the price on the tag and the price I payed are not the same.
 The looks and the touch of this item are very satisfactory. TNX.
Extremely warm, comfortable and easy to golf in. Add a great layer of warmth without being bulky.
Like the feel of fabric and fit as expected. Worn as casual attire
This shirt is very light, yet warm and allows full movement for golf. I saw Jordan wearing it at the Open and ordered it right away.
purchased as a Christmas gift for my son, he said it is warm and fits good

I have an upcoming golf trip and needed an extra pullover for the cool days and this thing is awesome. I love the styling and the color (white) and especially the feel of the material and overall weight and the LOOK! Can't wait to wear this on my golf trip.
This is the perfect cold weather top. Perfect for golf or work, please bring it back in more colors in the large tall size!

Great fit, makes you look more tapered.
Looks great.
Comfortable to wear over golf shirt mid 50s temp.
Warm and comfortable. I did order a size larger than normal because I planned to wear a shirt under it. Worked out great. Doesn’t hinder your swing. Looks great.

product_title: Clique Men s Crystal Mountain Jacket

reviews.review_body: not warm enough but great fit
The product’s stitching was already detaching on multiple points on the jacked with the stuffing beginning to come out through the stitching on multiple points.
I normally wear a 3XL and this jacket in 3XL is way small!
